180-cup-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank 180 Cup Update

We have sad news to share in our 180 Cup update. Research revealed that Solomon and Daymond parted ways three years after Solomon’s appearance on Shark Tank, due to disagreements on company decisions. The party was over and the company was out of business by early 2016. This will be our final 180 Cup update.
180-cup-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: 180 Cup Update | S5

2400-expert-sat-prep-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank 2400 Expert Update

Research for our 2400 Expert update revealed good news! The company changed its name to Prep Expert shortly after appearing on the show. Mark and Shaan’s partnership has extended to a book for young entrepreneurs, too.

Prep Expert expanded its business model to grow with the demanding college market, and the company now has $5 million in annual revenue. This was an extremely smart investment for Mark!

To access 2400 Expert's line of courses and tutoring sessions, you can sign up at the official website.
2400-expert-sat-prep-update-shark-tank-s.title: 2400 Expert Update | S7

50-state-capitals-in-50-minutes-update-s.body:
Shark Tank 50 State Capitals in 50 Minutes Update

Our research on the 50 State Capitals in 50 Minutes update revealed that the company struggled to gain traction after its Shark Tank appearance.

Moreover, the company primarily sold the product on Amazon due to the lack of a website and social media presence.

While Ken put effort into designing the cards and selecting educational keywords, the market response was underwhelming.

In fact, the game received mixed reviews on Amazon; some customers appreciated its educational value, while others dismissed it as a poor concept.

At the time of writing our 50 State Capitals in 50 Minutes update, we found that the game can still be found on Amazon and several affiliate websites. However, at the time of writing, the game is currently unavailable.

However, it has minimal visibility and sales, marking its decline as a viable business venture.

It looks like the game is just a side hustle for Ken, but if anything changes, we will be back for another 50 State Capitals in 50 Minutes update.
50-state-capitals-in-50-minutes-update-s.title: 50 State Capitals in 50 Minutes Update | S1

a-perfect-pear-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank A Perfect Pear Update

Our research on A Perfect Pear update revealed that the deal with Robert and Kevin never closed for undisclosed reasons.

However, the business experienced significant growth shortly after airing, as Susan was making over $80,000 a month at the time.

Despite the deal falling through, our A Perfect Pear update found that Kevin Harrington helped Susan get her product on the Home Shopping Network.

As a result, retailers like Whole Foods and Lunardi's carried A Perfect Pear products, which were also available on Susan's website.

With the growth from appearing on Shark Tank, Susan Knapp continued growing her business. Her products remained available in various retail outlets and through her website.

However, after a short-term boost, Susan ultimately closed the business in February 2010.

This looks to be our final A Perfect Pear update.
a-perfect-pear-update-shark-tank-season-.title: A Perfect Pear Update | S1

abs-protein-pancakes-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank ABS Pancakes Update

Our ABS Pancakes update research revealed that the company is still in business! The deal with Daymond didn’t close, but that didn’t stop Josh and Ashley.

A huge bump in sales after the episode aired got them off to a great start, and now they have annual revenue of just over $1.5 million. Their product is available on the ABS Pancakes website and also on Amazon.
abs-protein-pancakes-update-shark-tank-s.title: ABS Pancakes Update | S7

acton-skates-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Acton Update

Though Acton walked away without a deal, our Acton update research revealed great news for the company. In the years since airing on the show, Acton has rebranded as Acton Global.

They no longer sell electric skates, and now focus on providing electric scooters and bikes to college campuses. Their electric skateboard is a huge hit, too. Reported annual revenue as of 2021 was $6 million.

You can find Acton’s other products (though they no longer sell the Rocket Skates) on the Acton Global website.
acton-skates-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Acton Skates Update | S7

addisons-wonderland-bedroom-decor-update.body:
Shark Tank Addison's Wonderland Update

Research for our Addison's Wonderland update revealed that in 2014, the company ceased to sell products for a time, while the website remained active as an interior design blog written by Brittany. By 2019, she was working for HGTV DreamHome, and her work would be featured in HGTV Magazine, Better Homes & Gardens, and by several other well known publications. In 2019, she opened Addison's Wonderland in Monroe, Georgia, and as of December 2022, estimated annual revenue is $1 million.
addisons-wonderland-bedroom-decor-update.title: Addison's Wonderland Update | S4

afresheet-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank AfreSHeet Update

After the episode aired, Maxwell sold out of all of his limited inventory. Unfortunately, the sheets never became available again. Our research revealed that the company went out of business shortly after the episode aired.

This will be our final AfreSHeet update.
afresheet-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: AfreSHeet Update | S7

airbedz-air-mattress-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank AirBedz Update

We have good news to share in our AirBedz update. The company is still in business, although Jim has since expanded his company into the larger brand, Pittman Outdoors.

Jim eventually ran into some patent issues, however, those have all been resolved now.

Products are available on Amazon as well as the Pittman Outdoors website. On both retailers, you will find a range of air mattress, along with truck bed and roof top tents, coolers, drinkware, awnings and more!
airbedz-air-mattress-update-shark-tank-s.title: AirBedz Update | S3

alaska-glacial-mud-co-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Alaska Glacial Mud Co. Update

We have great news to share in our Alaska Glacial Mud Company update! Since appearing on Shark Tank, Lauren went on to expand her product line and rebranded the company to Alaska Glacial Essentials. Her products are available through the Alaska Glacial Essentials website, and through Amazon. Annual revenue is estimated between $3.5 million and $5 million.
alaska-glacial-mud-co-update-shark-tank-.title: Alaska Glacial Mud Co. Update | S5

aldo-orta-jewelry-shark-tank-season-2.body:
Shark Tank Aldo Orta Jewelry Update

Our Aldo Orta Jewelry update reveals that the two-shark deal never closed. Despite this, the business continues to operate.

It appears that Aldo Orta Jewelry was available through QVC for a time, which has been reported to have significantly increased sales for a time.

However, at the time of this writing, it appears to longer be available through the QVC website.

While there is no clear data on yearly revenue for this company, their website is still up and running, so we assume that sales are still coming in. You can find several of Aldo's pieces, being offered on the Aldo Orta Jewelry website.

It also looks as though he may have pieces available at The Leigh Gallery, in Chicago.
aldo-orta-jewelry-shark-tank-season-2.title: Aldo Orta Jewelry Update | S2

alices-table-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Alice's Table Update

Our Alice's Table update research found that the deal with Sarah and Mark was successfully closed.

Since airing on Shark Tank, the company has thrived, growing to $6 million in lifetime sales. They have also onboarded over 70 new hosts, who have fully booked schedules.

In Season 10, we got an official Alice's Table update segment where she revealed a major partnership with 1-800-Flowers.

The company continued to flourish and Mark Cuban called it one of the best pitches on the show.

However, the COVID-19 pandemic forced a significant pivot. Alice successfully transitioned the business to online workshops, maintaining their services remotely.

In January 2022, 1-800-Flowers acquired Alice's Table for an undisclosed amount, with Alice remaining as president.

At the time of our Alice's Table update, the company continues to operate under the 1-800-Flowers brand, offering online workshops on flower arranging, gourmet food platters, and pasta making.

We will keep you posted with any additional Alice's Table updates.
alices-table-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Alice's Table Update | S9

alpha-m-consulting-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Alpha M Update

Our Alpha M update is a mixed bag. On the one hand, the DVDs seemed not to sell at the original price point, and would eventually become an available digital download for a discounted $197 instead of the $297 original.

For founder Aaron Marino, he continued operating Alpha M. with great success, consulting with regular clients and celebrities as well. His estimated annual revenue for Alpha M is $634,000 and it seems he is still growing the brand since appearing on Shark Tank.
alpha-m-consulting-update-season-4.title: Alpha M Update | S4

amber-update-shark-tank-season-6-2.body:
Shark Tank Amber Update

After a lengthy struggle, Amber ultimately went out of business in 2015. Bill and Kyle have moved onto new projects but have used their experience at Amber to help them with their current jobs.

So, this will be our final Amber update.
amber-update-shark-tank-season-6-2.title: Amber Phone Charging Station Update | S6

angellift-wrinkle-reducer-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank AngelLift Update

Let’s get straight to the AngelLift update! This was an investment that never materialized, as Aaron refused to appear on QVC when the cameras stopped rolling. Despite this, the company has an estimated annual revenue of around $4 million. If you're interested in giving their products a try, you can get them on the AngelLift website.
angellift-wrinkle-reducer-update-shark-t.title: AngelLift Update | S5

angels-and-tomboys-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Angels and Tomboys Update

Angels and Tomboys captured national attention shortly after their episode aired in October 2016, leading to a significant surge in sales.

Our Angels and Tomboys update found that the deal with Mark Cuban and Daymond John successfully closed. The sharks provided strategic advice, helping the company grow and reach a wider audience.

By spring 2018, Angels and Tomboys took a major step forward by opening their first brick-and-mortar store in Memphis, Tennessee.

However, by the summer of 2018, the company hit a rough patch. Their online presence began to fade, with the website declining and social media activity dwindling.

Despite these challenges, the Memphis store remained open through early 2019.

Even as late as mid-2021, while the store continued to operate, the online store still had no products available.

As time went on, the company's struggles became more apparent. By early 2023, the Memphis store had closed, and the online store continued to list products as "sold out."

However, in a surprising turn of events, our Angels and Tomboys update found that the company made a comeback in October 2023 with a freshly redesigned website and a new focus on plant-based skincare products.

They officially launched this updated collection at a beauty networking event in Memphis on November 1, 2023.

In addition, they established Girlhood Academy, a nonprofit organization that promotes self-esteem and combats bullying among young girls.

At the time of writing, Angels and Tomboys continues to evolve, with exciting plans to introduce new products, including a body wash, a 2-in-1 shampoo and conditioner, and a facial cleanser system.

If we get another Angels and Tomboys update we will be sure to let you know.
angels-and-tomboys-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Angels and Tomboys Update | S8

aqua-vault-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Aqua Vault Update

Research for our Aqua Vault update revealed some good news! Daymond finalized his offer with the company and helped boost sales rapidly in the years that followed. The company spent some time developing a second product as the estimated annual revenues of the Aqua Vault brand boosted to about $3 million per year. Products are available on the Aqua Vault website.
aqua-vault-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Aqua Vault Update | S6

arkeg-arcade-keg-cabinet-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank ARKEG Update

Unfortunately, by May 2015, Dan and Brant were looking to unload the company in its entirety, and eventually sold it off for $11,500. While Dan and Brant are out of the picture now, ARKEG can be purchased on the Uncrate website. It’s unclear if the product has been profitable for its new parent company or if it remains, for the most part, unsuccessful. Either way, this will be our final ARKEG update.
arkeg-arcade-keg-cabinet-update-season-4.title: ARKEG Update | S4

ash-and-anvil-clothing-update-shark-tank.body:
Shark Tank Ash and Anvil Update

Sadly, during our Ash and Anvil update research, we found that the deal with Mark never closed.

However, undeterred, the duo are still in business but under a new name: Ash & Erie. The name change arose from trademark concerns with a larger company.

Eric and Steven showed their resourcefulness as they secured funding independently.

Our Ash and Anvil update reveals the business reached $1 million in sales by May 2018, just seven months after their appearance on Shark Tank.

A year later, their venture funding round brought in an additional $1.2 million. In total, they've raised over $5 million since the show.

As of December 2021, their annual revenue sits at over $1 million. Building on this success, their website updates from August 2022 showcase the introduction of new clothing lines, including premium polos, summer shorts, and rain jackets.

This expansion strategy paid off because their annual revenue has grown to over $2 million!

With a new brand and product line, things are looking positive for our next Ash and Anvil update.
ash-and-anvil-clothing-update-shark-tank.title: Ash and Anvil Update | S9

atlantic-candy-company-update-shark-tank.body:
Shark Tank Atlantic Candy Company Update

Our Atlantic Candy Company update found that after their Shark Tank appearance, the company encountered some tough challenges.

This included a $2 million lawsuit from an Australian candy company.

Although the lawsuit dragged on until December 2017, it didn't hold them back. They bounced back by redesigning their main product, ToyBox.

At the time of writing, ToyBox is available at major retailers such as Walmart, Target, and Dollar General and has grown to around $4 million in annual revenue.

Additionally, our Atlantic Candy Company update found that they have partnered with well-known brands like Disney, Nestle, and Hershey's through their contract manufacturing services.

It looks like Jared is back on the right track. If we get another Atlantic Candy Company update, we will let you know.
atlantic-candy-company-update-shark-tank.title: Atlantic Candy Company Update | S8

ava-the-elephant-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Ava the Elephant Update

Our Ava the Elephant update research found that the deal with Barbara Corcoran was successfully closed.

After securing a patent in July 2010, Tiffany transitioned from a clay prototype to a professionally manufactured model, eventually selling 100,000 units and generating $1 million in revenue by 2013.

During that time, she also created a second product called Thermometer Stickers. However, it didn't take off like Ava the Elephant.

In 2018, Tiffany signed a licensing deal with Baby Delight. By 2021, Better Family, Inc. acquired Ava the Elephant and made it available in over 10,000 stores.

Despite initial success, unforeseen expenses and challenges in the medical industry led Barbara to invest an additional $235,000 over time.

Eventually, manufacturing was transitioned to licensing.

Tiffany also faced personal challenges, including a battle with cancer, but continued to mentor new inventors and entrepreneurs.

At the time of writing our Ava the Elephant update, the medicine dispenser remains a popular product, with singing and talking models available online.

While Tiffany stepped back from the business, her innovation continues to benefit children and caregivers.

We're calling this Ava the Elephant update a success.
ava-the-elephant-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Ava The Elephant Update | S1

avocaderia-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Avocaderia Update

The deal with Mark Cuban and Barbara Corcoran never materialized.

Despite the deal falling through, Alessandro persevered. In May 2018, approximately three months following the episode's original airing, Alessandro successfully opened a second Avocaderia location.

Our Avocaderia update research found that the company experienced a temporary setback in 2019 when one location faced a brief closure due to a sewage leak addressed by the health department.

Despite this challenge, their combined sales across the remaining locations surpassed $1 million that year. However, the emergence of COVID-19 in 2020 necessitated a shift in their initial growth strategy.

During the strict lockdown measures in New York City, Alessandro's restaurant was fortunate to participate in Operation Feed Brooklyn, a program that provided food to the homeless.

This initiative provided funding for Brooklyn restaurants to prepare meals for healthcare workers on the frontlines of the pandemic.

As a result, Alessandro was able to reopen his establishment and contribute to the community effort briefly.

Following a successful reopening in June 2021, after New York City restaurants resumed full operations in May, Avocaderia was able to move forward with its expansion plans. This included the addition of a third location shortly after restrictions were lifted.

By February 2022, the company achieved a significant milestone, reaching $3 million in annual revenue. Their continued success led to further expansion, with a fourth location opening in New York City by February 2023.

Most recently, in April 2024, Avocaderia added a fifth store, solidifying its presence in the city.

The company's current performance is impressive, with each location averaging over $1 million in annual revenue.

With the company's prospects looking good, we are confident that our next Avocaderia update will be a success!
avocaderia-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Avocaderia Update | S9

baby-loves-disco-dance-parties-update-se.body:
Shark Tank Baby Loves Disco Update

As it would turn out, the sharks hit the nail on the head. Baby Loves Disco continued its trajectory in the short term, but by 2017 they were out of business. Today, Heather is the Director of Auxiliary and Special Programs at Philadelphia’s Springside Chestnut Hill Academy, while Andy is the co-founder of Focus Bryn Mawr. This will be our final Baby Loves Disco update.
baby-loves-disco-dance-parties-update-se.title: Baby Loves Disco Update | S4

babys-badass-burgers-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Baby's Badass Burgers Update

We have great news to share in our Baby's Badass Burgers update. Success would come eventually, as they, over time, accumulated six trucks spanning across Los Angeles, San Bernardino, Ventura, San Diego, Orange County, and Houston. It is unclear their annual revenue, but it is estimated in the millions and Baby's Badass Burgers remain doing business as of 2023.
babys-badass-burgers-update-season-4.title: Baby's Badass Burgers Update | S4

back-9-dips-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Back 9 Dips Update

After the episode aired, the Back 9 Dips expanded to over 1,400 stores nationwide. However, in 2013, disaster struck.

In our Back 9 Dips update research, we found that the USDA identified anchovies in the dip and categorized it as “an undeclared allergen,” forcing a recall that ultimately led to the company closing in 2014.

At the time of writing, Nique Mealey is a sales and marketing specialist for Gigpro, while David returned to his former career in golf and is the Head Technician at the Heron Creek Golf and Country Club.

This will be our final Back 9 Dips update.
back-9-dips-update-season-4.title: Back 9 Dips Update | S4

bagbowl-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank BagBowl Update

Immediately following the deal, BagBowl was out of stock for two months due to production difficulties. Once it did hit the market, sales were tepid, so they released an additional product, the Daddio Spill Stopper Training Cup.

Sadly, during our BagBowl update research we found that the company went out of business in 2018.

At the time of writing, Brian Fleming has moved on to a career in real estate, while Kevin Fleming works in cloud computing. This will be our final BagBowl update.
bagbowl-update-season-4.title: BagBowl Update | S4

bakers-edge-brownie-pan-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Baker’s Edge Update

We have good news to share in our Baker's Edge update! If you’re an avid baker or cook, you’ll probably be glad to know it is still in business. The company went on to be acquired for an undisclosed amount by Sorfeo in 2022. Their expanded line of products is available on Amazon, and on the Baker's Edge website.
bakers-edge-brownie-pan-update-shark-tan.title: Baker's Edge Update | S5

balloon-distractions-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Balloon Distractions Update

We have bad news to share. Unfortunately Ben's appearance on Shark Tank seemed to anger the clown community more. The Tampa Bay Times profiled the rift between Ben and the clowns he had upset. The business eventually shut down, so this will be our final Balloon Distractions update.
balloon-distractions-update-shark-tank-s.title: Balloon Distractions Update | S5

balm-chicky-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Balm Chicky Balm Balm Update

Our Balm Chicky Balm Balm update may not be super surprising to anyone who saw the company receive negative feedback on Shark Tank. Unfortunately the company is no longer around and it seems like they ultimately ran out of money in the years after appearing on Shark Tank. This will be our final Balm Chicky Balm Balm update.
balm-chicky-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Balm Chicky Balm Balm Update | S6

bambooee-kitchen-towels-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Bambooee Update

We have great news to report in our Bambooee update! The company is still in business in 2023, with an estimated annual revenue of around $5 million. The expanded product line is readily available for purchase on the Bambooee website, Amazon, and on Walmart online. According to the company’s website, they have planted over 250,000 trees so far, and hope to plant at least 1 million in total.
bambooee-kitchen-towels-update-shark-tan.title: Bambooee Update | S5

bantam-bagels-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Bantam Bagels Update

While the sharks wouldn’t realize it at the time of filming, this company would be one of the most iconic and successful companies to ever appear on Shark Tank. Research for our Bantam Bagel update revealed that Bantam Bagels went on to have their products featured in Starbucks, Delta Airlines and various grocers. In addition, the company was apparently acquired for more than $30 million back in 2018, but Elyse continues to run the business even in 2022. While the company website appears to be down in 2023, their products seem to still be available in stores.
bantam-bagels-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Bantam Bagels Update | S6

bareease-numbing-kit-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank BareEASE Update

We have sad news to share in our BareEase update. While the kids sold for a while, the company seems to have gone out of business some time in 2014. Dr. Edna is still a busy physician, and in the years since appearing on Shark Tank, she has gone on to write several bilingual children’s books inspired by her son. This will be our final BareEASE update.
bareease-numbing-kit-update-shark-tank-s.title: BareEASE Update | S5

barkems-to-go-dog-meals-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Bark’em’s To Go Update

Our Bark’em’s To Go update shows that Blake never did make it into the pet business, despite his innovative idea. He did make another attempt with a fundraising campaign, however, it never came to fruition.

Since his appearance on the show, Blake has moved on to other, more successful projects. This will be our final Bark'em's To Go update.
barkems-to-go-dog-meals-shark-tank-seaso.title: Bark'em's To Go Update | S3

basepaws-update-shark-tank-season-10.body:
Shark Tank Basepaws Update

The company has continued to partially update its DNA testing kits and has even come out with varied testing for cats. After Shark Tank, Basepaws is still operating and continues to generate more than $1 million per year in revenue. The company’s official website is also updated regularly with information relating to its testing kits and products.

During Shark Tank Season 14 Episode 8, a Basepaws update shared that the company grew from $200,000 to $3.5 million in revenue. In 2022, Basepaws was acquired by Zoeits for over $50 million!
basepaws-update-shark-tank-season-10.title: Basepaws Cat DNA Testing Update | S10

basic-outfitters-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Basic Outfitters Update

Our Basic Outfitters update found that the company's revenue skyrocketed by 1000%, reaching $5 million in sales shortly after the episode aired.

They also expanded their reach, starting to ship to Canada and even considering a "Create-a-Drawer" service for women.

In 2018, the couple was recognized on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list.

They also secured a partnership with JetBlue, with their products featured in the airline's Mint amenity kits.

In addition, they set up pop-up shops and grew their Amazon presence, further boosting the brand's visibility.

However, our Basic Outfitters update research found that Michael and Lauren left the company in June 2019, although the details of the transition remain unclear.

In early 2020, the company's social media accounts went quiet, with the last post in January.

Their website stopped selling products, and items on Amazon were marked as "currently unavailable," suggesting the business had shut down.

While a website redesign in September 2022 hinted at a possible comeback, at the time of writing, the company remains inactive with no significant updates.

If we get another Basic Outfitters update, we will let you know.
basic-outfitters-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Basic Outfitters Update | Shark Tank S8

beard-head-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Beard Head Update

Despite not securing a deal on the show, we’ve got great news for our Beard Head update. This company went on to be wildly successful. David’s appearance on Shark Tank took the company to the next level. In 2022 sales were just under $4 million, making this novelty company a huge success.

You can find the huge collection of available Beard Heads on Amazon and also on the Beard Head website, including those shown on the show and more.
beard-head-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Beard Head Update | S7

beard-king-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Beard King Update

Research for our Beard King update revealed that the deal with Lori never closed, and the business was purchased in 2019.

The Beard King Bib is available online at Walmart. In 2022, annual revenue is estimated to be around $1 million.
beard-king-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Beard King Update | S7

beardbrand-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Beardbrand Update

Research for our Beardbrand update revealed that the company is still in business and headquartered in Texas.

In 2022, Beardbrand reached the decade milestone after being founded back in 2012 and continues to generate millions every single year. While Eric didn't land a deal with the sharks, exposure from Shark Tank definitely helped him market the company and increase sales.

Our Beardbrand update found that since Shark Tank, Eric has released a handful of new products for bearded men and that sales have reached around $7 million annually.

Products can be purchased on the Beardbrand website.
beardbrand-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Share Tank Beardbrand Update | S6

beartek-smart-glove-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank BearTek Update

Unfortunately, it’s bad news for BearTek. Though they had a successful IndieGoGo campaign (which raised $60k), the company refunded all backing. The website is currently dark. It looks like company is nearly out of business, but our BearTek update research revealed that you can still purchase the gloves on Amazon.
beartek-smart-glove-update-shark-tank-se.title: BearTek Update | S7

beatbox-beverages-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank BeatBox Beverages Update

You’ll be happy to hear that the company is still in business! Research for our BeatBox Beverages update revealed that appearing on Shark Tank gave the brand a huge marketing boost and they managed to get into several thousand retailers across America.

Since appearing on Shark Tank, BeatBox Beverages has done over $57 million in sales and has re-designed the product to be single-serve drinks instead of a multi-use container.

You can shop their products on the BeatBox Beverages website and find retailers that carry the product.
beatbox-beverages-update-shark-tank-seas.title: BeatBox Beverages Update | S6

bed-jet-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Bed Jet Update

We have great news to report! Research for our Bed Jet update revealed that despite not making a deal on Shark Tank, the company seems to be growing and thriving. With more than 100,000 units sold on Amazon, it seems like Bed Jet is on an excellent trajectory to remain successful for a very long time. Besides Amazon, products are available on the Bed Jet website.
bed-jet-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Bed Jet Update | S6

bed-ryder-flat-bed-seating-update-shark-.body:
Shark Tank Bed Ryder Update

We have bad news to share in our Bed Ryder update. The company appears to be out of business. The product is no longer available on Amazon and no company website can be found. This will be our final Bed Ryder update.
bed-ryder-flat-bed-seating-update-shark-.title: Bed Ryder Update | S6

bee-free-honee-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Bee Free Honee Update

For a while, Bee Free Honee thrived. Following the show, the plant-based honey was available in a host of grocery stores, including Natural Grocers, Wegmans, and Whole Foods. Chris Sacca’s Veggie Grill started offering the product, too.

However, our Bee Free Honee update revealed that the company shut down in 2019 under unknown circumstances.

This will be our final Bee Free Honee update.
bee-free-honee-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Bee Free Honee Update | S7

bee-sweet-lemonade-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Bee Sweet Lemonade Update

After some initial deals with Walmart and NASCAR, Beer Blizzard couldn’t secure a long-term licensing agreement. It has since disappeared from social media, and its website is no longer in use.

This will be our final Beer Blizzard update.

benjilock-padlocks-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Benjilock Update

In our Benjilock update research, we found that the company has partnered with Hampton Products International, the makers of BRINKS locks.

This has been a successful deal for Robbie. Benjilock is now available at several retailers, including ACE Hardware, Wal-Mart, Home Depot, QVC, Lowes, and others. You can also purchase it on the Hampton website.

So it looks like Mr. Wonderful was true to his word and helped Robbie get a licensing deal.

Robbie's innovation didn't stop there. In August 2020, he introduced the Fingerprint Door Lock, offering convenient keyless entry for homes and garages.

This versatile lock can store up to ten fingerprints and also includes a pin pad for added security. It can be purchased through the Benjilock website and in hardware retail stores nationwide.

In 2021, he unveiled the Benjilock Fingerprint Bike Lock, which went on to win the prestigious 2021 TWICE PICKS Award for innovation at CES.

Hampton Products remains a strong partner, and Benjilock's annual sales revenue reached a staggering $5 million by November 2023.

The future looks very bright for Robbie and our next Benjilock update!
benjilock-padlocks-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Benjilock Update | S9

bermies-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Bermies Update

Despite not getting a deal on the show, Uki remained determined, and his business thrived. Since its appearance on Shark Tank, Bermies has experienced tremendous success.

Our Bermies update research found that his product line has expanded beyond swimwear, now featuring Hawaiian shirts, pants, shirts, lounge pants, hoodies, and jackets. Additionally, the swimwear is now made from recycled plastic bottles.

With a team of five employees, Bermies has reached $4 million in annual revenue and lifetime sales of over $50 million.

If you'd like to purchase some shorts, they can be found on the Bermies website and on Amazon.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we are calling this Bermies update a success!

besomebody-app-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Besomebody Update

Our Besomebody update found that shortly after airing, Kash sold the Besomebody app to Utivity Holdings in February 2017.

Unfortunately, the app was discontinued in January 2018 due to insufficient demand.

However, Kash shifted the company's focus to job training and skill development, forging partnerships with major companies like Kroger and Microsoft.

This pivot proved successful, with Besomebody's in-person training programs, known as Besomebody Paths, creating over 2,000 jobs across the country.

By 2019, our research on the Besomebody update found that they generated $20 million in annual revenue and earned recognition as one of America's top private companies by Entrepreneur Magazine.

In April 2020, Kash launched BSB Group International to serve better an expanding roster of clients, including both Fortune 500 companies and startups.

Despite the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, BSB Group stepped up, offering free marketing services to Cincinnati businesses affected by the crisis.

In 2022, BSB Group continued to expand, introducing a sports division to help college athletes navigate new opportunities to profit from their names and images.

At the time of writing, the company has ventured into content creation with "The Besomebody Podcast" and announced plans for BSB TV, a digital channel dedicated to business growth.

Further, they have grown to around $20 to $25 million in annual revenue.

We can't wait to bring you another exciting Besomebody update.
besomebody-app-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Besomebody App Update | S8

biaggi-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Biaggi Update | S6

bibbitec-bib-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Bibbitec Update

They felt Bibbitec required educating the customer prior to purchase. Robert asked if the couple had considered licensing the idea to a bib manufacturer with distribution channels. This would help get it to market much faster and at a much larger scale. Susie said that she could not pursue that route “morally” because of the toxins used in Chinese factories overseas.

When Susie said she wanted to prove that America could produce great quality products domestically, Kevin went on the offensive again. He said that America can make great products, but they can’t afford Bibbitec because the price was outrageous.

Steve tried to build excitement talking about the response Bibbitec received at tradeshows, but the sharks remained unconvinced. Daymond John tried tossing a lifeline to this failing pitch, asking if the Taylors truly believed they could get the cost down. The Taylors said that, with a large enough order, they should get the cost lower.

By now, Susie was losing her cool and began acting defensively to the sharks' criticism. Robert addressed the talk of lowering costs and said it was a good plan, but he didn’t understand the Taylors’ plan to sell thousands of Bibbitec bibs to the mass market.

Mark Cuban said he liked the bib and was not deterred by the price point but he personally found the Taylors very much unequipped to run the business. He advised they find a college kid to launch an Internet marketing campaign on the cheap and get the word out. Mark said there were solutions out there to their problems, but the solution was not him, so he was out.

Barbara Corcoran spoke next, stating that Mark’s advice was very good. She also told the Taylors that there was likely an equally passionate salesforce available– other moms. With that, she was out. Kevin was not at all interested in investing, so he too went out.

Daymond John went out next, as he felt he could offer no value to the Taylors. Robert went out last, telling the Taylors that their pitch included a number of confusing strategies, and that he personally felt they had no clear plan for success. With that, they were forced to leave without a deal. What happened next? Keep reading our Bibbitec update to find out!

As with many pitches, exposure from the show led to a spike in sales, and they sold nearly $40,000 in one weekend! Despite this, after some time sales became stagnant to the point where the product was no longer available. In 2019, the business closed down, so this will be our final Bibbitec update.
bibbitec-bib-update-season-4.title: Bibbitec Update | S4

biem-butter-sprayer-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Biem Butter Sprayer Update

After airing, Biem Butter Sprayer gained global interest. Sales took off, and the product even enjoyed some positive attention, like a feature on Cityline TV.

Our Biem Butter Sprayer update found that the deal with Lori Greiner didn't go through primarily due to concerns about the lack of a working prototype.

Things started to go downhill just five months later.

By 2018, Biem's parent company, Brevda, Inc., had received 33 complaints from customers in 18 states, citing issues like faulty products and unfulfilled refunds.

The Better Business Bureau (BBB) got involved, leading the company to release a new version, the Biem Butter Sprayer V2, in 2019.

In the summer of 2019, our Biem Butter Sprayer update found the company launched a Kickstarter campaign to generate support for a new version, the Biem QX3.

Sadly, the campaign fell short, raising just over $4,000 of its $63,000 goal.

By December 2019, the company's social media accounts had gone silent, with no updates on Facebook, Instagram, or X.

By May 2021, the Biem website listed all products as "out of stock," and there were no signs of any new developments.

Even though Doug Foreman still lists Biem as active on his LinkedIn profile, the company seems to have quietly faded away.

Our research on Biem Butter Sprayer update found that Doug has since turned his attention to a new venture, Austin Automation Design, which focuses on automating food preparation processes.

Sadly, this will be our final Biem Butter Sprayer update.
biem-butter-sprayer-update-shark-tank-se.title: Biem Butter Sprayer Update | S8

billy-blanks-jrs-dance-with-me-update-sh.body:
Shark Tank Billy Blanks Jr’s Dance With Me Update

Our Billy Blanks Jr’s Dance With Me update reveals that the program became a big success after Shark Tank. It was rebranded as Dance It Out, and continues to be offered today.

Billy has had several other successful ventures, he even stars in the Lifetime television show, Dance It Out. Additionally, Billy brings his routine all over the world, with the Dance It Out tour.

To check out the program, events and all things Billy Blanks Jr., visit the Dance It Out website.
billy-blanks-jrs-dance-with-me-update-sh.title: Billy Blanks Jr's Dance With Me Update | S3

birddogs-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Birddogs Update

Despite not securing a deal on Shark Tank, Birddogs is still in business and thriving.

In their defense, the entrepreneurs have argued that their attitude was confidence rather than arrogance, and they have managed to prove the sharks wrong by keeping their company thriving in business.

In July 2020, Birddogs was sued for violating the Americans with Disabilities Act and the New York State Human Rights Law.

The suit claimed their website was inaccessible to blind customers. At the time of this writing, the resolution of the lawsuit remains unclear.

Despite this, the company now boasts an annual revenue of $13.9 million, more than double the projected sales during its Shark Tank pitch.

Our Birddogs update also found that they have expanded their product line to include khaki shorts, pants, polo shirts, joggers, sweatpants, and bathing suits, all featuring their signature in-pants liner.

They even introduced boxer briefs, despite Peter's initial disdain for underwear.

The company has raised its prices from $55 to $68 and continues to outperform industry averages. However, challenges remain, including customer complaints about shipping times and service.

In spite of these issues, Birddogs is growing steadily, with customers eagerly anticipating new products. So, despite not getting a deal, we are calling this Birddogs update a success.
birddogs-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Birddogs Update | S9

bitsbox-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Bitsbox Update

Our Bitsbox update found that their Shark Tank exposure worked in their favor: in the month after the show aired, BitsBox's business tripled as more families and schools embraced the idea.

Aidan later shared that the TV exposure helped them raise the funding they needed from other investors, pushing BitsBox into the top tier of kids’ coding companies.

They expanded their offerings to include school-friendly versions of the platform, allowing teachers to bring BitsBox’s interactive coding projects into classrooms.

By mid-2020, BitsBox had generated over $11 million in total sales, though profitability remained a challenge.

Aidan acknowledged that, despite strong demand, they were only breaking even, illustrating the hurdles of scaling a subscription-based model.

They pressed forward, growing their team, doubling office space, and adding a video studio to improve their content.

By 2023, BitsBox had grown to over 800,000 users, with flexible subscription options catering to different budgets.

Families could choose from a digital package or a basic box. For added goodies like toys and stickers, they could opt for the deluxe box, making it accessible to a range of learners.

At the time of writing, our research on the BitsBox update found that the company is a leader in children's coding education.

Further, they now have an estimated valuation of $27 million.

We're calling this Bitsbox update a success.
bitsbox-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Bitsbox Coding for Kids Update | S8

blendtique-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Blendtique Update

Our Blendtique update found that the deal with Lori Greiner was not finalized, as is common with many agreements made on the show.

Despite this, Blendtique saw considerable growth. The company broadened its product line, offering various blending kits at different price points.

This expansion made the wine blending experience more accessible to a wider audience.

Notably, Blendtique hosts private events for individuals and groups, offering hands-on wine-blending experiences.

They also collaborate with vineyards and winemakers throughout Central California to source wines for custom creations.

These custom blends cater to occasions like weddings and offers unique selections for restaurants seeking distinctive offerings.

Our research on the Blendtique update found that the company's annual revenue has grown to around $4 million as of this writing.

If we get another Blendtique update, we will let you know!
blendtique-update-season-8.title: Blendtique Wine Company Update | S8

blondies-cookies-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank Blondie’s Cookies Update

Our Blondie’s Cookies update shows that despite closing all of the Florida stores after the Shark Tank appearance, the business is still going strong. Blondie eventually expanded the business by creating a new production facility in her home state of Indiana.

With 7 locations across her home state, as well as an online store, it seems that Blondie and her cookies are doing just fine. Especially since she's making an estimated $9 million in annual revenue.

You can find all of her popular treats on the Blondie’s Cookies website.
blondies-cookies-shark-tank-season-3.title: Blondie's Cookies Update | S3

body-jac-push-up-product-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank Body Jac Update

Our research on the Body Jac update revealed that Jack eventually met his weight loss goals.

The company also experienced an initial surge in success following its television debut, leading to a wave of infomercials and trade show appearances.

Despite this momentum, the Body Jac website went down in 2012. Barbara Corcoran later called it one of her worst investments, alleging that Jack took all her money.

Although she remained involved in the company until early 2013, the business began to falter and eventually closed by July 2021, likely due to poor financial management and an inability to maintain sales.

According to our Body Jac update research, Jack has since shifted to running his own marketing company and mentoring entrepreneurial students at Iowa State University.

In March 2024, he delivered a presentation titled "Outsharking the Sharks.

At the time of writing, Jack remains active in the entrepreneurial community, focusing on educating the next generation of entrepreneurs.

This looks to be our final Body Jac update.

Research for our Body Walking update finds that after the episode aired, Tod was featured on the show The Doctors months later. This helped to establish himself as a thought leader in the massage industry.

He would go on to create the Body Walking Institute, which helped train new body walkers on a larger scale. Body Walking remains in business, and is now a major provider of massage therapy in the United States.

With successful growth since Shark Tank, we can't wait to see where our next Body Walking update takes us!
body-walking-update-season-4.title: Body Walking Update | S4

bollyx-update-shark-tank-season-10.body:
Shark Tank BollyX Update

Now let’s take a look at the BollyX update after Shark Tank. The company is still in business, and even managed to keep his company growing by focusing on the ability to produce virtual classes during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Today, classes are still available on demand through the BollyX website, or in person, in over 100 cities worldwide. Instructors teach the classes in various gyms, park districts, and dance studios.

Shahil is estimated to be generating between $4 million and $5 million per year. While he wasn’t able to secure a deal on Shark Tank, he seems to have remained focused on expanding his company.
bollyx-update-shark-tank-season-10.title: BollyX Update | S10

bombas-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Bombas Update

Our Bombas update is definitely one for the books, as this iconic Shark Tank company has made more money, overall, than any of the other Shark Tank companies.

Lifetime sales have reached $1.3 billion, and it remains to be Daymond's most successful investment on Shark Tank. The company does about $100 million annually!

Since the show, Bombas has expanded its catalog of products to include shirts, slippers, underwear, and more! Besides the company website, products can also be found on Amazon.

In terms of their sock donation program, they've given away at least 100 million pairs of socks!

With the growth it's experienced since Shark Tank, there's no telling where our next Bombas update will take us!

Shark Tank Bon Affair Update

We have great news to share in our Bon Affair update! We’re glad to report that many years later, the company is still in business! However, it appears Jayla is no longer involved with the company, apparently having left around 2016. Estimates put the annual revenue at $5 million, and the brand’s sparkling Sauvignon Blanc and Syrah spritzer are currently available at Total Wine and More, and on the Bon Affair website.
bon-affair-wine-spritzer-update-shark-ta.title: Bon Affair Update | S5

boo-boo-goo-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank Boo Boo Goo Update

The product came in all the colors of the rainbow, plus different hues to match skin tones. The playful, paint-on application took a little of the sting out of childhood scrapes, and there was no painful adhesive that stuck to sore skin when it was time to come off.

The sharks immediately wanted to know what made the product different from the well-known alternative; a spray-on liquid bandage application that dries clear. Andrew replied that the clear-drying competitor leaves the wound visible through the transparent product. He added that the competition’s formulation made it flammable as well. According to Andrew, 70% of bandage users are kids 3-15 years old. The liquid bandage competition hadn’t yet been able to tap into that market.

Mark Cuban was the first shark out. He said that competitors were long-established, and Andrew would have a hard time getting retailers to make shelf space for their new product. Barbara Corcoran found the whole concept unnecessary, so she went out next. Robert Herjavec also went out, stating it was too early to invest.

Lori Greiner wished the two luck, but said without a solid patent, she wasn’t ready to invest. Kevin O'Leary shared in Lori's opinion, but made an offer anyway. He offered $100,000 in exchange for 25% equity, contingent on a patent, and Andrew and Kiowa accepted the deal. What happened next? Keep reading our Boo Boo Goo update to find out!

We have sad news to share. After the show, Andrew and Kiowa finalized their deal with Kevin and the company even expanded their product line. Unfortunately, it seems that none of those products ever came to market. The original product was made available for a short time, but the company hit some snags in 2016, and shut down in 2017. This will be our final Boo Boo Goo update.
boo-boo-goo-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: Boo Boo Goo Update | S5

boobie-bar-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Boobie Bar Update

Our research on the Boobie Bar update revealed that the deal with Daymond John was successfully closed.

Daymond helped secure a meeting with Target, significantly boosting the company's profile.

Wendy expanded Boobie Bar's product range to include protein bowls, shakes, electrolyte drinks, lactation gummies, and subscription kits.

However, the website notes a disclaimer stating that Boobie Bar products are not FDA-approved.

Despite the lack of clinical trials, Daymond's support and positive Amazon reviews have helped the company grow.

In 2021, our Boobie Bar update found that the company reached $2 million in annual sales. Their products are available on their website and at Walmart, Target, Amazon, and various pregnancy support sites.

Wendy continues to innovate with new products like Boobie Bark, Boobie Body protein shakes, Hydro Mom electrolyte drink mix, and Boobie Bears gummy candies.

The original lactation bars remain popular. They feature superfoods such as oats, flaxseed, moringa, turmeric, and Shatavari root.

According to our research, Boobie Bar is supported by organizations like The Breastfeeding Center and The Care Connection.

It seems Wendy is steering her company in the right direction, and the future looks bright for our next Boobie Bar update.
boobie-bar-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Boobie Bar Update | S9

booby-pack-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Booby Pack Update

Unfortunately, our Booby Pack update holds some bad news. It turns out that the deal with Barbara never finalized. The company ultimately folded about four years after appearing on Shark Tank, at the beginning of the 2018 calendar year. This will be our final Booby Pack update.

boogie-box-fitness-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Boogie Box Fitness Update

Our research on the Boogie Box Fitness update indicates that the business experienced a significant surge following its episode airing.

This exposure propelled them into a new market, ultimately leading to the production of their first DVD and a substantial boost to their overall profile.

Capitalizing on this momentum, our Boogie Box Fitness update found that it secured appearances on national shows like Dr. Oz and FitCeleb, further expanding their visibility.

However, despite this success, they faced tough competition from other dance-based workouts and struggled to differentiate themselves.

At the time of writing, Boogie Box Fitness appears to be out of business. Their social media accounts have been inactive, and their website has been offline since July 2021.

It looks like this will be our final Boogie Box Fitness update.
boogie-box-fitness-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Boogie Box Fitness Update | S1

boomboom-inhalers-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank BoomBoom Update

We do actually have good news to share in our BoomBoom update! That's because the company is still in business, and its nasal inhaler products can be found at CVS, Rite Aid, and Walmart.

They're also available on Amazon, and the the company is believed to be worth between $3 million and $4 million!

As you can see from our BoomBoom update, the company has performed pretty well for leaving without a deal, but it’s certainly possible their potential would have been much higher had they struck a deal with Robert or any of the other sharks.

Only time will tell if they are able to remain in business, and continue to bring in annual revenues for their collection of nasal inhaler products.

You can shop their products on the Bottle Breacher website.

The company’s official website is still online but it’s unclear if Seth and Justin are still a part of the company after the acquisition. Products can be purchased on the Bottle Bright website and on Amazon.

bottlekeeper-update-shark-tank-season-10.body:
Shark Tank BottleKeeper Update

Overall, we have great news to share in our BottleKeeper update. While the deal never closed, the cousins have still found success.

Since the show, they've also expanded their product line to include a CanKeeper, PintKeeper, a cooler called the ChillKeeper, and more!

In addition to the BottleKeeper website, products are available on Amazon, and at Ace Hardware, Sur La Table, and other retailers around the country. Further, the company is doing more than $10 million in annual revenue.

bouquet-bar-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Bouquet Bar Update

Our Bouquet Bar update research revealed that the deal with Mark Cuban never materialized.

Shortly after Shark Tank, Bouquet Bar enjoyed early success and formed partnerships with major corporations like Facebook and Google.

However, our Bouquet Bar update found they struggled to maintain momentum due to rising shipping costs and high customer acquisition expenses.

As a result, Bouquet Bar went out of business in December 2019.

Since then, the founders have returned to their respective brands.

Alex and David returned to their floral design business, Square Root Designs, while Sal returned to his digital agency, Adaptive Media.

Although Bouquet Bar's unique approach to personalized gift boxes had potential, the financial challenges proved too significant to overcome.

It appears this is our final Bouquet Bar update.

Services are available on the Brand Yourself website.
brand-yourself-search-results-service-up.title: Brand Yourself Update | S6

bravo-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Bravo Update

Unfortunately, the deal with Mark and Lori never materialized. However, in 2019, the company introduced cryptocurrency payments.

In September 2021, the company was rebranded to FAMIGO and is currently available for download in the Apple Store under the new name.

This rebranding marked a strategic shift towards supporting content creators and their followers.

A press release highlights, "FAMIGO's content creation platform provides independent artists full control of their brands by offering the same powerful suite of capabilities that other platforms reserve for megastars."

Additionally, FAMIGO offers several benefits to creators, including flexible subscription plans, direct fan engagement through paid messages and personalized shout-outs, the ability to sell a variety of digital and physical products directly to their audience, and an enhanced user experience that fosters stronger connections between creators and fans.

Furthermore, the company continues to thrive, boasting an annual revenue of $2 million.

Despite not finalizing the deal with the sharks, Hector and Maria have elevated their business to greater heights.

This Bravo update is undoubtedly a success.
bravo-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Bravo Update | S9

In 2018, they sold a majority stake to an equity company in San Francisco, which allowed them to get into most grocers throughout the country. You can also find them on Amazon. Annual revenue is now reported to be about $12 million.

Brazi Bites are available on their company website, as well as in most major grocery retailers and Amazon. We can't wait to see where our next Brazi Bites update takes us!

Their innovative approach continues, with a successful IndieGoGo campaign in June 2021 for a space-saving incline bench called The Flip Bench.

Most recently, our Brazyn Life update found that they launched the Talon Massager, a massage gun with attachments for targeted muscle relief.

They have also gained endorsements from many professional sports teams, including the NBA, NFL, USA Rugby, Bobsledding, and Tennis.

At the time of this Brazyn Life update, you can purchase The Morph and other additional products on their website.

It also looks like Nate and Tom have expanded their product line to include additional mobility tools, such as the Morph Stick, various Morph Roller models, and merch.

Since airing on Shark Tank, their dedication to fitness and wellness has translated into a thriving business with $6 million in annual revenue.

It looks like this Brazyn Life update is a success.

breathometer-smartphone-breathalyzer-upd.body:

Research for our Breathometer update found that in 2017, the Federal Trade Commission ruled that the Breathometer device was found to be “seriously inaccurate” in its blood alcohol content analysis. The FTC determined the company had sold over $5 million worth of the devices, and ordered Breathometer to offer a full refund to everyone who had ever bought one. Due to these issues, it's not surprising to learn that the company is no longer in business. This will be our final Breathometer update.

brewers-cow-beer-flavored-ice-cream-shar.title: Brewer's Cow Update | S3

bridal-buddy-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:

Our Bridal Buddy update found that the deal with Lori Greiner and Kevin O'Leary ultimately did not close. The reasons for this are not publicly detailed.

However, The Shark Tank's appearance provided substantial media exposure, leading to features in various bridal magazines and television segments, which enhanced their brand visibility.

In addition, Bridal Buddy expanded its retail presence by securing placements in major stores like Bed Bath & Beyond and numerous bridal shops across the United States.

brightwheel-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Brightwheel Update

He had received $2.2 million in the seed round and Brightwheel had a $10 million valuation. Dave was planning to keep the platform free and without ads.

He told the sharks he would implement optional premium features for those who wanted to pay extra. Kevin O’Leary was not charmed by the lack of advertising.

Brightwheel had gone from 10 schools to 2,500 across the states. Kevin was intrigued and offered $400,000 for a 10% stake. Daymond John went out because he said education wasn’t an area he had much experience in, unlike fellow sharks Kevin O'Leary, Mark Cuban, and guest shark Chris Sacca.

Chris showed his interest but advised that the lack of advertising might need to be reconsidered. He also made an offer of $400,000 for a 4.85% stake.

Dave asked Chris if he would consider teaming up with another shark, but Chris didn’t rank the other sharks for their skills in education.

This led to an extended quarrel between Chris and Mark that Daymond seemed to enjoy witnessing. Kevin took advantage of the squabbling to change his offer, matching Chris’ for $400,000 at 4.85%.

Mark joined the offers with $400,000 at 4%, the stake Dave initially had on the table. Daymond asked if Dave would consider more money for a higher stake, and Dave replied in the affirmative.

Dave countered with $600,000 for 6% equity, and Chris countered that with a joint deal with him and Mark with $600,000 for 6.67%.

Dave asked Mark if he’d match that, and Mark said he would. Dave accepted the deal, and shook hands with the two sharks, leaving the tank with two new partners.

Now let's check in for a Brightwheel update to see what happened after the episode aired.

Brightwheel has been thriving since appearing on Shark Tank. Mark and Chris were instrumental in the growth of the company, securing more investments and connections.

Our Brightwheel update research found that the company now has an estimated valuation of $600 million. You can learn more on the Brightwheel website.
brightwheel-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Brightwheel Update | S7

brilliant-pad-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Brilliant Pad Update

After airing, the deal with Lori Greiner ultimately fell through. Despite the disappointment, the company took this opportunity to refine its product.

They introduced more absorbent and affordable waste pads, along with a tray lip to prevent spills. They also implemented an automatic roll advance system for added convenience.

Like many companies, our Brilliant Pad update found that they faced some manufacturing challenges in 2020 due to the pandemic.

As restrictions let up and manufacturing got back to normal, the company launched the Brilliant Pad Smart, a completely hands-free version.

This innovative design allows users to control the waste pad advancement remotely through a smartphone app.

Additionally, the Smart Pad captures pictures of "potty events" and provides insights on stool consistency, even alerting users to potential health concerns through soft stool detection.

Since airing, Brilliant Pad has grown to over $1 million in annual revenue and is showing no signs of slowing down.

We can't wait to see what Alan has in store for our next Brilliant Pad update.
brilliant-pad-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Brilliant Pad Update | S9

broccoli-wad-money-clip-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Broccoli Wad Update

Our Broccoli Wad update reveals that the deal with Barbara never actually closed. In 2023, the company seems to be out of business, with no active social media presence or website.

Further, we found that the deal with Barbara never closed. However, it seems that Johnny and Vinny eventually took some advice from the sharks about marketing and added Vinny's face to the packaging.

In a podcast interview with ExtraShockXL, Vinny spoke about a Broccoli Wad update and his partner Johnny. According to Vinny, as soon as they walked out of the tank, Johnny shared that he never intended to take the deal with Barbara and was just there for the exposure.

Despite the product being for sale on Amazon for a few years after airing on Shark Tank, it seems Johnny and Vinny finally decided to shut things down and move on to new ventures.

This will be our final Broccoli Wad update.
broccoli-wad-money-clip-update-shark-tan.title: Broccoli Wad update | S2

brush-hero-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:

Shortly after appearing on Shark Tank, our Brush Hero update found that sales skyrocketed, increasing to 500 times their normal volume.

However, this success brought challenges, including a flood of cheap Chinese counterfeits on Amazon.

This led to disrupted customer service and led to an in-depth review of Amazon's policies.

Our research on the Brush Hero update revealed that they were able to overcome the counterfeit issues and were voted one of the 25 best gifts for car lovers in 2018 by Car and Driver Magazine.

Since Shark Tank, Brush Hero has grown to over $6 million in annual sales and has secured a partnership with Costco.

If we receive any more Brush Hero updates, we'll be sure to let you know.

Following the deal, he was able to expand his product line, and offer a variety of different drinks that customers could buy through his website.

After a few years, the company was sold to Snarky Tea in April 2020. Snarky Tea happens to be another Shark Tank Company, that Mr. Wonderful himself invested in.

That said, a quick look at the Snarky Tea website, shows that the BRUW isn't currently available for sale.

Despite this, it seems that selling his entire company was a success story for Max Feber, who always dreamed of being an entrepreneur and coming on Shark Tank.

Shark Tank Caffeindicator Update

From all sources available, it seems the Caffeindicator is out of business.

Unfortunately, our Caffeindicator update research found that the deal with Kevin Harrington never went through, and the product never became widely available.

There was a brief moment of excitement when the product was featured in health and food magazines, but it seems Michael wasn't able to drum up enough excitement.

After that initial buzz, the media and Michael stopped talking about the Caffeindicator.

It also seems possible that one of the "big five" sweetener companies, the ones Michael needed to partner with, weren't convinced the test strip would boost their sales.

There's also a chance a competing company might have bought the idea just to keep it out of the market. We'll likely never know for sure what happened behind the scenes.

captain-ice-cream-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank Captain Ice Cream Update

According to our Captain Ice Cream update research, after appearing on Shark Tank, the business started offering franchises for their mobile ice cream service.

At some point, Tim's franchise system eventually worked. He offered franchises for people to open their own Captain Ice Cream businesses, kind of like mini ice cream stores on wheels.

By mid-2014, Tim was finally able to launch his franchise model and even included branded motorized scooters (mopeds) in the package.

The basic package cost $12,495 and came with an umbrella, a uniform, some business cards, and a fee for using the Captain Ice Cream name for a year.

The other franchise's package included everything we mentioned above but with a bonus. You get a custom-made 2010 Ford Transit Connect van instead of just a moped.

This sounds perfect for someone who wants a bigger ice cream selection or doesn't want to rely on a moped for travel. However, the price tag to get started was higher at $44,495.

Although this price did not cover everything. You'd also be responsible for things like getting the van delivered, adding any extra features you wanted, getting the necessary licenses and permits, and paying taxes.

It's unclear how many franchise locations Tim was able to spin up. Further, in June 2014, the Captain Ice Cream website went offline and hasn't come back up since.

Further, according to Sierra Truck Center's staff page, Tim now has a new job in commercial truck sales.

Sadly, it looks like this will be our final Captain Ice Cream update.
captain-ice-cream-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Captain Ice Cream Update | S1

Undoubtedly, the moral of the story is to never give up! That's the good news, however the bad news is that this will be our final Carsik Bib update.

They ultimately agreed to a deal with Kevin for $600,000 in exchange for 19% equity. Let’s see how the company is doing now with our CertifiKid update.

It turns out that Kevin and CertifiKid finalized their deal and the company has used some of the money to expand to new regions across the United States. Due to the nature of the COVID-19 pandemic, the company was forced to be put on hold until the pandemic was over.

They recently re-opened and started up their platform and website once again. It appears that Kevin has made a reasonable amount of his money back, while Jamie and Brian have successfully grown their business and re-established themselves by generating millions of dollars in revenue in 2021.

Furthermore, with over 3,500 reviews on the App Store, ChangEd has attracted tens of thousands of new users.

In addition, they introduced a new feature to the app called "Friends and Family," which allows others to contribute to a user's student debt.
