We have mixed news to share in our Flipoutz update. After airing on Shark Tank, the company went on to achieve success and its products were eventually sold at Toys R Us and Hallmark stores.

Then, in 2013, the kids sold their company to Wild Craze, for an undisclosed amount. In 2015, they rebranded to Snap Tagz, but the company has since shut down.

The Johnson kids, now adults, have since moved on to other projects. This will be our final Flipoutz update.

While Tim and Zach parted ways in 2014, Zach expanded his product line in 2015. You can check out Zach's many different products on Amazon and Freaker USA site.

It's great to report a positive Freaker USA update despite not landing a deal on Shark Tank Season 4.

That said, Fridge Fronts no longer exists under its own name. However, Best Appliance Skins can help you transform your ugly fridge, into a stainless steel one for around $115.00, which is far cheaper than a new appliance!

Shark Tank Frill Clothing Update

It appears the company was sold for an undisclosed amount of money but products are still available online. To shop their products, check out the Frill Clothing website.
frill-clothing-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Frill Clothing Update | S6

frywall-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank FryWall Update

It’s unclear if the deal with Lori ever closed. Several sources indicate that it never closed, while some claim it closed.

It seems likely that the deal didn’t close, as neither Lori Greiner’s website nor Frywall's website mentions each other.

However, Frywall's website and Amazon page do reference its appearance on Shark Tank.

Despite this, our Frywall update found that the company now offers five different splatter guards in various sizes and colors.

It has different-sized products that fit pans and skillets from eight to thirteen inches in diameter.

Their website also features a well-maintained recipe section with frequent updates.

Since airing on Shark Tank, FryWall has appeared on several television programs and earned millions of dollars in lifetime revenue.

FryWall has become a recognizable household name, dominating the splatter guard category within the kitchen gadget market.

While the company's exact net worth remains unknown, it holds a utility patent to prevent copycats.

As of today, FryWall's strategy involves maintaining its niche market dominance by keeping its design simple, visually appealing, food-safe, and heat-resistant up to 450 degrees Fahrenheit.

While it’s unclear what happened with Lori, we are going to call this FryWall update a success.
frywall-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: FryWall Update | S9

fun-bites-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank FunBites Update

Our FunBites update is somewhat exciting because Lori and Bobbie finalized their deal. The company was featured on QVC  and sales continue to reach impressive levels. In 2021, the company was estimated to generate more than $1 million in gross revenue sales, with a reasonable chance in continued growth. Products are available on Amazon as well as the FunBites website.
fun-bites-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: FunBites Update | S6

fun-time-express-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Fun Time Express Update

Research for our update finds that the guys told the Chicago Tribune that their company website received 10,000 visits within a week of their 2014 appearance on Shark Tank. He also mentioned that a year later, the deal still hadn't closed. In 2018, they sold the company and both went back to real estate. This will be our final Fun Time Express update.
fun-time-express-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Fun Time Express Update | S5

funcakes-rental-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank FunCakes Update

Research for our FunCakes update revealed some good news! This company has managed to stay in business over the years and has received exceptional media attention after airing on Shark Tank Season 6.

During covid, they switched from cake rentals to a different business model, selling the cakes outright instead. You can view and purchase their fake cakes on the FunCakes company website.
funcakes-rental-update-shark-tank-season.title: FunCakes Update | S6

funhouse-attraction-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank FunHouse Update

After airing, Todd and David struggled to find additional investors willing to take the financial risk for their idea.

Our research on the FunHouse update found that the idea ultimately failed to materialize, and the entrepreneurs have parted ways.

Unfortunately, the planned venue in Times Square, which would have showcased a variety of live acts, remained an idea rather than a reality.

Despite exposure to Shark Tank, our FunHouse update research found that the business failed to materialize into reality.

Subsequently, a year later, Todd returned to his street performance roots while David resumed his academic career as a graduate school professor.

This will be our final FunHouse update.
funhouse-attraction-update-shark-tank-se.title: FunHouse Update | S1

fuzzibunz-cloth-diapers-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank FuzziBunz Update

In our FuzziBunz update research, we found that Tereson remained at odds with the competitors and hired a new patent attorney to help go after the knock-offs.

Unfortunately, it was a fruitless endeavor and never resulted in removing them from the space or coercing them to enter a licensing agreement as Kevin had suggested.

Sadly, FuzziBunz closed in September 2018. This will be our final FuzziBunz update.
fuzzibunz-cloth-diapers-update-season-4.title: FuzziBunz Update | S4

g-o-a-t-pet-products-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank G.O.A.T Pet Products Update

Our G.O.A.T Pet Products update research revealed that it is unclear if the deal with Robert Herjavec closed. However, the company has since gone out of business.

Shortly after airing, Michelle expanded the product line to include G.O.A.T. Milk Dog Treats.

These gluten-free goat milk treats were handmade by disabled workers at the Wisconsin Eisenhower Center. Part of the proceeds from the treats supported animal rescues.

Most of their products, including the original speaker, which cost $24.99 (later reduced to $11.99), were sold on Amazon and received mostly positive reviews.

However, since September 2021, the company has been largely inactive.

Its Facebook page is inactive, its website is no longer operational, and many products are out of stock on Amazon.

The Bluetooth app for the speaker hasn't been updated since March 2019, and users have reported issues with it. The last activity on their Twitter account was also in 2019.

So, despite a successful appearance on Shark Tank, this looks like our final G.O.A.T. Pet Products update.
g-o-a-t-pet-products-update-shark-tank-s.title: G.O.A.T. Pet Products Update | S9

gameday-couture-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Gameday Couture Update

Mark Cuban and Gameday Couture eventually finalized their deal and the company continued to grow and acquire sports licenses. Research for our Gameday Couture update revealed that the female sports products are found in Dick’s Sporting Goods stores around North America and the company as a whole generates millions of dollars in revenue per year. Products are available on the Gameday Couture website and on Amazon.
gameday-couture-update-shark-tank-season.title: Gameday Couture Update | S6

games2u-update-shark-tank-season-2.body:
Shark Tank Games2U Update

Our Games2U update reveals that the company triumphed even without a shark investment. Although they left the tank empty handed, they have since expanded to Canada and the Middle East.

The company has been featured by Rachael, the Wall Street Journal, Inc., Fox Business, and more. Additionally, they currently have an annual revenue of $9 million.

You can find out what they offer on the Games2U website. They have several games and activities to choose from when booking your next event.
games2u-update-shark-tank-season-2.title: Games2U update | S2

garage-door-lock-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Garage Door Lock Update

We have good news to share in our Garage Door Lock update! It has been reported that Bryan’s company shut down, or the product is no longer being manufactured, but we found that’s not the case. The company is still in business, and as of November 2022, an updated version of Bryan’s product is for sale through his company’s rebranded ELockSys website.
garage-door-lock-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Garage Door Lock Update | S5

gato-cafe-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Gato Cafe Update

We have sad news to share in our Gato Cafe update. Unfortunately, despite running a few crowdfunding campaigns for her idea, Adriana was forced to close her company before it ever became a reality. This will be our final Gato Cafe update.
gato-cafe-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Gato Cafe Update | S6

gayla-bentley-fashion-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Gayla Bentley Fashion Update

Our research on the Gayla Bentley Fashion update revealed that shortly after its episode aired, the company secured a placement in the Neiman Marcus luxury department store, positioning it for initial success.

However, Gayla's inexperience in scaling the business led to difficulties, and by 2016, her online presence had become inconsistent.

Despite experiencing a brief resurgence with her line being sold in boutiques across 23 U.S., Canada, and the UK, her operations suffered a major setback when Hurricane Harvey flooded her facilities in Houston in August 2017.

Our Gayla Bentley Fashion update found that the damage was severe, and Gayla was unable to recover from the financial and logistical challenges.

As a result, Gayla Bentley Fashion went out of business in 2018.

At the time of this writing, Gayla has shifted her focus to consulting. She uses her expertise in fashion to advise Fortune 500 companies on personal and professional styles.

This will be our final Gayla Bentley Fashion update.
gayla-bentley-fashion-update-shark-tank-.title: Gayla Bentley Fashion Update | S1

geek-chic-furniture-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Geek Chic Update

As it would turn out, the deal with Robert H. never closed, and growth was too slow to provide Robert G. the cash flow to sustain operations. Eventually, in 2017, Geek Chic went out of business. This will be our final Geek Chic update!
geek-chic-furniture-update-season-4.title: Geek Chic Update | S4

geek-my-tree-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Geek My Tree Update

Unfortunately, our Geek My Tree update isn’t good news. While the product sold well for a couple of years (especially after closing the deal with Kevin), Brad ultimately closed the doors in 2018. Too many knock-off products and patent issues lead to bad news for this business.

This will be our final Geek My Tree update.
geek-my-tree-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Geek My Tree Update | S7

geoorbital-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank GeoOrbital Update

Despite not securing a deal, GeoOrbital continued to grow after Shark Tank. Their product gained distribution through major retailers like Amazon, Brookstone, and Best Buy.

Additionally, they secured funding through crowdfunding platforms (StartEngine) in 2017 and 2018.

Our GeoOrbital update found that the company saw leadership changes in 2018 with the departure of its Chief Strategy Officer. In July 2019, Dakota Decker left for a different company.

Despite personnel changes, GeoOrbital won the Edison Award for Innovation in 2018 and the Time Magazine Invention of the Year in 2019, so it is safe to say others liked the product.

They also expanded their business model by launching a Public Safety division.

Social media posts stopped in November 2019, and they haven't updated their Facebook page since July 2020, which has raised some red flags.

In August 2022, their products were no longer available on major retail websites, including their own.

While the company might still be technically operational based on the founder's LinkedIn profiles, the lack of online sales and updates suggests they are no longer actively functioning.

Based on the available information, it's reasonable to consider GeoOrbital out of business.

So, it looks like this might be our final GeoOrbital update.
geoorbital-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: GeoOrbital Update | S9

getaway-tiny-home-rentals-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank GetAway Update

Our GetAway update found that shortly after their Shark Tank appearance, the company saw a huge spike in web traffic and bookings.

By 2017, they had grown to 80 cabins in New York, Boston, and Washington, DC.

While this was less than their original target of 30 cities, the founders were careful not to rush expansion, wanting to maintain the quality of the guest experience.

In 2019, they secured an additional $22.5 million in venture capital to help push their growth forward.

When the pandemic hit in 2020, demand for GetAway's secluded cabins soared. People were seeking safe ways to escape.

Sales jumped by 150%, and by May 2021, they raised an additional $47.5 million in Series C funding and mapped out plans to expand to 29 locations, bringing their total funding to $81 million.

By then, they had expanded to 17 metro areas, bringing in $30 million in annual revenue.

Our GetAway update found that the company hit a major milestone in May 2022 with 1,000 cabins in new cities like Atlanta, Chicago, and Indianapolis.

They also launched GetAway Campgrounds, offering more upscale camping options.

In August 2023, GetAway added eight more locations, for a total of 29. They now have over 1,000 cabins across the U.S.

In October 2024, GetAway officially changed its name to Postcard Cabins.

At the time of writing our GetAway update research, the company has grown to $41 million in annual revenue and has expanded its offerings to include group retreats and events.

If you're interested, you can book a cabin here.

Despite not getting a Shark Tank deal, GetAway defied all odds to become a success.

We’re calling this GetAway update a success.
getaway-tiny-home-rentals-update-shark-t.title: GetAway Tiny Home Rentals Update | S8

gift-card-rescue-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Gift Card Rescue Update

Our research on the Gift Card Rescue update revealed that Kwame eventually turned down the deal with Kevin O'Leary and Robert Herjavec because giving up 50% equity was too much for him.

Since appearing on Shark Tank, Gift Card Rescue initially soared in popularity. Leveraging the show's publicity, they secured a partnership with Amazon.

In 2012, the company had grown to $6 million in annual revenue, and by 2013, it had surpassed $10 million, making Gift Card Rescue one of the fastest-growing startups on Shark Tank.

However, their rapid growth led to financial strain and numerous customer complaints.

Our Gift Card Rescue update found that by 2015, their annual sales revenue had reached $15 million, but in July 2016, a lender's loan default judgment froze the company's bank account, forcing it to shut down.

Kwame attempted to raise funds and renegotiate loan terms but was unsuccessful. The company could not sustain its rapid expansion without adequate financing.

Subsequently, the Better Business Bureau received 300 complaints, primarily from unpaid sellers.

At the time of writing, the Gift Card Rescue website is still active but under new ownership.

Today, Kwame is the CEO and founder of Pioneer Branding, which focuses on helping entrepreneurs build magnetic personal brands.

This will be our final Gift Card Rescue update.
gift-card-rescue-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Gift Card Rescue Update | S1

glace-cryotherapy-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank Glace Cryotherapy Update

Unfortunately, the deal with Barbara never closed. Skyler acknowledged this in a company Facebook post shortly after the episode aired.

In 2017, all four of Glace Cryotherapy’s locations went out of business. While Skyler has continued to consult for the Cryotherapy industry, Glace Cryotherapy machines are no longer available. This will be our final Glace Cryotherapy update.
glace-cryotherapy-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Glace Cryotherapy Update | S7

gladiator-lacrosse-equipment-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank Gladiator Lacrosse Update

Our Gladiator Lacrosse update shows that Rachel’s progress in the business world has been stratospheric. Gladiator Lacrosse products are still being sold after attracting the interest of many retailers.

Rachel is a Princeton student and has already been featured on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list.

You can check out Gladiator Lacrosse on the company’s website and a wide range of products are also available on Amazon.

We are very confident that our next Gladiator Lacrosse update will be even more promising.
gladiator-lacrosse-equipment-update-shar.title: Gladiator Lacrosse Update | S7

glovestix-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank GloveStix Update

Sadly, it looks like the deal with Lori and Alex never went through, possibly due to disagreements about retail strategy.

However, Krista persevered and expanded her product line to include StinkStix for various types of footwear, catering to a broader audience.

The products remain essentially the same as when they appeared on the show, except that ShoeStix has been renamed StankStix. They still feature an insert that needs to be replaced throughout the product's life.

Our GloveStix update found that in 2023, the company secured placement in roughly 100 sporting goods stores, including major retailers like Pure Hockey.

Further, GloveStix has received significant media attention, having been featured in major outlets like The Washington Post, Fortune, and the Chicago Tribune.

GloveStix's success is further recognized by prestigious awards such as the Stevie Awards, Today's NEXT BIG Thing, and Loudoun Chamber Entrepreneur of the Year.

Since Shark Tank, GloveStix has grown to over $1 million in annual revenue.

We are going to call this GloveStix update a success!
glovestix-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: GloveStix Update | S9

glow-recipe-beauty-line-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Glow Recipe Update

As we looked into the company for our Glow Recipe update, we found that the deal with Robert never came to be. However, the business is doing great. Their products launched in Sephora shortly after airing. Now, they are a huge name in the beauty community with over $100 million in annual sales.

You can find Glow Recipe products on their fully stocked Amazon store. You can also shop all of their product lines via the Glow Recipe website.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we are thrilled to share a great Glow Recipe update!
glow-recipe-beauty-line-update-shark-tan.title: Glow Recipe Update | S7

gobie-h2o-filtered-water-bottle-update-s.body:
Shark Tank Gobie H2O Update

While the bottles were sold for many years, the company seems to have gone out of business in 2021. Rusty has since moved on to another endeavor. According to his LinkedIn page, he is now affiliated with Happi Canine, a company that sells CBD supplements for dogs. This will be our final Gobie H20 update.
gobie-h2o-filtered-water-bottle-update-s.title: Gobie H20 Update | S4

gold-rush-nugget-bucket-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Gold Rush Nugget Bucket Update

We have good news to share in our Gold Rush Nugget update! The deal between Robert and Mark closed, and the official partnership was formed. There were definitely some challenges in the months following the episode airing on Shark Tank, but the company has steadily grown and now there’s more than $1 million in annual revenue with the future looking brighter than ever for the company. You can get your very own bucket on Amazon as well as the Gold Rush Nugget Bucket website.
gold-rush-nugget-bucket-update-shark-tan.title: Gold Rush Nugget Bucket Update | S6

good-grief-celebrations-funeral-concierg.body:
Shark Tank Good Grief Celebrations Update

Our research on Good Grief Celebrations update found that the business struggled to establish a strong market presence shortly after airing.

The company's Twitter account became inactive in late 2011, suggesting that it likely ceased operations around that time.

Also, the lack of funding and market acceptance hindered growth, and Rikki found it challenging to sustain the business.

At the time of writing our Good Grief Celebrations update, Rikki is the Director of Marketing for The Cake Doctor.

Her shift to a new role suggests that she took the sharks' feedback and decided to pursue a different path.

This marks the end of our Good Grief Celebrations update.
good-grief-celebrations-funeral-concierg.title: Good Grief Celebrations Update | S1

goodhangups-magnetic-hangers-update-seas.body:
Shark Tank GoodHangUps Update

Our GoodHangups update revealed that the deal with Lori Greiner successfully closed.

This partnership helped the company experience a surge in growth shortly after its appearance.

Further, the product gained exposure on QVC and became available at major retailers like Bed Bath & Beyond, buybuyBaby, and Amazon.

From 2016 to 2019, GoodHangups generated $5.3 million in sales, reaching $1 million in annual revenue by April 2022.

However, the company faced challenges by mid-2022, selling out of inventory and halting social media updates by June.

At the time of writing our GoodHangups update, the website lists products as "sold out" and shows "Currently Unavailable" on Amazon.

Our GoodHangups update research found that Leslie still lists GoodHangups as an active business on her LinkedIn. This indicates a pause rather than a permanent closure.

While it appears that GoodHangups may be on hold, Leslie has since shifted focus to Hot Taco, Inc., where she is the President.

If we get another GoodHangups update, we'll be sure to let you know.
goodhangups-magnetic-hangers-update-seas.title: GoodHangups Update | S8

gotta-have-smore-desserts-update-season-.body:
Shark Tank Gotta Have S'More Update

We have mixed news to share in our Gotta Have S'More update! Carmen was able to finally get her shipping costs down in 2018, which was great for business. However, social media accounts have not been updated since December of 2022, and in the second quarter of 2023, the Gotta Have S'More website is down. At this point, it's unclear whether the company is still in business, or if they're just taking a break, but we hope for the best!
gotta-have-smore-desserts-update-season-.title: Gotta Have S'More Update | S4

grace-and-lace-boot-socks-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Grace and Lace Update

Our Grace and Lace update finds the company is still kicking! Not only have they continued selling socks, but the company has expanded into other apparel items as well. The company reportedly had over $1 million in sales within five days following their 2013 Shark Tank appearance. By 2019, their sales had reached $47 million! Check out all they offer on the Grace and Lace website.
grace-and-lace-boot-socks-update-shark-t.title: Grace and Lace Update | S5

graffiti-removal-services-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Graffiti Removal Services Update

Our research on Graffiti Removal Services update found that the company relocated to Portland, Oregon, in 2011 due to a surge in graffiti incidents.

Following the move, Paul shifted his focus from franchising to retailing eco-friendly cleaning products through his website.

The move proved successful, with annual revenue growing from $275,000 to nearly $4 million by 2021.

The cost of graffiti removal products varies widely depending on several factors.

These include the graffiti's location and surface, size, application method, and the amount of material used.

According to our Graffiti Removal Services update, removal products, cleaning wipes, and accessories are available from its website at prices ranging from $9.99 to $185.00.

It will be interesting to see what the future holds for Paul in our next Graffiti Removal Services update.
graffiti-removal-services-update-shark-t.title: Graffiti Removal Services Update | S1

granola-gourmet-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Granola Gourmet Update

Our research on Granola Gourmet update found that Jeff secured investments from other investors and expanded into over 600 stores, including Safeway, Vons, Whole Foods, and Amazon, by 2011.

This growth led to a follow-up feature on Shark Tank, where he further shared his success and revealed more details about his expansion into Amazon.

However, the company faced challenges. By 2013, Granola Gourmet's social media went silent, and the website became inactive in 2016.

While Jeff's LinkedIn profile indicates the business is still active, the product has vanished from both physical and online stores, suggesting a quiet closure.

According to our Granola Gourmet update research, intensified competition and market oversaturation likely contributed to declining sales and the company's eventual disappearance from the public eye.

However, as of this writing, Jeff has since shifted focus to other ventures, leaving Granola Gourmet's future uncertain.

This will likely be our final Granola Gourmet update.
granola-gourmet-update-shark-tank-season.title: Granola Gourmet Update | S1

grease-bags-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Grease Bags Update

Our Grease Bags update found that the deal with Barbara Corcoran fell through because Latangela couldn't reduce manufacturing costs as Barbara had requested.

Despite this setback, the exposure from the show sparked a surge in pre-orders on Shopify.

However, the company struggled to keep up with the demand.

Latangela faced months of delays in fulfilling orders, and by December 2017, frustrated customers began voicing their complaints on social media.

She issued an apology and eventually fulfilled the orders, but the challenges persisted.

By 2021, Grease Bags was listed on Amazon and Shopify, though customer reviews were increasingly negative, with many reporting that the bags would split open.

Our Grease Bags update found that Latangela relaunched the company in 2021, with the website back online and products available on platforms like Zulily.

Yet by July 2022, the product was once again out of stock on both the website and Amazon.

However, at the time of writing, the bags are listed as in stock again.

Despite these hurdles, Latangela has shown remarkable persistence, continuing to promote her eco-friendly product.

Alongside her business, Latangela has managed to maintain her acting career, appearing in projects like the 2023 movie, “Girl in the Closet.”

If we get any more news on a Grease Bags update, we will let you know!
grease-bags-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Grease Bags Update | S8

grease-monkey-wipes-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Grease Monkey Wipes Update

Our Grease Monkey Wipes update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec and Barabara Corcoran successfully closed, as the entrepreneurs were able to repay the investment quickly.

This success led to an update segment in Season 2. In a significant turn of events, Tim bought out both the sharks and his co-founder, Erin Whalen, making Grease Monkey Wipes his sole venture.

In November 2014, Tim sold the company to Beaumont Products for an undisclosed amount.

His decision to sell was driven by his desire to explore new opportunities, leading him to start Cat5 Elite, a bicycling-themed clothing company.

Unfortunately, this venture didn't take off, and Tim eventually shifted his career to Houghton Mifflin Harcourt in Austin.

At the time of this writing, Grease Monkey Wipes continues to be sold through Beaumont Products.

This looks to be our final Grease Monkey Wipes update.
grease-monkey-wipes-update-shark-tank-se.title: Grease Monkey Wipes Update | S1

green-box-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Green Box Update

The Green Box update is exciting and shocking at the same time. The company experienced massive growth in the years following Shark Tank until a major acquisition took place in the beginning of 2020 from Pratt Industries. Jen and Ned also joined Pratt Industries to continue running the brand from a position within the company. You can actually order custom Green Box pizza boxes in bulk from the Pratt Industries website.
green-box-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Green Box Update | S6

grill-charms-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Grill Charms Update

Our research on the Grill Charms update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec eventually closed.

Leslie secured a licensing agreement with Fox Run Brands, a leading grilling solutions provider, in early 2013.

This strategic partnership enabled Grill Charms to significantly expand its market reach and ensure product availability during the peak gift-giving season of Christmas of the same year.

Our Grill Charms update found that Fox Run continued to distribute the product until around 2020, when the licensing agreement concluded.

While her LinkedIn profile still lists Leslie as the owner under Charmed Life Products LLC, recent findings suggest John Rinder is the current owner.

While details about the new agreement remain limited, it's clear that Leslie's innovative grilling solution continues to evolve.

However, Grill Charms products are still available on Amazon.

If we get another Grill Charms update, we'll let you know.
grill-charms-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Grill Charms Update | S1

grinds-chewing-tobacco-alternative-updat.body:
Shark Tank Grinds Update

We have good news to share in our Grinds update! While the deal never finalized after the show, they continued selling online and sales continued to steadily climb. By 2019, Pat and Matt spent $6.7 million to relocate their production, fulfillment, and distribution center to Westfield, Indiana. In 2023, Grinds remains in business with an estimated annual revenue of $5 million. Want to try the product? Pick some up on the Grinds website, or on Amazon!
grinds-chewing-tobacco-alternative-updat.title: Grinds Update | S4

grip-clean-hand-soap-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Grip Clean Update

The company is still doing very well. While researching for our Grip Clean update, we found that the deal with Lori didn’t close. However, shortly after the show aired, Bryce managed to make deals with brands like Cycle Gear and CarQuest for distribution.

You can still purchase Grip Clean on Amazon as well as on the Grip Clean website. The latest numbers for the company place annual revenue at about $3 million. That’s no small feat!
grip-clean-hand-soap-update-shark-tank-s.title: Grip Clean Update | S7

groovebook-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank GrooveBook Update

We have some mixed news to share. The company got the “Shark Tank bump”, and quickly went from 18,000 to 500,000 subscribers after the episode. Within the year, Shutterfly bought the company for $14.5 million, however they announced that they would discontinue all GrooveBook services effective April 8, 2022. This will be our final GrooveBook update.
groovebook-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: GrooveBook Update | S5

grypmat-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Grypmat Update

Our Grypmat update research found that the deal with Lori, Mark, and Richard was successfully closed.

Since airing, Grypmat has received significant consumer interest, leading to a complete sell-out of its existing inventory. The sharks' involvement has been instrumental in facilitating the international distribution of Grypmat.

Grypmat products are available on its website and Amazon, as well as in retail markets such as NAPA Auto Parts and other automotive stores.

In Season 10, Shark Tank shared an official Grypmat update, during which Tom visited an Air Force base and announced a major deal with the Air Force.

Further, Richard Branson has become a strong advocate for the product, using it across his various businesses, from electric race teams to Virgin Space Programs.

In 2019, Grypmat moved all of its sales online following Sir Richard Branson's advice. This strategic move proved beneficial when the COVID-19 pandemic dealt a major blow to all retail sales in 2020.

During this time, Grypmat introduced smaller versions for home mechanics.

Grypmat remains a thriving business, currently generating around $2 million in annual revenue.

With Tom taking his business to greater milestones, we eagerly await the next Grypmat update.
grypmat-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Grypmat Tool Mat Update | S9

gunnar-optiks-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Gunnar Update

While the terms Lori Greiner offered Joe were not ultimately accepted by the company's full investor group, Gunnar Optiks has continued to thrive.

Despite this, our Gunnar Optiks update research found that the company has become one of the leading brands for gamers looking to reduce eye strain.

Reviews for Gunnar Optiks's eyewear products are quite positive, and the company has consistently increased revenue since appearing on Shark Tank in Season 9.

As evidenced by their press releases, our Gunnar Optiks update found that they remain active sponsors within the eSports community and consistently introduce new products and partnerships.

As of February 2023, the company is demonstrably successful, boasting annual revenue exceeding $8 million.

Things are looking bright, and we are certain our next Gunnar Optiks update will be a good one!
gunnar-optiks-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Gunnar Optiks Update | S9

guzzle-buddy-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Guzzle Buddy Update

Based on our Guzzle Buddy update research, the deal with Daymond John was never closed.

Moreover, the company faced increased competition from knockoffs, which prompted it to expand its product line to include plastic versions and customized options for gifts and promotions.

By January 2023, Guzzle Buddy's annual sales reached $2 million.

Shortly after its appearance on Shark Tank, Google searches for Guzzle Buddy soared, driving wholesale purchases and boosting social media followers across all platforms.

Our Guzzle Buddy update research revealed that the original product price dropped from $25 to around $15.

Further, new variants have emerged, including designs for children's drinks and sturdier copolyester versions.

Despite the competition, Guzzle Buddy maintains positive online reviews for its novelty appeal and refund policy.

The future looks bright for our next Guzzle Buddy update.
guzzle-buddy-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Guzzle Buddy Drinkware Update | S9

hamboards-skateboards-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Hamboards Update

In our Hamboards update research, we found that the company’s business is booming. In the year following the Shark Tank appearance, the company had over $1 million in sales. Robert helped Hamboards cut their costs by 10%, and business is booming. The boards currently sell in nearly 60 skate shops across the country. Products are available on Amazon as well as on the Hamboards website.
hamboards-skateboards-update-shark-tank-.title: Hamboards Update | S5

hammer-nails-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Hammer & Nails Update

While Michael did not make a deal with the sharks, his future looks bright!  We look forward to seeing what the next Hammer & Nails update will have in store.
hammer-nails-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Hammer & Nails Update | S6

hand-out-gloves-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Hand Out Gloves Update

Our Hand Out Gloves update revealed that the deal with Barabra Corcoran ultimately fell through after some managerial disagreements.

However, in early 2018, they introduced lightweight gloves and neoprene gloves for fishing and planned to launch new products geared toward hunters and construction workers.

Sadly, in September 2018, the company suffered a tragic loss when co-founder Don Wildman passed away after a long battle with cancer.

Despite this emotional setback, Hand Out Gloves pushed forward with their plans for expansion.

In 2019, our Hand Out Gloves update found that they successfully launched a new line of work and hunting gloves, broadening their market and adding to their already diverse selection.

By December 2021, Hand Out Gloves was still up and running, but like many businesses, they faced difficulties due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

Supply chain issues caused a shortage of their snow gloves, which they had hoped to restock by November 2021.

Our Hand Out Gloves update research found that the company had grown to about $1 million in annual revenue, with most of its sales coming from small retailers and ski shops.

We're calling our Hand Out Gloves update a success.
hand-out-gloves-update-shark-tank-season.title: Hand Out Gloves Update | S8

hangease-hangers-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank HangEase Update

Unfortunately for everyone involved, the deal didn’t close. Ryan was just 19 when he appeared on Shark Tank, so although he had to shelve his hanger invention, he still had plenty of time to pursue success. In the years since his hanger days, he has completed a degree and worked in senior-level merchandising for Neiman Marcus. He is set to complete his MBA from Rice University in 2023. This will be our final HangEase update.
hangease-hangers-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: HangEase Update | S5

happy-feet-slippers-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Happy Feet Update

We have great news to share in our Happy Feet update! Pat credits Robert’s team with helping him land big name licensing deals such as Dreamworks, Marvel and Disney. If you’re looking for some gift-worthy slippers, you can order Pat’s products through the Happy Feet website, or on Amazon. The company has an estimated annual revenue of $4.5 million.
happy-feet-slippers-update-shark-tank-se.title: Happy Feet Update | S5

hargitt-marine-services-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Hargitt Marine Services Update

Through our research, we were unable to find any definitive information about whether Mark had succeeded in recovering the valuable ore from the Mariposa, so we checked out his Facebook page. Mark’s last post about the ship and its treasure was in 2015, and included a photo of the coastal waters where the wreckage lay, and a comment that his ore was still out there. This will be our final Hargitt Marine Services update.
hargitt-marine-services-shark-tank-seaso.title: Hargitt Marine Services Update | S5

hatch-baby-changing-table-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Hatch Baby Update

There’s a lot of good news for Hatch Baby. They expanded their product line to include an app-controlled nightlight with white noise and different colors, as well as multiple products that can grow with your children. They even have adult products. Our Hatch Baby update research revealed that as of 2022, the company makes about $5 million annually.

You can find the changing table, as well as the other products in their product line, on the Hatch Baby website.
hatch-baby-changing-table-update-shark-t.title: Hatch Baby Update | S7

hater-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Hater Update

According to our Hater update research, Brendan and Mark finalized their deal after Shark Tank. However, the company went out of business shortly afterward in June 2019.

There is not much information available on why Hater went out of business, but it seems likely that Brendan had trouble making the company profitable.

After Hater shut down, Brendan moved to Sweden to develop a new mobile app called Everbloom. This app allows users to transform their videos into beautiful stories.

It seems he has completely abandoned the idea of the Hater Dating App.

Unfortunately, it looks like this will be our final Hater update.
hater-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Hater Dating App Update | S9

heart-pup-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Heart Pup Update

Those interested can purchase Heart Pup products on the company's official website.
heart-pup-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Heart Pup Update | S6

heidi-ho-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Heidi Ho Update

We have some concerning news to share for Heidi's company. Research for our Heidi Ho update has revealed that their website is down and their Facebook page has been inactive since 2020. With their online presence seemingly vanished, it's unclear whether Heidi Ho is still in business or not, but given these signs, it doesn't appear to be.
heidi-ho-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Heidi Ho Update | S6

hells-bells-motorcycle-helmets-update-sh.body:
Shark Tank Hells Bells Update

Our Hells Bells update revealed that the deal with Daymond John fell through due to a significant production disagreement.

Marix refused to move production to China, prioritizing quality over quantity.

Despite this setback, the business continued to thrive. In 2021, Hells Bells Helmet rebranded to BADASS Helmets.

Further, they expanded their product line beyond custom 3D helmets to include motorcycle gas tanks and fenders.

Additionally, Hells Bells signed major partnerships with big retailers like Harley Davidson and was featured on the Sons of Anarchy TV show.

Our Hells Bells update research found that the company has grown to around $12 million in annual revenue.

We're calling this a success and can't wait to bring you the latest on our next Hells Bells update.
hells-bells-motorcycle-helmets-update-sh.title: Hells Bells Update | S1

henrys-humdingers-honey-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Henry’s Humdingers Update

We have tragic news to report. The deal with Robert and Mark never did finalize, and in January 2019, Henry shut down his business due to low sales, following the loss of his family's farm. Then in April 2019, the family's home burned to the ground, causing Henry’s mom to be injured and the loss of several pets. Henry said the experience taught him that family was truly the only thing that mattered. This will be our final Henry's Humdingers update.
henrys-humdingers-honey-update-shark-tan.title: Henry's Humdingers Update | S5

hillbilly-brand-clothing-line-update-sha.body:
Shark Tank HillBilly Brand Update

Our HillBilly Brand update shows that the deal with the sharks did not go through. Despite this, Mike and Shon got to communicate a lot with Daymond, and have grown the company to around $1 million in annual sales.

HillBilly Brand has continued to expand it's product line since Shark Tank and they now sell women's clothes and even have their own iced tea brand.

You can find everything the company offers on the HillBilly Brand website.

If we get any more news on a HillBilly Brand update, we will let you know!
hillbilly-brand-clothing-line-update-sha.title: HillBilly Brand update | S2

himalayan-dog-chew-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Himalayan Dog Chew Update

Even though they failed to receive a desirable offer on Shark Tank, we have great news to share in our Himalayan Dog Chew update!  The company is still in business and is estimated to generate more than $10 million in revenue with sales expected to keep growing. Their products are available online at Chewy, Amazon and on the Himalayan Dog Chew website.
himalayan-dog-chew-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Himalayan Dog Chew Update | S6

hip-chixs-jeans-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Hip Chixs Update

In 2015, Megan and Aimee launched a Kickstarter campaign, looking to secure $20,000 in crowdfunding. Unfortunately, they failed to reach the goal and wound up walking away with nothing. After this, it wasn’t long before Hip Chixs closed up shop for good. Megan went on to become a photographer stylist for Fossil, while Aimee became a trainer at Sculpt. This will be our final Hip Chixs update.
hip-chixs-jeans-update-season-4.title: Hip Chixs Update | S4

hold-your-haunches-shapewear-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank Hold Your Haunches Update

Unfortunately, despite years of success and sales bursting at the seams, the company seems to have gone out of business. In 2023, we find that the Hold Your Haunches website is down, but you can still snag a pair of their shapewear leggings on Amazon, and various other online retailers. This will be our final Hold Your Haunches update.
hold-your-haunches-shapewear-update-shar.title: Hold Your Haunches Update | S5

honeyfund-honeymoon-registry-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank Honeyfund Update

Great news for this entrepreneurial couple! Research for our Honeyfund update revealed that Kevin has been an excellent partner.

Honeyfund has continued to grow and dominate the wedding crowdfunding industry, making it easier than ever for customers to raise money for their honeymoons.

While we didn't find any new financial numbers in our Honeyfund update, we did find that Sara and Josh have added the ability for customers to set up funds for other major life events like buying a home or having a baby.

At the time of writing, the company has helped couples raise over $750 million, according to the Honeyfund website.
honeyfund-honeymoon-registry-update-shar.title: Honeyfund Update | S6

hoodie-pillow-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Hoodie Pillow Update

Research for our Hoodie Pillow update revealed fantastic news! While the deal with Robert never did close, the episode drove a big spike in sales for the company. The product that appeared on the show was eventually discontinued, but they expanded their line with a new focus on travel items. You can shop their products on the Hoodie Pillow website, and as well as on Amazon. As of 2023, annual revenue is estimated to be around $5 million!
hoodie-pillow-update-season-4.title: Hoodie Pillow Update | S4

hoop-maps-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank HoopMaps Update

After appearing on Shark Tank, HoopMaps experienced a surge in user subscriptions.

Although the app did not secure a deal on the show, Mark Cuban was impressed enough to offer his assistance in connecting the Morris brothers with Big3, the 3-on-3 basketball league founded by Ice Cube.

The app also gained national exposure through a feature on SportsCenter.

However, by June 2021, the app appeared to be inactive. While the web URL remains operational, the app is no longer available for download, indicating it is likely no longer in operation.

Their social media pages have not been updated for over two years. The last real posts appeared on YouTube in May 2022 and Facebook in April 2022.

Further evidence suggests a shift in focus. Research for our HoopMaps update indicates a short-lived attempt at running a mini-league in 2019. However, it doesn't seem to have worked out.

The Morris brothers have since embarked on new ventures. They're working on a baseball league and Morris Media, a script-writing and content-creation agency.

It appears this will be our final HoopMaps update.
hoop-maps-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: HoopMaps Update | S9

hoppy-paws-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Hoppy Paws Update

Sadly, we don't have great news to share. Our Hoppy Paws update shows that the company had an initial boost after appearing on Shark Tank, but ultimately failed to grow and expand in the ways that it needed to in order to remain in business. At the beginning of 2019,  Trina decided to shut down Hoppy Paws and move on from the idea entirely. This will be our final Hoppy Paws update.
hoppy-paws-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Hoppy Paws Update | S6

hot-mama-gowns-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Hot Mama Gowns Update

Our Hot Mama Gowns update shows that Deidrea continued to have the company as a side hustle until 2013. That is when the business closed down.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Hot Mama Gowns update.
hot-mama-gowns-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Hot Mama Gowns update | S2

hot-tot-hair-products-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Hot Tot Update

We have great news to share in our Hot Tot update! The company went on to obtain further testing, and became officially branded as a “hypoallergenic” product. Sales steadily increased, and as of 2023, the company has an estimated worth of $5 million today. Products are available on the Hot Tot website, and on Amazon.
hot-tot-hair-products-update-season-4.title: Hot Tot Update | S4

hotels-by-day-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Hotels by Day Update

Our Hotels by Day update found that although the entrepreneurs left without a deal, they quickly expanded their hotel partnerships from 300 to 450.

However, when the pandemic hit in 2020, the company saw an 82% drop in bookings.

But as remote work took off, many turned to Hotels by Day for quiet workspaces outside the home, sparking a surge in “work-from-hotel" bookings.

By mid-2021, demand had nearly bounced back, with over 1,500 hotels on board, making them a leader in this niche.

In 2022, Hotels by Day went international, adding major European cities to its list of partnerships and opening its doors to travelers and remote workers abroad.

Our research on the Hotels by Day update found that their annual revenue had grown to around $5 million.

Further, they introduced FlexBook, a service offering flexible check-in and check-out options for overnight stays.

At the time of writing, Hotels by Day has expanded its lineup to include Work Rooms, Meeting Rooms, Event Spaces, and Coworking Desks.

Despite not getting a Shark Tank deal, Yannis and Brian managed to take their business to new heights.

We can't wait to see what our next Hotels by Day update has in store for us.
hotels-by-day-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Hotels by Day Update | S8

hotshot-coffee-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank HotShot Update

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, HotShot is thriving! Danny managed to shift the focus from “hot coffee at home” to a larger consumer market, with convenience stores, movie theatres, and traveling shows. Our HotShot update research revealed that annual revenue as of 2022 is about $2 million.

You can find HotShot coffee at Malco Theatres in Tennessee, as well as in the NY Metropolitan area. Dozens of locations sell the product, including Walt Disney World. It’s a huge win for HotShot!

Unfortunately, you can no longer order HotShot for personal use. You’ll have to track down this popular coffee at the locations where it’s sold.
hotshot-coffee-update-shark-tank-season-.title: HotShot Update | S7

how-do-you-roll-sushi-franchise-update-s.body:
Shark Tank How Do You Roll Update

Unfortunately, the deal never closed with Kevin. The company performed well, and grew steadily over the years. Then, in 2015, the brothers sold How Do You Roll to a private restaurant group. Details of the deal were undisclosed. While they remained in business for years after the change in ownership, as of August 2021, they are sadly out of business. This will be our final How Do You Roll update.
how-do-you-roll-sushi-franchise-update-s.title: How Do You Roll Update | S4

hugos-amazing-tape-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Hugo's Amazing Tape Update

It's rare to see a company sell 100% of its equity in Shark Tank, but it does happen from time to time. Since selling Hugo's Amazing Tape to Lori Greiner and Mark Cuban, reports indicate that it continues to generate millions of dollars in annual revenue.

However, rumors suggest the sharks divested the business.

There appears to be some discrepancy regarding ownership. According to our Hugo's Amazing Tape update research, the website still lists Katherine and Lauri as owners while identifying Mark and Lori as investors.

At the time of writing, it’s unclear if the original deal went through or if Katherine and Lauri decided they’d like to retain some ownership.

Since Shark Tank, Hugo's Amazing Tape has grown to around $3 million in annual revenue.

If we get any more news on Hugo's Amazing Tape update, we will be sure to let you know.
hugos-amazing-tape-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Hugo's Amazing Tape Update | S9

human-bobber-floatation-device-update-sh.body:
Shark Tank Human Bobber Update

Despite agreeing to a deal with Mark and Kevin on Shark Tank, the deal ultimately fell through.

Based on our Human Bobber update research, shortly after airing, the product became available in retailers like West Marine and Camping World. However, as of this writing, it is no longer available in those stores.

Further, our Human Bobber update found that they have expanded their product line to include new products like a floating tote bag that doubles as a floating chair, floating cup holders, leak-proof tumblers, and more.

For Justin and Doug, Human Bobber continues to be a side hustle. They both maintain full-time jobs, Justin in engineering and Doug in landscape architecture.

Despite not securing a Shark Tank deal, the company has achieved steady growth, with annual revenues reaching approximately $950,000.

While not an outstanding progress, we can say this Human Bobber update is a fair success.
human-bobber-floatation-device-update-sh.title: Human Bobber Update | S9

hungry-harvest-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Hungry Harvest Update

It’s good news for Hungry Harvest! The deal with Robert closed, and Hungry Harvest expanded to multiple different markets across the US. During the pandemic, business was booming, which caused Evan to take out more funds from venture capitalists.

Our Hungry Harvest update research revealed annual revenue of about $4 million for the company. Learn more about the company at the Hungry Harvest website.
hungry-harvest-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Hungry Harvest Update | S7

hyconn-update-shark-tank-season-2.body:
Shark Tank HyConn Update

Unfortunately, our HyConn update shows that the deal never happened due to Mark introducing changes Jeff wasn’t ready to accept. Although the HyConn website is still up and running, there are no products available for purchase.

At the time of this writing, it's unclear if the company is still in business, but if we learn anything new, we'll be sure to let you know.
hyconn-update-shark-tank-season-2.title: HyConn update | S2

hydromax-hydration-system-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Hydromax Update

Our Hydromax update shows that Chris’ deal with Jeff never happened. Despite this, the company is doing well.

The product is now being used by players on the Dallas Cowboys, the San Diego Chargers, and at Pop Warner High School. They're also used by several colleges.

Further, their yearly revenue is reported to be $2 million. You can check the system out on the Hydromax website. There's even an endorsement there by Sammy Davis.
hydromax-hydration-system-update-shark-t.title: Hydromax update | S2

i-want-to-draw-a-cat-for-you-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank I Want to Draw a Cat for You Update

Our I Want to Draw a Cat for You update reveals that the company finally enjoyed great success after appearing on Shark Tank. Steve finally got to pay Mark back, and did so many cat drawings that he basically started experiencing cramps.

After a while, he took a break from cat drawings to focus on his TV show, but has since returned to the original business. You can check out the drawings and purchase your own on the I Want to Draw a Cat for You website.

Evidently, his service is so popular, that he is actually booked out a year in advance. He now charges $25 per drawing.
i-want-to-draw-a-cat-for-you-shark-tank-.title: I Want to Draw a Cat for You update | S3

ic-pooch-monitoring-system-update-shark-.body:
Shark Tank iC Pooch Update

We have sad news to share in our iC Pooch update. Unfortunately the company was forced out of business in 2021.Despite going out of business, Brooke Martin went on to improve her career in a variety of impressive positions after she graduated. This will be our final iC Pooch update.
ic-pooch-monitoring-system-update-shark-.title: iC Pooch Update

ice-age-meals-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Ice Age Meals Update

Our Ice Age Meals update found that the company faced a tough loss of $500,000 in October 2021, which ultimately led to the closure of their kitchen in November 2022.

Despite the challenges, Nick didn't back down. He reached out to his customers for support, and their response made a real difference.

By early 2023, Ice Age Meals consolidated its operations into a single facility, which improved efficiency in both production and shipping.

Nick also expanded into new territory with the launch of Ice Age Culinary.

Our Ice Age Meals update found that the company now offers virtual cooking classes.

This includes a popular 21-Day Culinary Challenge that teaches participants to make paleo-friendly dishes in under 21 minutes.

This shift, along with new products like paleo jerky and spice blends, helped the business regain its footing.

At the time of this writing, Ice Age Meals has grown to around $4 million in annual revenue—double its revenue before its appearance on Shark Tank.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we are calling this Ice Age Meals update a success.
ice-age-meals-update-season-8.title: Ice Age Meals Update | Shark Tank S8 - Shark Tank Recap

ice-chips-candy-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Ice Chips Update

We have great news to report in our Ice Chips update! Although the deal with Barbara and Mark never closed, exposure from the show led to over $300,000 in additional sales. This allowed the ladies to purchase machinery, and speed up production time. As of 2023, Ice Chips remains in business, with an estimated annual revenue of $5 million. The candy can be purchased on the Ice Chips website, and on Amazon.
ice-chips-candy-update-season-4.title: Ice Chips Update | S4

ice-shaker-bottle-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
**Shark Tank Ice Shaker Update **

Since appearing on Shark Tank and securing investment from Mark Cuban and Alex Rodriguez, Ice Shaker has increased its product offerings to include 140 different bottles in a variety of colors and sizes.

Their bottles are sold in many Lifetime Fitness and Vitamin Shoppe locations, as well as in over 3,500 GNC stores.

Our Ice Shaker update revealed that the company received a follow-up segment on Shark Tank Season 10, Episode 6, with Alex Rodriguez returning as a guest shark.

The update shared that the company had grown to over $3 million in sales within 12 months of appearing on Shark Tank. Further, they recently launched on Amazon, which has helped get the brand in front of millions of customers.

Our Ice Shark update research also found that Chris Gronkowski's brother, Rob, bought out Alex Rodriguez's shares for an undisclosed amount.

Things are looking good for the Gronkowskis, so we can't wait to bring you the latest in our next Ice Shaker update.
ice-shaker-bottle-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Ice Shaker Bottle Update | S9

icybreeze-air-conditioner-cooler-update-.body:
Shark Tank IcyBreeze Update

IcyBreeze is one of the few companies to appear on the show that actually takes the sharks’ advice. Research for our IcyBreeze update revealed that they lowered the price of their coolers after the show. The cooler continues to do well, but IcyBreeze was sold in 2018. These three owners no longer have the company, but revenue is still at about $3.6 million yearly.

IcyBreeze coolers seem to be experiencing some supply shortages and issues, and only some of the products are available from their website this year. However, they are expected to restock soon. You can purchase your own cooler at the IcyBreeze website.
icybreeze-air-conditioner-cooler-update-.title: IcyBreeze Update | S7

ifork-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank iFork Update

Our iFork update reveals the deal with Barbara didn't materialize. However, the company is still in business.

At the time of writing, iFork is only available on its website, and its social media accounts have been inactive since 2018.

Kyle's LinkedIn profile references his Shark Tank appearance, but he no longer lists the company's ownership.

Despite this, our iFork update found that its LinkedIn page indicates the business is still operational, with an estimated revenue of $93,000.

It seems like iFork is just a part-time gig for Kyle.

Since June 2019, Kyle has focused on a new venture, The Incubator (The Incc), a multicultural media and social networking platform slated to launch in Fall 2021.

However, as of August 2023, the platform hasn't launched.

In March 2023, he revamped the iFork website to feature a new stainless steel line, but the Facebook page remains inactive.

Regardless of these challenges, the stainless steel products are available for purchase on the iFork website.

We will be sure to let you know if we get any additional iFork update news.
ifork-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: iFork Utensil Update | S9

illumibowl-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank IllumiBowl Update

An IllumiBowl update segment during Season 8 revealed that the company is still doing the best it can. Despite competing products on the market, they are making up to $2 million in yearly revenue. The price for the product was reduced shortly after airing, and the entrepreneurs report that Kevin is involved with the entire process.

You can purchase a toilet night light on the IllumiBowl website.
illumibowl-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: IllumiBowl Update | S7

ilumi-light-bulbs-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank iLumi Update

Now let’s get to that iLumi update. The company has been successful in the many years since appearing on Shark Tank. Bluetooth technology continues to evolve, and the company found other IoT applications for Bluetooth connectivity, which they license to manufacturers. In 2019, the company changed its name to MeshTek, and have an estimated revenue of $6 million. Products are available on the MeshTek website and on Amazon.
ilumi-light-bulbs-update-shark-tank-seas.title: iLumi Update | S5

inchbug-juice-box-holder-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank InchBug Update

Our InchBug update reveals that Brenda’s company has been thriving since her appearance on Shark Tank. She has gone into some independent shops but doesn’t seem to have pursued huge retail deals.

The MyDrinky is currently being sold at $10.95 on the Inchbug website. Brenda has also launched Orbit Label 2.0 which improves on the original product and is making an estimated $5 million in annual sales.

When we get more news on an InchBug update we will be sure to let you know!
inchbug-juice-box-holder-update-shark-ta.title: InchBug Update | S7

inirv-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Inirv Update

Our Inirv update has some interesting developments. Since airing, the company received a significant media boost, which brought interest and feedback.

However, in 2018, a dispute arose with their prototype manufacturer, leading to a lawsuit and countersuit. However, they settled eventually.

The COVID-19 pandemic further delayed their plans, but the team used this time to improve their logistics.

By 2021, they rebranded as Ome and secured $3 million in additional funding by early 2022.

Ome's smart stove knobs are remote-controlled via app or voice with Alexa and are now a reality.

In March 2024, they launched the second-generation product with enhanced features and more color options at a major industry show.

At the time of our Inirv update, products retail for $399 for a four-pack and are available on their website, which includes a compatibility checker.

Ome is expanding into the AgeTech industry, developing solutions for senior living communities with their platform, Amity, for remote stove management.

They are also venturing into BBQ with an automatic shut-off knob for outdoor grills and seeking partnerships with appliance manufacturers.

Ranjith and Akshita have received numerous awards, including being named one of Exeleon Magazine's Top 100 Dynamic Leaders.

Their estimated lifetime revenue is currently around $6.1 million.

It'll be interesting to see what the future holds for both entrepreneurs in our next Inirv update.
inirv-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Inirv Update | S9

ink-flip-printer-ink-refill-program-upda.body:
Shark Tank Ink Flip Update

Our Ink Flip update research found that the company struggled to stay afloat due to intense competition.

Shortly after the episode aired, Ink Flip went out of business in 2011. As of this writing, Andy Sperry is now the Chief Operating Officer at Queen of the Thrones, according to his LinkedIn page.

This is our final Ink Flip update.
ink-flip-printer-ink-refill-program-upda.title: Ink Flip Update | S1

innovation-pet-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Innovation Pet Update

Despite some great work by Daymond and some major success, it’s bad news for our Innovation Pet update. In 2020, the company claimed bankruptcy, and all of its assets were auctioned off.

The company is no longer in business. It’s a shame following their success, too. This will be our final Innovation Pet update.
innovation-pet-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Innovation Pet Update | S7

insta-fire-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Insta-Fire Update

We've got great news to share! A segment in Season 8, revealed that the deal with Mark and Lori went well, and they’ve been able to purchase the new packing machines they needed. Our Insta-Fire update research revealed that in 2022, they were making over $4 million in annual revenue.

You can find Insta-Fire on Amazon or on the official website.
insta-fire-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Insta-Fire Update | S7

instant-lifts-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank Instant Lifts Update

Our Instant Lifts update shows that the company continues to be in business today. Nick and Penelope eventually rebranded their products, and focused on a clearer approach.

The products are being sold by retailers, including Amazon, and 35 Walmart locations. They can be found on the Instant Lifts website.

According to the website, they've sold over 1 million Instant Lifts to date!

If we learn anything new about this company, we will certainly let you know. In the meantime, you can check out our other company updates from Season 3 Episode 9, by following the links below!
instant-lifts-shark-tank-season-3.title: Instant Lifts Update | S3

intelli-stopper-wine-stopper-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank Intelli-Stopper Update

Now that we know how the pitch went, let's get an update. In an interview following the show, Chase said the company had a huge spike in sales, and were even contacted by a potential investor. Despite this, the company is no longer in business in 2023. This will be our final Intelli-Stopper update!
intelli-stopper-wine-stopper-update-shar.title: Intelli-Stopper Update | S5

invis-a-rack-truck-bed-rack-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Invis-a-Rack Update

Our Invis-a Rack update reveals that Donny became a popular figure among Americans, thanks to his patriotic stance. The company grew and exclusive licensing rights were acquired by Dee Zee Inc.

You can check out the Invis-a-Rack products on the Dee Zee Inc. website. The Invis-a-Rack is also available on Amazon.

If you'd like to get your own Invis-a-Rack, they sell for anywhere between $800-$1200.
invis-a-rack-truck-bed-rack-shark-tank-s.title: Invis-a-Rack update | S3

invisiplug-surge-protectors-update-shark.body: We have pretty shocking news to share. Initially, the product had great sales, with a run on QVC and it also retailed in Target, Staples, and on Amazon. Sadly, things took a bad turn for the company in 2016. Mike threatened someone outside of his home with a semi-automatic handgun, and was charged with assault, and the company went under shortly thereafter. This will be our final Invisiplug update.
invisiplug-surge-protectors-update-shark.title: Invisiplug Update | S5

ionic-ear-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Ionic Ear Update

Our research on the Ionic Ear update revealed that it was one of the most bizarre pitches on Shark Tank.

As expected, the idea never took off.

Moreover, the surgically implanted Bluetooth device concept faced immediate skepticism, with Barbara Corcoran saying it was the "creepiest" pitch she'd ever seen.

Post-show, the idea failed to secure investment and never moved beyond development.

By 2013, the business had vanished, with Darin disappearing from the public eye.

Furthermore, our Ionic Ear update found that Darin scrapped the idea after his appearance on Shark Tank, as there have been no updates or progress.

Our research on the Ionic Ear update revealed that the company never launched a website, performed any surgeries, or sold the product.

Unfortunately, this looks to be our final Ionic Ear update.
ionic-ear-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Ionic Ear Update | S1

iretron-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank iReTron Update

Our research revealed some dissapointing news. It turns out that the deal with Mark and Barbara never finalized. Online sources report the business shut down in 2019. According to Jason’s LinkedIn page, he left his job as a manager for a virtual healthcare company in September 2022, and is now a surfer. This will be our final iReTron update.
iretron-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: iReTron Update | S5

islide-custom-sandals-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank ISlide Update

After airing on Shark Tank, ISlide quickly scored licensing deals with big names like DC Comics, the NBA, MLB, and Nickelodeon, pushing the company's valuation to $10 million by 2019.

However, like many businesses, our ISlide update found that the company faced serious challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The disruption to supply chains and the cancellation of sports events took a heavy toll on sales.

Despite these setbacks, ISlide made a strong comeback by mid-2021, regaining its footing with $9 million in annual revenue.

Our ISlide update found that by 2023, the company was back to $10 million in sales, driven by creative new designs like gel and fur soles and an expanded product line that now includes robes, socks, and hats.

Founder Justin Kittredge remains actively involved in steering the brand, with a strong focus on social media engagement.

At the time of writing, ISlide has partnered with Perfect Game to create custom slides for youth sports, continuing to grow and innovate in the market.

We're calling this a success and can't wait to bring you our next ISlide update.
islide-custom-sandals-update-season-8.title: ISlide Update | Shark Tank S8

jacksons-honest-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Jackson's Honest Update

Sadly, the couple's son, Jackson, passed away three months before their episode aired.

This tragic loss spurred the couple to rebrand their business in 2018, honoring Jackson's memory by naming it Jackson's - the Super Snack. They also introduced grain-free puffs to the product line.

The deal with Rohan eventually closed, and he helped them introduce the Japanese heirloom sweet potato chips. In 2019, they started distributing to food service providers.

In August 2021, our Jackson's Honest update research found that they opened their own production facility in Muskego, Wisconsin, which produces 110 bags of chips per minute.

At this point, they are now focused on making just sweet potato chips with coconut oil. The rest of their line is now made with avocado oil.

You can purchase Jackson's sweet potato chips on their website in several different sizes and flavors, like Carolina BBQ, Sea Salt, Spicy Tomatillo, and Unsalted.

You may be able to find the chips at Wal-Mart or other grocery stores in your area.

In late 2021, the family moved to Crested Butte, CO, and launched a program called "Everyday Heroes" that showcases kids making a positive impact in their communities.

By August 2023, their product became available in every Whole Foods location and offered over 25 unique flavors. The business currently boasts an annual revenue exceeding $16 million.

The Reamer family business is gradually becoming a household sensation, and we can't wait to bring you our next Jackson's Honest update.
jacksons-honest-update-shark-tank-season.title: Jackson’s Honest Update | S9

jarrett-raja-productions-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank Jarrett & Raja Productions Update

Research for our Jarrett & Raja Productions update revealed that exposure the company received from Shark Tank allowed them to attract the interest of other producers. Miracles became One Epic Night, which appeared in several venues, one of which was in Las Vegas.

The performers also appeared on several TV shows, and continued to headline gigs in Las Vegas. Following the interruption of the pandemic, they are now back to performing a show called, Magic & Music at Stratosphere.

You can check out what they’re up to on the Jarret & Raja Productions website.
jarrett-raja-productions-update-shark-ta.title: Jarrett & Raja Productions Update | S7

jeska-shoe-company-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Jeska Shoe Company Update

The deal with Daymond did finalize, but Jeska Shoe Company did not last very long after the episode aired. By October 2014, Jessica posted a letter on Facebook announcing that she was closing the business for good due to “diminishing returns.” As of January 2023, Jeska Shoe Company remains shuttered and the products are not for sale. This will be our final Jeska Shoe Company update.
jeska-shoe-company-update-season-4.title: Jeska Shoe Company Update | S4

joes-fish-fry-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Joe's Gourmet Fish Fry Update

Our Joe's Gourmet Fish Fry update reveals that the deal with Daymond fell through.

However, the business continued to thrive, with orders surging shortly after their episode aired.

In May 2018, they launched a gluten-free fish fry mix on Good Morning America, which led to a boost in sales.

By October 2018, their fish fry mix was used in Stop & Shop's seafood department fry program. By the end of the year, their products were sold in over 2,500 grocery stores.

In 2019, our Joe's Gourmet Fish Fry update found that they began selling frozen Southern fried shrimp on QVC, which later became available in grocery stores throughout the Midwest, South, and Southeast.

Later that year, they opened Joe's Gourmet Fish and Chicken in Lithia Springs, Georgia, and followed with a second location in College Park in 2021.

However, it appears that the second location is closed now.

In 2021, our Joe's Gourmet Fish Fry update found that they partnered with Walmart to offer restaurant franchises within Walmart locations.

Despite reports of $5 million in annual revenue in 2022, there have been recent signs of a slowdown.

At the time of writing, products are available on the website but are unavailable on Amazon and Walmart.

We will keep you posted with any additional Joe's Gourmet Fish Fry updates.
joes-fish-fry-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Joe's Gourmet Fish Fry Update | S9

jolly-rogers-telephone-co-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Jolly Rogers Telephone Update

The company’s growth hasn’t really taken shape since its appearance on Shark Tank in Season 10. Its website is still online and is occasionally updated but there doesn’t seem to be any major sign that anything has changed since the company's appearance on Shark Tank. It seems like its growth is relatively stagnant and there’s no clear indication of whether that will change anytime soon.
jolly-rogers-telephone-co-update-shark-t.title: Jolly Rogers Telephone Co. Update | S10

jones-scones-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Jones Scones Update

Unfortunately, things didn't work out for J. or Jones Scones. In 2018, he shut the doors for good and returned to practicing law. Jones Scones is out of business. Sometimes that’s just the way the cookie crumbles. This will be our final Jones Scones update.
jones-scones-update-season-4.title: Jones Scones Update | S4

jumpforward-college-athlete-recruitment-.body:
Shark Tank JumpForward Update

Our JumpForward update research found that the deal with Kevin O'Leary and Robert Herjavec didn't materialize.

Despite the setback, JumpForward expanded its offerings by developing a mobile app to complement its web-based platform, which significantly boosted its reach.

Serving over 150 college athletic departments in the U.S, JumpForward achieved a remarkable 99% annual subscription renewal rate.

Our JumpForward update found that Active Network acquired the company in 2016 for an undisclosed amount, marking the founders' successful exit.

At the time of writing, Brian is the founder and CEO of Livly, a property management company.

At the same time, Adam became the Chief Product Officer at the real estate company Vantaca, LLC.

This marks the end of our JumpForward update.
jumpforward-college-athlete-recruitment-.title: JumpForward Update | S1

jungle-jumparoo-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Jungle Jumparoo Update

We have great news to share! Research for our Jungle Jumparoo update revealed that the company has managed to stay in business since the show aired.

Unfortunately, the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission issued a recall on all of the yellow-colored poles that were used for the Jungle Jumparoo from November 2018 through March 2019 due to high levels of lead.

However, Rachel and Steve have been flexible and have worked to issue refunds and new poles for customers that were impacted.

Despite this, they are currently generating a little under $4 million per year in gross revenue.

You can check out their products and get your own Jumparoo on the Jungle Jumparoo website.
jungle-jumparoo-update-shark-tank-season.title: Jungle Jumparoo Update | S6

kalyx-technologies-sports-bras-update-sh.body:
Shark Tank Kalyx Technologies Update

Shortly after airing, despite initial setbacks of not securing a deal, Kimberly raised three times as much from investors as she requested from the sharks and sold 4,000 units.

Our Kalyx Technologies update research found that Kimberly raised over $500,000 in venture capital and angel investments.

From 2008 to 2012, the company saw year-over-year growth in sales and revenues, expanding into high-profile gyms, yoga studios, and boutiques such as Equinox, Yoga Works, and Montage Resorts.

Kalyx products were also sold online through retailers like Hautelook and in boutiques worldwide, including Australia, Europe, the UK, and South America.

In addition, Kalyx's sports bras received several awards, including Health Magazine's 2011 Gear Awards for Best New Apres Fitness Jacket and Glamour Magazine's 2009 Best New Sports Bra.

Celebrities like Jennifer Aniston and Kate Hudson endorsed the products, which appeared in numerous magazines.

Based on our Kalyx Technologies update research, ActivewearUSA acquired the company in 2012.

At the time of writing, Kimberly holds a senior marketing and operations executive position with The Adzi Agency and continues to support entrepreneurial endeavors through Luna Startup Labs and TEDxPearlStreet.

This will be our final Kalyx Technologies Update.
kalyx-technologies-sports-bras-update-sh.title: Kalyx Technologies Update | S1

kane-couture-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank Kane & Couture Update

We have sad news to share in our Kane & Couture update. The company is no longer in business, however, some of the products can still be found on various online retailer websites, but their website is no longer running. This will be our final Kane & Couture update.
kane-couture-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: Kane & Couture Update | S5

kazam-balance-bike-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank KaZAM Update

Research for our KaZAM update revealed great news! An update segment during Season 5 of Shark Tank, shared that Mary Beth and KaZAM sold over $1.5 million within months of the investment.
