Our Raising Wild update found that the partnership with Barbara Corcoran closed successfully.

Within just eight months, the brand expanded its product line and had already hit $400,000 in sales.

Barbara played a crucial role as a mentor, helping the sisters navigate the business world without compromising their creative vision.

The company expanded into kids' swimwear in November 2022 and later introduced matching sets for moms and their little ones.

Our Raising Wild update found that the company has surpassed $25 million in lifetime sales.

While its social media has been quiet since June 2023, products are still available online.

At the time of writing, the sisters are now leading more independently, though Barbara's team continues to offer support when needed.

If you want to purchase a Raising Wild swimsuit, you can check out the full collection on the official website.

We are calling this Raising Wild update a success.
raising-wild-update-season-8.title: Raising Wild Update | S8

rapid-ramen-cooker-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Rapid Ramen Cooker Update

We have great news to report in our Rapid Ramen Cooker update. Our research uncovered that this product has gone onto become a top seller in Amazon’s microwave accessories category.  The company eventually became Rapid Brands, and is estimated to have earned a whopping $55 million. Products are available on the Rapid Brands website, as well as on Amazon.
rapid-ramen-cooker-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Rapid Ramen Cooker Update | S5

rareform-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank RareForm Update

Our RareForm update found that the deal with Kevin O’Leary closed successfully. Moreover, shortly after its episode aired, the company received an immediate boost.

Just in the weekend following their episode, online orders shot up to 50% of their total online business from the previous year.

Building on this momentum, the company projected annual revenues to reach $5 million.

Originally focused on surfboard bags, RareForm soon expanded its product line to include backpacks, duffel bags, wallets, tote bags, cooler bags, and accessories.

Additionally, To support this growth, the company added a second facility in Nashville, ensuring they could keep up with demand and streamline operations.

Our RareForm update research found that the company formed partnerships with major billboard companies, allowing them to recycle 80% of billboard material across the U.S.

Furthermore, they repurposed around 20,000 pounds of vinyl each month, preventing it from ending up in landfills and staying true to their sustainability goals.

We can't wait for another exciting RareForm update.
rareform-update-season-8.title: Rareform Bags Update | S8

readerest-glasses-holder-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank ReadeRest Specsecure Update

Our ReadeRest update reveals that the partnership between Lori and Rick was a huge triumph. The product was featured on QVC and immediately sold out.

By the end of 2012, they had $6 million in sales. The company is still a hit today, making around $5 million in annual revenue.

You can find their offerings on the ReadeRest website, and also on Amazon. The company also now sells readers.

ReadeRest has gone on to also be featured by Forbes, and Good Morning America.

If we learn anything new about the company, we will certainly let you know. In the meantime, you can check out our other company updates from Season 3 Episode 6.
readerest-glasses-holder-shark-tank-seas.title: ReadeRest update | S3

recharj-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Recharj Update

Our Recharj update found that the company is no longer in business.

Shortly after airing, Daniel shifted his focus to offering meditation sessions and corporate events, including on-site sessions for entire companies or buildings.

The 2020 pandemic presented a significant challenge, forcing Daniel to shut down the physical studio to prioritize health concerns.

To maintain continuity, Recharj pivoted to virtual meditation sessions. By June 2021, our Recharj update found that the physical studio's closure became permanent.

During the pandemic, Recharj continued to offer private sessions and expanded its work with government contracts and corporate clients.

However, by May 2022, the Recharj website had become inactive, and social media updates had ceased.

In August 2022, Daniel officially shut down Recharj. After shutting down the business, he went on to become a managing partner at Synergy Federal Services.

Sadly, it looks like this will be our final Recharj update.
recharj-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Recharj Update | S9

reely-hooked-fish-co-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Reely Hooked Fish Co. Update

Unfortunately, despite the deal with Mark Cuban going through, our research revealed that Reely Hooked Fish Co. has gone out of business.

After airing, our Reely Hooked Fish Co. update found that = they sold their smoked fish dip in small stores across Florida for a while but struggled to grow.

Further, shipping the fresh fish was a big challenge, so they focused on collecting names and emails until they could fix this issue.

Their last social media posts were in 2019, and their website is no longer active.

Steven Markley's LinkedIn profile shows he started a pool service company called Pools Next Door in July 2019, but it closed in November 2022.

There is no update on the other owner, James Arcaro.

This looks to be the final Reely Hooked Fish Co. update.
reely-hooked-fish-co-update-shark-tank-s.title: Reely Hooked Fish Co. Update | S9

remyxx-rekixx-sneakers-update-shark-tank.body:
Shark Tank Remyxx ReKixx Update

Our Remyxx ReKixx Sneakers update shows that the deal with Daymond never happened, but he did advise Gary. It turns out, that Daymond didn't want Gary to have to give up so much of the company afterall.

With Daymond's advice, Gary raised money through Kickstarter. Because of that, the business continued for awhile, and he enjoyed $40,000 in sales. However, he ultimately had to close it down in 2019. This will be our final Remyxx ReKixx update.
remyxx-rekixx-sneakers-update-shark-tank.title: Remyxx ReKixx Update | S3

rent-a-goat-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank Rent A Goat Update

We have great news to share in our Rent A Goat update! We were thrilled to find that Mike, Matt, and the goats are still hard at work, all these years later. The Rent A Goat website currently lists two large service areas: one in Northern California and one in Southern California. Mike is serving as Director of Operations for the company, and Matt is CEO.
rent-a-goat-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: Rent A Goat Update | S5

rent-a-grandma-babysitting-service-shark.body:
Shark Tank Rent-a-Grandma Update

Our Rent-a-Grandma update reveals Todd’s business continues to operate today, despite the lack of enthusiasm from the sharks. Additionally, company offers many more services than it initially had. Besides child care, they have grandma's who provide senior care, tutoring, pet care, housekeeping, cooking, and much more.

AARP Bulletin, ABC News, Los Angeles Times, and more have even featured the company.

You can check them all out on the Rent-a-Grandma website.

If we learn anything new about this company, we will certainly let you know. In the meantime, you can check out our other company updates from Season 3 Episode 8 by following the links below!
rent-a-grandma-babysitting-service-shark.title: Rent-a-Grandma Update | S3

rent-like-a-champion-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Rent Like A Champion Update

Rent Like A Champion is still a hit! An update in Season 8 revealed that the company had expanded its services to golf tournaments and NASCAR shows.

There are options to rent in 27 college towns. While the pandemic made a small dent in their profits, research for our Rent Like A Champion update revealed $12.6 million in annual revenue in 2022.

You can find more about these big game vacation rentals (whether you’re interested in renting or renting out your home) on the Rent Like A Champion website.
rent-like-a-champion-update-shark-tank-s.title: Rent Like A Champion Update | S7

rethink-anti-cyberbullying-app-update-se.body:
Shark Tank ReThink Update

Our ReThink update revealed that the deal with Lori Greiner and Mark Cuban never materialized, but that didn't stop Trisha from pushing forward with her business idea.

In 2020, while still at Harvard, she secured a $300,000 grant from the Elevate Prize Foundation, which allowed her to continue developing the app.

ReThink had grown to over 5 million users in 2021, earning Trisha a spot on Forbes' 30 Under 30 list.

Additionally, the app expanded in 2022, reaching 16 Caribbean countries and introducing French and Dutch language support.

Despite some mixed reviews, our ReThink update found that the company has established new partnerships with schools, law enforcement, and other organizations to combat cyberbullying.

Even after being selected as a Rhodes Scholar in 2021 and moving to England, Trisha continues to lead the company.

In 2023, ReThink Citizens, the company's nonprofit branch, received $50,000 from the Archewell Foundation to support its Caribbean efforts.

At the time of writing, Trisha's net worth is estimated at $2 million, and ReThink is still available on both major app stores.

It's great to see that things worked out well for Trisha, and we hope that our next ReThink update will be even better.
rethink-anti-cyberbullying-app-update-se.title: ReThink Anti-Cyberbullying App Update | S8 - Shark Tank Recap

revestor-search-engine-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank ReVestor Update

We have interesting news to share in our ReVestor update. Bill went on to restructure his plan, and sell directly to investors looking for rental properties. To fund it, he started a mortgage company called Griffin Funding, which as of 2021, was responsible for $5 million in annual revenue. ReVestor, with this new influx of cash, was able to build infrastructure and launch, but it is only available in the San Diego area.
revestor-search-engine-update-season-4.title: ReVestor Update | S4

reviver-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Reviver Update

Research for our Reviver update revealed that the product is currently still available on Amazon, but it is unclear if the company is still in business. A company website cannot be found and social media accounts have not been active for a number of years.

It seems like Ben and Eric have decided to close up shop and are just selling off their remaining inventory. However, we will keep an eye on it and if we get more news on a Reviver update, we will let you know!
reviver-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Reviver Update | S6

revolights-bicycle-lights-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Revolights Update

We have sad news to share. Though the company had many great years, and it was very popular in the cycling community, Kent called it quits in 2019. He told fans in an announcement that for personal and professional reasons, the company was shutting down. This will be our final Revolights update.
revolights-bicycle-lights-update-shark-t.title: Revolights Update | S5

rewardstock-app-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Rewardstock Update

We have great news to share in our Rewardstock update. In November of 2020, Jon sold the company to Experian.

Although the sale was a 100% cash deal, the amount of the sale has not been made public. However, it appears that Mark and Jon decided that this was ultimately the best course of action for Rewardstock.

With the sale of the company, social media ceased to be updated, and no website can be found.

While we don't know exactly how things worked out, it's safe to say that Jon has been able to move on to other passions for now. However, this will be our final Rewardstock update.
rewardstock-app-update-shark-tank-season.title: Rewardstock Update | S10

ride-on-carry-on-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Ride-On Carry-On Update

Our Ride-On Carry-On update reveals that the deal with Barbara went through, and the company enjoyed success for a few years. However, in 2023 the company is no longer in business.

Barbara recouped her investment easily and the company continued to thrive a few years after Shark Tank.

In 2019, Ride-On Carry-On created a line of travel items and rebranded to SitAlong Toddler Luggage Seat. It was then picked up by a brand called Think King and had an annual revenue of $1 million.

Unfortunately, it has since disappeared from social media and its website is no longer in use. It's unclear why, but it seems that this will be our final Ride-On Carry-On update.
ride-on-carry-on-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Ride-On Carry-On Update | S2

rinsekit-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank RinseKit Update

Our RinseKit update found that the deal with Daymond John successfully closed.

RinseKit introduced new models in 2020, including a heated shower that plugs into a car’s cigarette lighter and portable shower systems like the 1.5-gallon POD and the battery-powered 4.5-gallon PRO PAK.

Sales remained strong, with Chris Crawford sharing that RinseKit had been pulling in around $1.5 million annually.

By June 2022, their annual revenue had climbed to $1.8 million, and their products were available in over 600 retailers, including big names like REI, Target, Home Depot, and Amazon.

Beyond financial success, our RinseKit update found that the company also focused on giving back to the community.

RinseKit partnered with DigDeep, a nonprofit that provides clean running water to underserved American communities.

Moreover, customers can even add a donation at checkout, making it easy to support the cause.

We’re calling this RinseKit update a success.
rinsekit-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: RinseKit Update | S8

robin-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Robin Update

Since appearing on Shark Tank, Robin's business setup has changed dramatically. In July 2019, the company was acquired by The Fahey Group, an Ohio-based holdings group.

Our research indicates that Justin and Bart are not listed on the website's team or investor sections, suggesting they may have sold their entire ownership stake in the company.

In September 2020, Robin unveiled a new guidance system to improve the robots' ability to maneuver in tight spaces.

By December 2020, they entered into a partnership agreement with TurfBot Mowing, a lawn care franchise.

This partnership established a subscription business model (Robots as a Service) aimed at lawn care companies.

These companies pay a monthly fee to use Robin's products and receive additional support. The subscription model offers various levels for different additional services.

In 2020, our Robin update found that they hired 40 landscaping companies. By 2021, they planned to sell to 150 mid-market landscapers and install 1,000 residential units.

In August 2022, the company rebranded to MowBot.

Since airing on Shark Tank, MowBot has grown to over $7.3 million in annual revenue.

Despite not getting a deal in the tank, we'd call this Robin update a success.
robin-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Robin Update | S9

rock-bands-jewelry-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Rock Bands Update

Unfortunately, our Rock Bands update isn’t totally positive. After the show aired, the deal never closed, and Lee eventually retired the Rock Bands website.

During our Rock Bands update research, we found that his bracelets are still sold on the Lee Dahlberg website, where he also sells a line of custom, refurbished furniture called “Son of a Bench.”

Between Rock Bands, Son of a Bench, his work as a comedian, and a modeling career, Lee Dahlberg is estimated to be worth approximately $17 million.
rock-bands-jewelry-update-season-4.title: Rock Bands Update | S4

rocketbook-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Rocketbook Update

Our Rocketbook update revealed that the company expanded its product line to online giants like Amazon and prominent retail chains such as Best Buy, Office Depot, Staples, and Target.

Further, by December 2018, the company had sold over 500,000 notebooks and generated more than $10 million in revenue.

In 2020, the company reported net sales of $32 million, reflecting a remarkable 35% year-over-year increase.

In December of that year, BIC bought Rocketbook for $40 million.

The goal was to combine BIC's experience in making writing tools with Rocketbook's digital notebook technology.

Following the acquisition, co-founders Joe Lemay and Jake Epstein remained at the helm, focusing on product development and further expanding the brand's market presence.

Our research into the Rocketbook update found that the company now operates as a subsidiary of BIC.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we are calling this Rocketbook update a success.
rocketbook-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Rocketbook Cloud Notebook Update | S8

rokblok-by-pink-donut-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank RokBlok Update

Unfortunately, our RokBlok update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec fell through.

While the exact reason is unclear, our research suggests he might have been worried about competition from a similar product called Soundwagon.

Since appearing on Shark Tank, RokBlok quickly gained popularity. It sold out within four hours of its episode airing, and sales jumped from around 15 units per day to hundreds.

In September 2019, RokBlok secured a utility patent and partnered with major retailers like Walmart and West Elm.

Our RokBlok update found that its rapid growth brought challenges. Negative reviews surfaced, especially about audio quality, and the company struggled to meet demand.

To address this, Logan allowed customers to reserve RokBlok with a 10% discount during stock shortages.

Despite these setbacks, RokBlok bounced back.

Logan fixed customer issues and released the improved RokBlok 1.5, which resolved audio problems and enhanced the stylus, Bluetooth, and speaker capabilities.

The latest model, RokBlok 2.0, is now available, and the company is valued at $5 million.

Now that Logan has worked out some of the kinks, we are excited about where our next RokBlok update will take us!
rokblok-by-pink-donut-update-shark-tank-.title: RokBlok Update | S9

romp-n-roll-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Romp n' Roll Update

Our Romp n’ Roll update found that shortly after its episode aired, the company expanded to nine U.S. locations and opened its first international franchise in 2009.

Furthermore, Romp n' Roll expanded to over 300 centers in China in 2016.

At the time of writing our Romp n' Roll update, the company operates 95 international franchises, including locations in China and South Korea.

With plans to add 10 to 15 new franchisees each year, they are focusing on both U.S. and international markets.

Our research on the Romp n’ Roll update revealed that the company currently generates approximately $4 million in annual revenue.

We call this Romp n' Roll update a success.
romp-n-roll-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Romp n' Roll Update | S1

roominate-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Roominate Update

In the months after the episode aired, the Roominate expanded rapidly into a variety of stores, with some of their sets still being available on Walmart.com and on Amazon.

In 2016, PlayMonster bought out Roominate and Alice and Bettina exited the business. This will be our final Roominate update.
roominate-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Roominate Update | S6

rootsuit-fan-wear-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Rootsuit Update

Rootsuit enjoyed some success following the episode airing, but it was short-lived. It’s unclear how well Colin and Rootsuit did during its run, but the business shuttered in 2016 and ceased operations. Today in 2023, they remain out of business. This will be our final Rootsuit update.
rootsuit-fan-wear-update-season-4.title: Rootsuit Update | S4

rounder-bum-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Rounder Bum Update

Our research on the Rounder Bum update reveals that Kevin O'Leary successfully closed the deal.

Shortly after airing on Shark Tank, Rounde rBum experienced immediate success.

Kevin honored his agreement by actively promoting the products on his social media channels, significantly boosting their visibility.

As a result, the company's sales skyrocketed, making Rounder Bum the fourth best-selling men's underwear on Amazon.

By May 2022, they were generating $3 million in annual revenue.

According to our Rounder Bum update research, the company has since expanded its product line.

It now includes boxers, boxer briefs, trunks, briefs, jocks, thongs, shirts, and accessories for men. All products are available for purchase on the Rounder Bum website.

Clearly, the deal with Mr. Wonderful was fruitful and cemented Rounder Bum's market presence, leaving room for further growth.

Our next Rounder Bum update promises to be an exciting one.
rounder-bum-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Rounder Bum Update | S9

ruckpack-nutrition-shot-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank RuckPack Update

We have great news to share in our RuckPack update! After the deal closed, the company increased exponentially, peaking just above $500,000 in revenue. They then secured a deal with Walgreens, and in 2016, RuckPack partnered with The GHT Companies. In 2023, revenue is estimated to be in the millions. Products are available on the RuckPack website.
ruckpack-nutrition-shot-update-season-4.title: RuckPack Update | S4

rufflebutts-kids-clothing-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank RuffleButts Update

Research for our Rufflebutts update revealed that the deal with Lori was never finalized, but the company is still thriving in 2023 and has an estimated yearly revenue of $7 million. Products available on the RuffleButts website, at Nordstrom, and on Amazon, among other retailers.
rufflebutts-kids-clothing-update-shark-t.title: RuffleButts Update | S5

rugged-maniac-races-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Rugged Maniac Update

We have great news to share in our Rugged Maniac update! Shortly after their episode aired, the company’s sales surpassed $10 million. In early 2018, New Media Investment Group bought 80% of the company for $10.4 million, and they continue to run it today. You can find out more on the Rugged Maniac website.
rugged-maniac-races-update-shark-tank-se.title: Rugged Maniac Update | S5

rumi-spice-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Rumi Spice Update

Our Rumi Spice update found that the deal with Mark Cuban did not close. We know this firsthand because we did not find the company in Mark’s investment portfolio.

However, despite this, Rumi Spice has been featured in various publications, including Forbes.

Most notably, Rumi Spice products are now available in Whole Foods Market stores across the United States.

In 2018, the founders appointed Patti Doyle as CEO to manage the company's operations.

This strategic move allowed the entrepreneurs to focus on other critical business areas, including product development and market expansion.

Later that year, in December 2018, Rumi Spice secured a $2.5 million Series A investment from InFrontier, a prominent venture capital firm.

This funding played a crucial role in expanding their product line and scaling their operations to meet growing demand.

While the company has not disclosed specific sales figures, estimates suggest that Rumi Spice generates approximately $5 million in annual revenue.

If we get another Rumi Spice update, we will let you know.
rumi-spice-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Rumi Spice Saffron Update | S8

ryans-barkery-dog-treats-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Ryan's Barkery Update

Immediately, sales skyrocketed, and Ryan’s Barkery was rolled out in more than thirty stores. Operations were moved from Daniela’s kitchen to a co-packer as well. In an update segment in Season 5, Ryan revealed the company had rebranded itself as Ryan’s Ruffery. The company became wildly successful, but it would soon come to a screeching halt. Unfortunately, Daniela suffered a stroke, and in late 2018, she passed away. Following her passing, the company shut down, so this will be our final Ryan's Barkery update.
ryans-barkery-dog-treats-update-season-4.title: Ryan's Barkery Update | S4

s-w-a-g-essentials-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank S.W.A.G Essentials Update

It's good news for Lydia. Research for our S.W.A.G Essentials update revealed that she has increased the number of products within her company and generates a few million dollars in gross revenue every single year. Her products are available on the S.W.A.G Essentials website and on Amazon.
s-w-a-g-essentials-update-shark-tank-sea.title: S.W.A.G Essentials Update | S6

saavy-naturals-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Saavy Naturals Update

If you want to purchase some of Savvy Natural’s products, you’re in luck! During research for our Saavy Naturals update, we discovered that the deal with Barbara never closed. However, the company really made a name for itself because of the quality of its products. In 2021, Saavy Naturals was acquired by another brand, but the amount of the sale was not disclosed.

Today, you can find Saavy Naturals products in their retail store in Pacific City, California. You can also purchase products online at the Saavy Naturals website.
saavy-naturals-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Saavy Naturals Update | S7

safe-catch-tuna-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Safe Catch Tuna Update

Our Safe Catch Tuna update found that the company raised $5 million in seed funding from angel investors Echo Capital and Essential Investments in 2017.

This boost helped them expand their product line, adding new seafood options like spiced tuna and salmon.

In February 2018, they secured another $5 million, which allowed them to roll out even more products, including sardines and Ahi tuna.

Their marketing also got a huge lift when Nick Jonas featured Safe Catch Tuna in an Instagram video, introducing the brand to millions of his followers.

Just two months later, Safe Catch Tuna partnered with Kroger, getting their products on shelves across the country.

In 2021, our Safe Catch Tuna update found that it became the first seafood company to be rePurpose Certified Plastic Neutral, a significant step in its commitment to sustainability.

Safe Catch Tuna faced challenges when the National Advertising Division (NAD) of the Better Business Bureau recommended changes to its marketing claims, prompting the company to make the necessary adjustments.

By 2023, they were the fastest-growing seafood brand in the U.S., with their products in over 12,000 stores and annual revenue topping $5 million.

Their Wild Ahi Yellowfin Tuna Pouches even won the 2023 Good Housekeeping Best Snack Award for Protein-Packed Favorites.

Our research into the Safe Catch Tuna update revealed that the founders have since expanded their entrepreneurial efforts.

Sean started Pure Cravings, a premium cat food brand, while Bryan took on advisory roles with various organizations.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we're calling this Safe Catch Tuna update a success.
safe-catch-tuna-update-shark-tank-season.title: Safe Catch Tuna Update | S8

safe-grabs-microwave-mat-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank Safe Grabs Update

Our Safe Grabs update found that the deal with Lori Greiner successfully closed.

Further, Lori's extensive network, particularly her connections with QVC, proved invaluable in expanding Safe Grabs' visibility and reach.

After airing, Safe Grabs quickly gained traction, with the silicone mats selling out on QVC just a day later. In just 10 minutes, Cyndi sold over $300,000 worth of products.

By 2017, Safe Grabs had expanded into major retail stores like Bed, Bath & Beyond and Home Depot.

Our Safe Grabs update found that Cyndi reported $2.4 million in sales a year after her appearance on Shark Tank. Three years later, the company had reached $5 million in revenue.

Even during the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, Safe Grabs continued to thrive, generating $4 million in annual revenue by 2022 and surpassing $24 million in lifetime sales.

During this time, the company also supported the medical community by matching donations to purchase up to 50,000 medical masks for hospitals in need.

Cyndi returned to Shark Tank in Season 9 for a special reunion, celebrating the success of entrepreneurs who had appeared on the show.

Since Shark Tank, Cyndi has introduced new products like pinch mitts and themed kitchen towels.

We're calling this Safe Grabs update a success.
safe-grabs-microwave-mat-update-shark-ta.title: Safe Grabs Update | S8

salespreneur-training-program-shark-tank.body:
Shark Tank Salespreneur Update

Our Salespreneur update reveals that the company did not manage to triumph after the Shark Tank appearance. The business seems to have closed down in 2012, and Dave moved on to other ventures.

Because of this, this will be our final Salespreneur update.
salespreneur-training-program-shark-tank.title: Salespreneur update | S3

samson-martin-maternity-t-shirts-update-.body:
Shark Tank Samson Martin Update

Research for our Samson Martin update, ultimately revealed that the company did not manage to succeed after all. Kim has moved on to other projects, ultimately shutting down the business in 2012.

LinkedIn, lists her as a wardrobe stylist for Wear With Genes, where she has been employed since 2020. Before then, she held various roles, many of them in the fashion industry.

Hopefully, despite moving on from Samson Martin, Kim is loving her current career. However, this will be our final Samson Martin company update.
samson-martin-maternity-t-shirts-update-.title: Samson Martin Update | S2

sanaia-applesauce-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank Sanaia Applesauce Update

Now all that remains to discuss is the present day Sanaia Applesauce update. Unfortunately, the deal with Mark Cuban never finalized, and Sanaia Applesauce went out of business as soon as the United States experienced the COVID-19 pandemic.

However, on April 2, 2022 Keisha announced on Facebook that she was relaunching her brand. Check out the Sanaia Applesauce website to learn more, and purchase products.

It'll be interesting to see what our next Sanaia Applesauce update has in store!
sanaia-applesauce-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Sanaia Applesauce Update | S10

sand-cloud-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Sand Cloud Update

Our Sand Cloud update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec closed successfully.

Furthermore, Sand Cloud had a surge of 13,000 visitors to its website the night their episode aired—an enormous jump from its usual 600.

With Robert Herjavec's backing, their sales shot up to $2.7 million within a few months, and by the end of the year, they were on track for $7 million.

The founders stayed true to their roots, committing 10% of profits to marine conservation.

Robert even joined them in Hawaii for a beach cleanup, reinforcing Sand Cloud’s dedication to protecting the oceans.

In 2018, Sand Cloud expanded its line with sustainably made items like water bottles, T-shirts, and jewelry.

They recognized people wanted more ways to support the mission, even beyond beach towels. By year’s end, they hit $20 million in sales, proving the demand was real.

In early 2020, Sand Cloud was featured on Shark Tank's “Greatest Businesses with a Social Cause” special, which highlighted their environmental impact and showed footage from the Hawaii cleanup.

With momentum still building, they rolled out new products, including hats, backpacks, and even blankets.

Our research on Sand Cloud update found that they had opened a retail store in Venice, California, in 2021, and their products were available in over 1,400 beach shops across the U.S.

At the time of writing, Sand Cloud has grown to around $7 million in annual revenue.

Additionally, their donations toward marine conservation have nearly reached $1 million.

We call this Sand Cloud update a success.
sand-cloud-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Sand Cloud Update | S8

sandilake-clothing-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Sandilake Clothing Update

After her Shark Tank appearance, Melissa opened a retail store in Portland, Oregon.

Our SandiLake Clothing update found that in early 2019, she sold SandiLake Clothing to an undisclosed buyer in Florida.

By August of the same year, she bought the company back and rebranded it as Allmade Apparel.

To maintain a work-life balance, Melissa traveled with her family in an adventure van while Peter Cuderman handled day-to-day operations.

At the time of writing, SandiLake has shifted its offerings to include tees for adults alongside its original kids' line, with a loyal customer base, and has grown to over $1 million in annual revenue.

It should be interesting to see what our next SandiLake Clothing update has in store.
sandilake-clothing-update-shark-tank-sea.title: SandiLake Clothing Update | S8

sap-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Sap Update

Despite not securing a deal on Shark Tank, SAP Maple experienced a surge in popularity after the episode aired.

They saw a jump in online sales, exceeding $100,000 within just ten days.

While they have yet to land distribution in major national retail chains, SAP Maple continues to be available for purchase directly through the SAP website and on Amazon.

We don't have exact financials, but we estimate that Sap generates well over $1 million in annual revenue.

When we get a more detailed Sap update, we will be sure to let you know.
sap-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Sap Update | S9

sarah-oliver-handbags-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Sarah Oliver Handbags Update

While researching for our Sarah Oliver Handbags update, we encountered some distressing news. While the products gained such popularity that their website crashed when the episode aired, the company shut down in 2017.

The US Department of Labor told Sarah that she couldn’t pay per item. She was forced to close after they told her that her business practices were illegal. This will be our final Sarah Oliver Handbags update.
sarah-oliver-handbags-update-shark-tank-.title: Sarah Oliver Handbags Update | S7

savy-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Savy Update

Shortly after her Shark Tank appearance, Disha received some partnership interest and planned to launch a paid version of her app.

She kept a low profile, focusing on improving Savy through the Stanford StartX accelerator. Unfortunately, these efforts weren't enough to save the business.

Our research on the Savy update revealed that the company went out of business in 2018 due to its inability to attract a large user base and significant clients.

By June 2021, the website and social media were inactive, and the app had been removed from app stores.

Unfortunately, this will be our last Savy update.
savy-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Savy Update | S9

sbu-unicycle-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank SBU Update

As it would turn out, Daniel and David withdrew from the deal before it closed. Despite this, the exposure from the show helped them catapult sales, and two new versions of the SBU went to market. The self-balancing unicycle would also be featured on MythBusters and Tosh.0, gaining even more notoriety. While the product sold on Amazon, and the company website for a time, it was sadly discontinued as of 2015. With that said, this will be our final SBU update.
sbu-unicycle-update-season-4.title: SBU Update | S4

scan-mobile-app-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Scan Update

We have pretty incredible news to share in our Scan update. In 2014, the year following his Shark Tank appearance, Garrett went on to sell his technology to Snapchat for around $54 million! It looks like the sharks may have missed out on a great opportunity to invest in Garrett's company! This will be our final Scan update.
scan-mobile-app-update-shark-tank-season.title: Scan Update | S5

scholly-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Scholly Update

We have great news to share in our Scholly update! The company is still in business and millions of smartphone users have downloaded the app. The greater success may be the fact that millions of dollars in scholarships have been awarded to students over the years, which is a wonderful thing. You can find out more about the company on the Scholly website.
scholly-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Scholly Update | S6

schulzies-bread-pudding-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Schulzies Bread Pudding Update

We have sad news to share. Unfortunately, the company is no longer in business. It looks as though Sarah’s San Francisco location closed in mid 2015, and her Venice Beach location closed sometime after. This will be our final Schulzies Bread Pudding update.
schulzies-bread-pudding-update-shark-tan.title: Schulzies Bread Pudding Update | S5

scratch-and-grain-baking-co-update-shark.body:
Shark Tank Scratch and Grain Baking Co. Update

Our Scratch and Grain Baking Co. update is a little bit sad. It appears that the company is no longer in operation. The company experienced a short-term boost in sales after appearing on Shark Tank but faced several key logistical issues over the years. This will be our final Scratch and Grain Baking Co. update.
scratch-and-grain-baking-co-update-shark.title: Scratch and Grain Baking Co. Update | S6

screenmend-screen-repair-kit-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank ScreenMend Update

Research for our ScreenMend update found that the company is still in business in 2023. With Lori’s help, the product has been sold on QVC as well as on Amazon, at Walmart, and is in all major home improvement stores currently. Their products are also available on the ScreenMend website.
screenmend-screen-repair-kit-update-shar.title: ScreenMend Update | S5

scrub-daddy-sponge-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Scrub Daddy Update

Our Scrub Daddy update is surely one for the record books! Lori eventually helped Aaron roll his product into thousands of stores. Then, with her help, the Scrub Daddy was featured on QVC again and again, selling out every time!

By 2016, lifetime sales were more than $75 million, and in 2017, they skyrocketed above $150 million. This earned Scrub Daddy the title of the most successful Shark Tank product in history.

By 2020, Scrub Daddy relinquished that title to Bombas, but maintained second-place status boasting lifetime sales of $268 million, versus Bombas’s $330 million. As of 2022, Scrub Daddy’s lifetime sales exceeded $300 million, and Aaron himself was worth an estimated $70 million.

Today, lifetime sales have now reached an unbelievable amount of $926 million, bringing in an average of $80 million annually. Overall, Scrub Daddy is one of the most successful Shark Tank investments of all time!

If you don't already own a Scrub Daddy of your own, you can grab one on Amazon, or on the Scrub Daddy website.
scrub-daddy-sponge-update-season-4.title: Scrub Daddy | S4

sealed-by-santa-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Sealed by Santa Update

Our Sealed by Santa update found that the deal with Lori Greiner never closed due to managerial disagreement.

Nevertheless, the show's exposure brought in a wave of new customers.

It also allowed Sarah to expand her product line, offering 12 different types of letters along with other seasonal products.

Beyond the classic Santa letters, Sealed by Santa now includes personalized messages from the Easter Bunny and Tooth Fairy, making it a year-round business.

In February 2023, our Sealed by Santa update found that Sarah took the holiday experience to the next level by introducing a live video chat with Santa.

Additionally, the business began shipping to Canada, marking its first step into international markets.

Despite the deal with Lori not going through, we are calling this Sealed by Santa update a success.
sealed-by-santa-update-shark-tank-season.title: Sealed by Santa Update | S8

send-a-ball-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Send a Ball Update

While Send a Ball didn't secure an investment on Shark Tank, their appearance on the show proved to be a big win.

The national exposure they received after airing led to a significant increase in sales. This boost in sales allowed the sisters to keep expanding their business and reach new customers.

Just as Kevin Harrington predicted, copycat services did emerge. However, Send a Ball benefits from being the first mover in this niche market, allowing them to establish a strong brand identity and loyal customer base.

Our Send a Ball update research found that their website also mentions a patent-pending, which could offer further protection against imitators.

The Send a Ball sisters' story proves that rejection on Shark Tank doesn't have to be the end.

As of July 2021, Send a Ball has grown to around $1 million in annual revenue.

Despite not securing a deal, they immensely benefited from the "Shark Tank Effect". We are excited about our next Send a Ball update.
send-a-ball-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Send a Ball Update | S1

shark-tank-apollo-peak-pet-wine-update-s.body:
Shark Tank Apollo Peak Update

Our Apollo Peak update found that the agreement with Kevin O'Leary was not finalized.

Kevin's team reviewed the company's financials and felt Apollo Peak was too new, leading them to seek a larger stake.

Brandon declined the revised terms, causing the deal to fall through.

Despite this, Apollo Peak gained substantial media exposure, featuring in outlets like the Huffington Post and CBS Sunday Morning, which bolstered its visibility.

The company expanded its product line to include dog-friendly wines and pet toys, diversifying its offerings.

At the time of writing, our Apollo Peak update research found that the company has grown to around $500,000 and $1,000,000 in annual revenue.

Apollo Peak's original website is now redirected to a different URL, suggesting that the company may have rebranded or been acquired.

Meanwhile, their products are still available through the Pet Wine Shop. It features a range of pet-themed beverages and toys, including Apollo Peak products.

Despite his deal with Kevin falling through, Brandon managed to carve out something out of his business.

We consider this Apollo Peak update a success.
shark-tank-apollo-peak-pet-wine-update-s.title: Apollo Peak Pet Wine Update | S8

shark-tank-barbell-apparel-update-season.body:
Shark Tank Barbell Apparel Update

Our Barbell Apparel update found that shortly after its airing, the company received a wave of positive attention on social media, with many viewers expressing interest in their products.

This exposure boosted sales, allowing Barbell Apparel to overcome early inventory challenges and expand its product line.

Originally focused on athletic-fit jeans, it now offers a variety of apparel, including chinos, T-shirts, polos, and a women’s collection.

In April 2018, The New York Post featured Barbell Apparel in an article that discussed a survey the company conducted.

The survey found that 79% of respondents believed owning good gym clothes is essential to achieving fitness goals.

By 2021, Barbell Apparel had taken another step forward by opening two retail stores. One in Las Vegas, NV and one in Scottsdale, AZ.

Our Barbell Apparel update revealed that the company has grown to around $5 million in annual revenue.

Further, they have maintained a strong online presence with over 164,000 followers on Facebook and 131,000 on Instagram.

Despite not landing a shark's investment, we're calling this Barbell Apparel update a success.
shark-tank-barbell-apparel-update-season.title: Barbell Apparel Update | S8

shark-tank-bootyqueen-apparel-update-sea.body:
Shark Tank BootyQueen Apparel Update

Our BootyQueen Apparel update found that the deal with Daymond John successfully closed. John expressed confidence in Amanda's influence and the brand's potential.

Following their Shark Tank appearance, the business gained significant media attention.

In 2017, Amanda promoted the brand by making a cameo on Lifetime's reality show Little Women: Dallas.

Later, in 2018, the apparel was featured in a segment on "The Dr. Oz Show."

Furthering their expansion, in January 2019, the Kuclo opened a retail store in Plano, Texas, marking a significant step in their expansion efforts.

By November 2021, BootyQueen Apparel reported an annual revenue of approximately $3 million.

Despite these earlier successes, the company faced challenges.

Eventually, by mid-2021, BootyQueen Apparel ceased updating its social media accounts, and its website became inactive.

As of August 2023, the brand's products were unavailable online, indicating a halt in operations.

Our research on the BootyQueen Apparel update found that Amanda and Steve Kuclo divorced in 2022.

Amanda reverted to her maiden name, Amanda Latona, and shifted her focus to other ventures, including her role as an athlete with ALLMAX Nutrition.

Meanwhile, Steve Kuclo remarried and continued his career in bodybuilding and fitness training.

At the time of this writing, BootyQueen Apparel appears to be inactive, with no recent updates or product availability.

It appears this is our final BootyQueen Apparel update.
shark-tank-bootyqueen-apparel-update-sea.title: BootyQueen Apparel Update | S8

shark-tank-chilantro-korean-bbq-update-s.body:
Shark Tank Chi'Lantro Update

Our Chi'Lantro update found that the deal with Barbara Corcoran fell through.

Nevertheless, the company experienced a major media boost due to its Shark Tank exposure.

In a 2018 interview, Jae shared that Chi'Lantro had been growing at a steady 20% each year.

One key change he implemented was going cashless, allowing staff to spend more time connecting with customers.

This focus on the customer experience, along with a unique menu, has been a major factor in the company’s rapid growth.

In 2020, our Chi'Lantro update found that Jae introduced neighborhood pop-ups, bringing food trucks into local communities to serve customers while following safety protocols.

By October 2022, Chi'Lantro had opened its 10th location, and in the spring of 2023, its 11th restaurant opened in Houston.

In addition to expanding its restaurants, Chi'Lantro now offers catering, runs a fleet of food trucks, and partners with delivery services like DoorDash, Uber Eats, and Postmates.

Our research into the Chi'Lantro update revealed that the company has grown to 13 locations, with annual revenues between $14 million and $17 million.

However, they are on track to reach their goal of 15 locations and plan to expand beyond Texas.

At the time of writing, Chi'Lantro now serves more than 200,000 orders of Kimchi fries every year.

Further, the brand engages with its community through events like Austin's Blues on the Green and shares everything from meal ideas to custom playlists on social media.

With Jae's journey from running a single food truck to managing a thriving restaurant chain, we can call this Chi'Lantro update a success.
shark-tank-chilantro-korean-bbq-update-s.title: Chi'Lantro Update | S8

shark-tank-cropsticks-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank CropSticks Update

Our CropSticks update found that the company secured a patent in April 2018 for its innovative bamboo chopstick design.

Additionally, CropSticks formed partnerships with major clients, including Disney properties, The Four Seasons, and Roy's restaurants.

To meet the rising demand for sustainable dining solutions, the company also launched bamboo fiber straws and reusable chopsticks, diversifying its product line.

Moreover, in 2019, CropSticks achieved Certified B Corporation status, marking its commitment to social and environmental responsibility.

This certification, along with the company's eco-friendly focus, helped CropSticks gain traction in retail.

Its products are now available in over 500 locations, including Walgreens and Cost Plus World Market.

At the time of writing, our CropSticks update research found that the company generates approximately $1.2 million in annual revenue and has grown to an estimated net worth of $1.5 million.

If we get another CropSticks update, we will let you know.
shark-tank-cropsticks-update-season-8.title: Cropsticks Bamboo Chopsticks Update | S8

shark-tank-drainwig-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank DrainWig Update

Based on our research, the deal with Kevin O'Leary eventually closed, and DrainWig became a major success story.

The product remains widely available in major retailers like Amazon, Bed Bath & Beyond, and Wal-Mart, demonstrating its continued market presence.

The Briggs family has expanded their product line beyond the original flower design, offering additional styles and even a specific version for bathtubs.

In 2014, DrainWig was included in the Oscar nominee swag bag!

During our DrainWig update research, we found that they have successfully exited their unfavorable infomercial deal and are now generating healthy profits.

DrainWig continues to grow and has easily surpassed over $1 million in annual revenue. Further, they sell over 1,000 units a month on Amazon alone.

We can call this DrainWig update a success and cannot wait to watch the company continue to grow.
shark-tank-drainwig-update-shark-tank-se.title: DrainWig Update | S9

shark-tank-energybits-nutrition-tablets-.body:
Shark Tank ENERGYbits Update

Our ENERGYbits update found that despite not getting an offer from any of the sharks, Catherine continued to promote ENERGYbits across various podcasts, including “Midlife Conversations” and “The Dr. Gundry Podcast.”

The product also gained attention in major publications like Vogue and Cosmopolitan.

In 2019, ENERGYbits faced some scrutiny by the National Advertising Review Board, which is part of the Better Business Bureau. It raised concerns about the lack of human clinical studies supporting the health benefits of algae tablets.

The board also found the company’s environmental claims to be overstated.

By 2021, our ENERGYbits update found that it had expanded its reach beyond its website to retailers like Amazon, Walmart, and other health-focused stores.

The product line also grew, offering four versions: Energy, Recovery, Vitality, and Beauty.

Prices range from $65 for small bags of 360 tablets to $150 for canisters of 1,000 tablets.

At the time of writing our ENERGYbits update, the company had grown to around $4 million in annual sales and was available in high-end retailers like Nieman Marcus.

Furthermore, Catharine has appeared on the “Integrative Cancer Solutions” podcast, maintaining her dedication to promoting algae-powered health.

We're calling this ENERGYbits update a success.
shark-tank-energybits-nutrition-tablets-.title: ENERGYbits Update | S8

shark-tank-flag-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Flag Update

Our Flag update found that Samuel and Savannah encountered a series of challenges that ultimately led to their business’ closure.

Despite raising over $1.6 million through successful Kickstarter campaigns and private investments, Flag struggled with production delays and logistical setbacks.

In fact, by March 2017, just before their Shark Tank episode aired, they announced that they were halting print production due to these issues.

As Samuel and Savannah tried to scale, many backers and customers grew dissatisfied.

Reports of unfulfilled photo prints and refunds led to a significant loss of trust in the company.

Following this, Flag's app was removed from the iOS App Store, and its website became inactive, signaling a complete shutdown of operations.

Our research on the Flag update found that Samuel transitioned into strategic advisory roles, lending his expertise to major clients like Microsoft, Google, Apple, and Hewlett-Packard.

He currently holds a position as Vice President of Communications and Startups at the Silicon Valley Leadership Group.

However, information about Savannah's professional activities following Flag remains limited, and her current pursuits are largely unknown.

This looks to be our final Flag update.
shark-tank-flag-update-season-8.title: Flag Photo Printing App Update | S8

shark-tank-goverre-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Goverre Update

Our Goverre update found that the deal with the sharks eventually closed successfully. The outcome provided the company with the necessary capital to expand operations.

Further, in the week following the episode's airing, the company generated $400,000 in sales, effectively selling out its entire inventory.

However, shortly after this success, Goverre faced a legal challenge. A competing brand, Govino, filed a lawsuit against them for trademark infringement.

This legal battle lasted approximately two years and was resolved favorably for Goverre just before going to trial in 2019.

The sharks' $200,000 investment was utilized to cover the legal expenses associated with this lawsuit.

Despite this setback, Goverre continued to grow its product line.

In August 2019, they introduced portable champagne flutes, and by July 2020, they launched portable cocktail glasses.

In 2021, they expanded further by adding portable charcuterie plates to their offerings. These additions aimed to enhance the outdoor dining experience for their customers.

Our research into the Goverre update found that the company’s annual sales revenue reached $1 million in 2022.

Further, its Lifetime sales total $4.6 million, and its valuation currently sits at over $2 million.

At the time of this writing, Goverre remains operational, and its products are available on its website and Amazon.

Despite the numerous challenges, we're calling this Goverre update a success.
shark-tank-goverre-update-season-8.title: Goverre Spill-Proof Wine Glass Update | S8

shark-tank-guard-llama-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Guard Llama Update

Our Guard Llama update found that the agreement with Barbara Corcoran was not finalized. The specific reasons for this are not publicly detailed.

However, the business received significant media attention, including features in the Chicago Tribune and various tech blogs.

Further, they partnered with the National Association of Realtors to distribute devices to real estate agents, a primary target market.

In 2019, Joseph Parisi was arrested on drug-related charges, including trafficking controlled substances.

Unfortunately, by late 2021, Guard Llama ceased operations amid customer complaints regarding service cancellations.

Our research on the Guard Llama update found Joe was awaiting trial as of August 2023.

However, Nick has since pursued other ventures, including roles in real estate and investment sectors.

It appears that this is our final Guard Llama update.
shark-tank-guard-llama-update-season-8.title: Guard Llama Safety App Update | S8

shark-tank-guardian-bikes-update-season-.body:
Shark Tank Guardian Bikes Update

Our Guardian Bikes update found that the deal with Mark Cuban successfully closed, and he became an active partner, guiding marketing and business growth.

By 2019, they had sold over 35,000 units; their innovative SureStop braking system garnered attention, leading to features in various media outlets and positive reviews from customers.

In 2022, the company made a strategic move to shift production from China to the United States, opening a factory in Seymour, Indiana.

This transition aimed to improve quality control and support local manufacturing, creating over 100 jobs in the process.

To support this shift, the entrepreneurs raised an additional $3 million from Mark Cuban and other investors.

Our research on the Guardian Bikes update found that the company has grown to an annual revenue of  $24 million, with lifetime sales surpassing $40 million since its Shark Tank appearance.

Further, Brian and Kyle continue to lead the company, maintaining their commitment to safety and innovation in children's bicycles.

We are calling this Guardian Bikes update a success.
shark-tank-guardian-bikes-update-season-.title: Guardian Bikes Update | S8

shark-tank-inboard-technology-electric-s.body:
Shark Tank Inboard Technology Update

Our Inboard Technology update found that the deal with Kevin and Lori never came to fruition.

Like many Shark Tank products, the M1 Electric Skateboard received a lot of media attention right after the show.

This sparked a surge in sales, plans to expand their product line, and promising retail deals with major outlets like Best Buy.

However, in 2019, things went south when the company took a gamble and shifted into the electric scooter market with their G1 scooter.

While the move seemed promising at first, it turned out to be more complicated and time-consuming than they expected.

Further, our Inboard Technology update found that the company managed to raise over $8 million in extra funding and secured around 1,500 pre-orders for the G1 Glider.

However, the excitement fizzled when they canceled those pre-orders and refunded deposits after a potential deal to sell a fleet of G1 scooters to a major European company emerged.

That decision ended up causing major financial issues.

Co-founder Ryan Evans and the leadership team stayed optimistic, banking on promises from their financial backers to keep the company afloat during the G1's development.

Sadly, that backing never came through, and Inboard Technology couldn't stay afloat.

In November 2019, they had to lay off employees, liquidate their assets, and sell off their intellectual property.

By the end of 2019, Inboard Technology had closed its doors permanently, marking the end of both the M1 and its bold scooter ambitions.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Inboard Technology update.
shark-tank-inboard-technology-electric-s.title: Inboard Technology Update | S8

shark-tank-jacks-stands-marketplaces-upd.body:
Shark Tank Jack's Stands and Marketplaces Update

Our Jack’s Stands and Marketplaces update found that it is unclear whether the deal with Chris Sacca eventually closed.

Nevertheless, a year after his Shark Tank appearance, Jack's Stand received a big boost when Good Times restaurants began selling its lemonade in four flavors throughout Colorado.

They also set up stands in the restaurants, where kids could sell the lemonade for a small fee.

However, things took a turn in 2019 when Colorado passed Senate bill SB19-103, restricting permits for businesses run by minors that operate for less than 84 days a year.

As Jack entered high school, his focus shifted toward charity work and motivational speaking. At just 12 years old, he delivered a TED Talk.

In 2019, he launched a new venture called TeenHustl, which started as a local delivery service like UberEats.

However, the COVID-19 pandemic reshaped the business into a delivery service for Amazon packages and other items, with teens handling the deliveries on bikes.

The Jack's Stands website hasn't seen updates since 2018, and franchise opportunities stopped in 2019.

However, the company became a nonprofit in 2021, continuing its mission to inspire young entrepreneurs.

Our Jack's Stands and Marketplaces update research found that Jack received several awards, including the U.S. Chamber of Commerce's 2020 Young Entrepreneur Achievement Award.

He also won the 2023 Prudential Emerging Visionary award, which came with a $5,000 prize.

If we get further news on Jack's Stands and Marketplaces update, we will let you know.
shark-tank-jacks-stands-marketplaces-upd.title: Jack's Stands and Marketplaces Update | S8

shark-tank-line-cutterz-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Line Cutterz Update

Our Line Cutterz update found that the deal with Daymond John closed successfully, and the company experienced a remarkable surge in sales.

In just one month after the episode aired, Vance sold more products than he had in the entire previous year.

As the business grew, Vance began exploring new applications for his patented technology beyond the fishing industry.

He envisioned potential uses in scuba diving, cutting guitar and bagpipe strings, butcher's string, balloon tying, and even crafting.

In 2018, our Line Cutterz update found that Vance had added flat-mount and pole-mount versions of the cutters to give customers more options.

In 2020, Vance took a major step and opened a physical store in West Columbia, Texas.

He operates Line Cutterz from the same location. The company now features an expanded lineup that includes fishing rods, reels, and a variety of apparel and accessories.

At the time of writing, Line Cutterz has over 100,000 followers across its social media pages.

Further solidifying their success, the Line Cutterz ring received official patent status and garnered an impressive 725 reviews on Amazon, with an average rating of 4.5 stars.

Our Line Cutterz update found that the company has grown to around $2 million in annual revenue.

The future looks bright for our next Line Cutterz update!
shark-tank-line-cutterz-update-season-8.title: Line Cutterz Update | S8

shark-tank-loctote-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Loctote Update

Our Loctote update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec did not close.

Although its Shark Tank appearance provided substantial media exposure, it also increased brand recognition and sparked a surge in sales.

Nolk, a Canadian brand architect, acquired Loctote in December 2020. This acquisition marked a significant transition in the company's ownership and operational strategy.

By July 2022, Loctote had achieved over $6 million in sales.

Further, in January 2023, Don launched another company called LOSS-PROOF, which focuses on theft-proof smartwatch straps.

As of November 2023, Loctote reported annual revenue of approximately $1 million.

At the time of this writing, our research on the Loctote update found that Loctote continues to operate under Nolk's ownership.

We're calling this Loctote update a success.
shark-tank-loctote-update-season-8.title: Loctote Industrial Bag Co. Update | S8

shark-tank-milk-snob-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Milk Snob Update

Our Milk Snob update found that the deal with Lori Grenier did not close.

However, that didn't slow things down. Milk Snob expanded its offerings to include baby blankets, sleeping bags, and, in 2020, a silicone pacifier that doubles as a teether.

A breakthrough came in 2018 when the company secured a licensing deal with Disney.

The deal later expanded to feature themed products from Jeep, Star Wars, and Harry Potter.

Our research on the Milk Snob update found that in 2019, the company set up its headquarters in Richardson, Texas, to manage its expanding product line better.

Further, the brand's popularity surged, with social media followings surpassing 174,000 on Facebook and 450,000 on Instagram.

Our Milk Snob update found that the company has grown its retail presence, with products hitting shelves in Target.

At the time of writing, Milk Snob has grown to around $6 million in annual revenue.

We can call this Milk Snob update a success.
shark-tank-milk-snob-update-season-8.title: Milk Snob Update | S8

shark-tank-nomiku-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Nomiku Update

Our Nomiku update found that the deal with Chris Sacca eventually closed.

Furthermore, shortly after its episode aired, the product caught the attention of not only home cooks but also top chefs, including those from famous restaurants like Noma.

Riding on this wave of success, Nomiku expanded its product line in 2016, introducing a Wi-Fi-enabled sous vide machine for $249, compared to the original $199 model.

This new version allowed users to control the device remotely. Lisa also released two sous vide cookbooks and launched a meal delivery service.

However, despite the initial excitement, Nomiku ran into some challenges. The Wi-Fi version, though innovative, received mixed reviews.

In 2016, CNET criticized the device for being bulky and outdated, offering little more than a remote control.

Meanwhile, competitors flooded the market with cheaper, more feature-rich alternatives, making it harder for Nomiku to stand out.

Our Nomiku update found that the company launched a third version with RFID technology that could automatically set temperatures, but it didn't stay on the market long.

In addition to these struggles, Nomiku faced significant delays in fulfilling Kickstarter orders. Many customers received faulty products, while others never received their machines at all.

Even with lifetime sales of $8 million, Nomiku couldn't overcome its manufacturing issues and stiff competition.

Our Nomiku update research found that the company eventually succumbed to its numerous struggles and went out of business in December 2019 after failing to secure more venture capital.

At the time of writing, the founders have moved on to other ventures.

Lisa shifted to a new career in psychedelic integration and counseling, while Abe transitioned into A.I. engineering, working with Sourceress and Imbue.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Nomiku update.
shark-tank-nomiku-update-season-8.title: Nomiku Update | S8

shark-tank-nootrobox-supplements-update-.body:
Shark Tank Nootrobox Update

Our Nootrobox update found that the company received six times the usual number of orders over the weekend after the episode aired.

In June 2017, they rebranded Nootrobox as Health Via Modern Nutrition (HVMN), shifting the focus to broader nutrition solutions beyond nootropics.

That same year, they launched their flagship product, HVMN Ketone Ester, a ketone-based energy supplement.

By 2019, HVMN decided to focus solely on the ketone market, phasing out older products like Go Cubes to concentrate on Ketone Ester and, later, its improved version, Ketone-IQ.

Additionally, Ketone-IQ was introduced as an energy shot designed in March 2019 to boost focus and athletic performance.

Around this time, HVMN also started a podcast featuring discussions on health, nutrition, and diet trends, with Woo and Brandt interviewing experts and athletes.

In February 2020, our Nootrobox update found that the company secured a $6 million contract with the U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) to study ketones in extreme environments for soldiers and pilots.

This partnership, which lasted until September 2023, helped refine Ketone-IQ, making it more effective and affordable.

Alongside this, our Nootrobox update found that the company collaborated with athletes like snowboarder Senna Leith, marathoner Matthew Johnson, and YouTuber Jake Paul to promote their products.

HVMN’s growth continued, raising over $8.2 million in funding through two rounds.

At the time of writing, Nootroobox has grown to around $4 million in annual revenue and remains a leader in the health and performance industry.

We're calling this Nootrobox update a success.
shark-tank-nootrobox-supplements-update-.title: Nootrobox Update | S8

shark-tank-petplate-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank PetPlate Update

Our PetPlate update found that despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, the company grew quickly after airing.

Prior to airing, PetPlate served 100 customers within a 300-mile radius of New York City. Shortly after, it was shipping 300-400 meals per month across the country.

In 2018, Renaldo raised $4 million in venture capital to fuel the company's growth.

We received an official PetPlate update segment in Season 10, during which Renaldo revealed that the company had scaled even more. They are now shipping 3,000-4,000 meals monthly nationwide.

In February 2020, PetPlate secured $9 million in funding from investors, including General Mills' venture capital arm.

This allowed PetPlate to meet growing demand and continue expanding.

In 2021, PetPlate partnered with Paramount Pictures to create packaging themed around the popular family film Paw Patrol: The Movie.

Later that year, the company raised another $19 million to help expand into retail.

Our PetPlate update research found that as of May 2023, PetPlate had sold over 15 million meals across the U.S., with annual revenue surpassing $9 million.

At the time of writing, PetPlate had raised a total of $47 million and had sold more than 18 million meals.

Despite the sharks' initial skepticism to offer Renaldo a deal, we are calling this PetPlate update a success.
shark-tank-petplate-update-season-8.title: PetPlate Update | S8

shark-tank-pupbox-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank PupBox Update

According to our PupBox update research, the deal with Robert Herjavec successfully closed.

Shortly after their episode's airing, the company's sales doubled, surpassing $750,000.

They continued to expand their offerings to include subscription boxes for adult dogs and launched their own branded accessories, such as leashes and collars.

These moves helped them keep customers longer and strengthened PupBox's position in the competitive pet care market.

Our PupBox update found that their success caught the attention of Petco, a leading name in the pet industry. In late 2017, Petco acquired PupBox for an undisclosed amount.

As part of the deal, Ben, Ariel, and their team joined Petco to manage and grow the brand further.

This partnership allowed PupBox to expand its subscriber base, which had grown dramatically by 2019.

By 2020, PupBox had earned recognition as one of the most disruptive direct-to-consumer brands in the U.S., according to the International Advertising Bureau.

Our PupBox update found that Ben launched Cloud Water Filters, a direct-to-consumer brand offering clean, toxin-free water through advanced filtration systems in early 2021.

Meanwhile, Ariel stayed on to lead PupBox's operations, ensuring the brand continued to thrive under Petco's leadership.

We are happy to call this PupBox update a success.
shark-tank-pupbox-update-season-8.title: PupBox Update | S8

shark-tank-see-rescue-streamer-update-se.body:
Shark Tank See Rescue Streamer Update

Our See Rescue Streamer update found that business gained increased attention and sales following the show's exposure.

Further, in 2020, the See Rescue Streamer was included aboard a SpaceX flight to the International Space Station.

The company continues to supply military customers worldwide, including the U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard.

At the time of writing, the company has grown to an annual revenue of $3.9 million.

It would be interesting to see what the future holds for Robert in our next See Rescue Streamer update.
shark-tank-see-rescue-streamer-update-se.title: See Rescue Streamer Update | S8

shark-tank-seedsheet-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Seedsheet Update

Our Seedsheet update found that the deal with Lori Greiner successfully closed, leading to significant growth for the company.

Shortly after its episode aired, Seedsheet gained substantial media attention.

It was featured on QVC, where Lori Greiner showcased the product and referred to Cameron as the "garden whisperer."

The company also launched a new website in May 2021 to enhance its brand identity and customer experience.

Furthermore, two years after the show, the company achieved $1.5 million in sales.

By 2020, Seedsheet reported over $5 million in revenue, with $2 million generated in the last year alone.

At the time of writing, our Seedsheet update research found that the company expanded its product line to include various gardening solutions.

These now range from small container gardens to larger outdoor setups.

The company also added educational resources to assist aspiring gardeners.

This diversification aimed to cater to a broader customer base and promote sustainable gardening practices.

We are calling this Seedsheet update a success.
shark-tank-seedsheet-update-season-8.title: Seedsheet Garden Mat Update | S8

shark-tank-toor-lockbox-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Toor Lockbox Update

Our Toor Lockbox update found that the deal with Barabara Cocoran and Kevin O’Leary did not close.

In 2018, Junior fulfilled his Kickstarter pre-orders, shipping out 800 units, and even partnered with Touch of Modern.

However, our Toor Lockbox update found that the company struggled to maintain momentum.

By the end of 2018, its social media and app updates had stopped, and the product was no longer available for purchase on the website.

By 2020, Junior had shifted gears and co-founded City Naturals, a premium CBD oil business with his wife.

They opened a physical store in Dallas, Texas, which they continue to operate.

At the time of writing, Junior still lists Toor as an active business on his LinkedIn profile, but there have been no significant updates on the product since March 2023, and its revival seems unlikely.

It appears the company has gone out of business, and this will be our final Toor Lockbox update.
shark-tank-toor-lockbox-update-season-8.title: Toor Lockbox Update | S8

shark-tank-under-the-weather-pods-update.body:
Shark Tank Under the Weather Update

Our Under the Weather update found that the deal with Mark Cuban was not finalized.

However, the company saw a 180% increase in sales within six months of the episode airing.

By 2023, Under the Weather expanded its product line to include personal protection pods and isolation tents, catering to frontline workers during the COVID-19 pandemic.

This strategic pivot helped the company maintain strong sales during challenging times.

The company also broadened its distribution channels, making products available in retail stores nationwide.

At the time of this writing, our Under the Weather update research found that the company has achieved annual revenues of $5 million and a net worth of $10 million.

We're calling this Under the Weather update a success.
shark-tank-under-the-weather-pods-update.title: Under the Weather Pods Update | S8

shark-tank-validated-update-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Validated Update

Our Validated update found that the company expanded its operations beyond Seattle and Portland.

It launched in major U.S. cities, including New York, San Francisco, Las Vegas, Boston, and Chicago.

The app also integrates additional services like Uber, Lyft, and Biketown, enhancing the user experience.

In May 2019, Validated was acquired by Reach Now, a joint mobility venture between BMW and Daimler.

This acquisition aimed to integrate Validated's rewards system into Reach Now's transportation services.

Our research on the Validated update found that by June 2019, just a month after the acquisition.

The company had ceased operations, and the app had been removed from the Apple and Google Play stores.

Following the closure of Validated, the founders have pursued other ventures.

However, the specifics about their subsequent endeavors are not available.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Validated update.
shark-tank-validated-update-season-8.title: Validated App Update | S8

shark-wheel-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Shark Wheel Update

We have great news to share in our Shark Wheel update! The company is still in business and continues to do very well in terms of overall sales. New products have been developed with their wheels, including skateboards, luggage bags, and more. Products are available on Amazon and the Shark Wheel website.
shark-wheel-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Shark Wheel Update | S6

shed-defender-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Shed Defender Update

Now let’s dive into our Shark Tank Shed Defender update. Unfortunately, the deal was never finalized with Lori.

However, Miles and Tyson continued operating their business, and have managed to raise their company’s annual revenue to just over a $1 million.

They continue to sell their products on the Shed Defender website, and on Amazon. They're also available at Walmart, and PetSmart.

Check out the Shed Defender website to see what they have to offer, especially since they've expanded their product line to include other dog accessories.

Additionally, the company also gives back a portion of their monthly sales to shelters, rescues, and animal related non profits. Things are ultimately looking promising for Shed Defender, despite the deal falling through.
shed-defender-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Shed Defender Dog Onesie Update | S10

shefit-sports-bras-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank SHEFIT Update

It’s excellent news for Sara and Bob! During our SHEFIT update research, we found that the company is thriving, with annual revenue of about $7 million. The bra is endorsed by Olympian Val Smith and featured on The Today Show, the Doctors, and other daytime TV appearances.

These bras have really taken off in the activewear market! You can purchase one on the SHEFIT website, or from Amazon.
shefit-sports-bras-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Shefit Update | S7

shell-bobbers-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Shell Bobbers Update

In an update provided on Season 5 of Shark Tank, fans find out that Shell Bobbers is selling well. They were poised to be sold in more than 3,000 7-Eleven locations nationwide, while a separate deal with WalMart was in negotiations and eventually closed. Despite this, the company is out of business as of 2023. This will be our final Shell Bobbers update.
shell-bobbers-update-season-4.title: Shell Bobbers Update | S4

shemie-slip-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Shemie Update

After the episode aired, Shelton earned $30,000 from a Kickstarter campaign, which helped to get her business off the ground. Between 2012 and 2015, the Shemie was featured in various fashion publications like Vogue, W, Glamour, Cosmo, People Style Watch, Teen Vogue, Self, Star, and more. Sadly, production of the Shemie stopped in 2015, and the business closed. Shelton pivoted and became a realtor in Los Angeles, founding the Shelton Wilder Group of real estate agents of which she is the CEO. This will be our final Shemie update.
shemie-slip-update-season-4.title: Shemie Update | S4

show-no-changing-towel-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Show No Update

Our Show No update reveals that after some initial success, the business undoubtedly experienced a bumpy road. Shelly also revealed that the partnership with Lori never materialized.

She finally closed the business for good in 2017, after several failed attempts at mass manufacturing.

The good news is that Shelly moved on to something she is equally passionate about. She's now a clinical hynotherapist. However, this will be our final Show No company update.
show-no-changing-towel-shark-tank-season.title: Show No Update | S3

shower-pill-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Shower Pill Update

Despite leaving Shark Tank without a deal, Shower Pill experienced significant success.

Our Shower Pill update found that they rebranded in 2018 to Hustle Clean and partnered with NFL players like Steve Smith and Ronnie Lott.

Since airing, Hustle Clean quickly saw $15,000 in sales and surpassed $1 million in sales by 2019.

Their product line expanded to include new scents and face wipes, now available at Target and Amazon.

Hustle Clean also launched philanthropic efforts, such as sports scholarships for underserved youths, and provided hygiene products in disaster-stricken areas.

They continue to serve athletes, campers, and individuals with limited access to showers, demonstrating a successful evolution from their original concept.

According to our Shower Pill update research, the company has grown to over $4 million in annual sales.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we are calling this Shower Pill update a success.
shower-pill-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Shower Clean Body Wipes Update | S9

sierra-madre-research-update-shark-tank-.body:
