the-seventy2-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank The Seventy2 Update

Since its appearance on Shark Tank, The Seventy2 has enjoyed continued success. While Robert Herjavec initially invested, he reportedly exited the company in early 2019.

The product enjoyed strong sales following its appearance on the show, with a notable boost after Ashton Kutcher's tweet to his massive 19+ million follower base. Capitalizing on this momentum, they launched a two-person gear and supply pack for $565.

Our The Seventy2 update revealed that the company has unveiled a range of innovative new products, including the Zeus "life-charger" and the Rapid Raft, The First Aid Plus life raft.

In September 2021, the company teamed up with Global Outdoor Emergency Support (GOES), a life-saving app offering remote assistance in emergencies.

GOES boasts two key features: 24/7 access to a network of over 30 doctors directly through the app and AI-powered guidance for situations when no signal is available.

You can purchase the product on Uncharted Supply Co. for $399. The two-person kit sells for $589, which is a much better deal than just buying two of the original kits if you have more than one person living in your home.

As of August 2022, the company remains operational with an annual revenue of $1.5 million.

From the look of things, the business is headed in the right direction, and we are excited to see where our next The Seventy2 update takes us.
the-seventy2-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: The Seventy2 Update | S9

the-skinny-mirror-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank The Skinny Mirror Update

Unfortunately, our Skinny Mirror update research revealed terrible news. The Skinny Mirror never really took off. Seven months after the show aired, The Skinny Mirror closed. You can no longer purchase these mirrors at any retailer.

This will be our final The Skinny Mirror update.
the-skinny-mirror-update-shark-tank-seas.title: The Skinny Mirror update | S7

the-smart-baker-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank The Smart Baker Update

Our The Smart Baker update shows that the deal with Barbara never closed, but that didn’t stop Stephanie and Daniel. The company still enjoyed sales attention after the episode aired.

The business is still going strong, making $1 million in annual revenue.

You can check out all of their product on The Smart Baker website. They've expanded their line to include several styles of parchment paper, cupcake tiers, and they also have towels with measurement cheat sheets, in addition to their aprons.

Besides the website, products are also available on Amazon.

If we learn anything new about this company, we will certainly let you know. However, in the meantime, feel free to check out our other company updates from Season 3 Episode 7 by following the links below.
the-smart-baker-shark-tank-season-3.title: The Smart Baker Update | S3

the-style-club-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank The Style Club Update

Our Style Club update found that the deal with Mark Cuban was successfully closed.

By 2018, the company had landed partnerships with major retailers like Forever 21, Macy's, American Eagle Outfitters, and Nordstrom, building on the earlier success they found with Urban Outfitters.

They also expanded their product line, adding items like shirts, hoodies, backpacks, and makeup pouches.

However, things took a turn when billionaire investor Howard Marks claimed he had invested in The Style Club back in 2012 and accused Hillary of creating a new version of the company to pitch on Shark Tank.

Despite this controversy, our research on The Style Club update found that the company seemed to thrive for a few more years, with its social media staying active until May 2021.

At the time of writing, the company appears to have quietly gone out of business for undisclosed reasons, with no website and little trace of its former success.

Unfortunately, it looks like this is our final The Style Club update.
the-style-club-update-shark-tank-season-.title: The Style Club Update | S8

the-sullivan-generator-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank The Sullivan Generator Update

Our Sullivan Generator update reveals that the concept never materialized, and the science required to make it work could not be verified after all.

Mark is still an inventor with numerous patents, but the Sullivan Generator is not available for sale. That said, he maintains the Mark Sullivan Research website, which shares in detail about his many research projects and inventions, including The Sullivan Generator.

However, this will be our final update for The Sullivan Generator.
the-sullivan-generator-shark-tank-season.title: The Sullivan Generator Update | S3

the-swilt-convertible-sweatshirt-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank The Swilt Update

Our research for The Swilt update reveals that the company is no longer in business. We could not find a website, and social media accounts have not been updated since 2017.

Although, we noticed that some people still comment on old Facebook posts to inquire about where to purchase the product.

Ivori likely pursued other business ventures, but ultimately proved the sharks right by not being able to make The Swilt work on the wider market. Hopefully she has found something that she is equally as passionate about, however, this will be our final company update for The Swilt.
the-swilt-convertible-sweatshirt-shark-t.title: The Swilt update | S3

the-twister-portable-golf-ball-cleaner-u.body:
Shark Tank The Twister Update

Our The Twister update found that shortly after its episode airing, the company capitalized on the media exposure and boosted its sales.

However, at the time of writing, the company's official website is no longer active.

Despite this, the product is still available on Amazon, and The Twister now generates $200,000 in annual revenue.

It seems that not much has happened with the company since Shark Tank. If we get another The Twister update, we'll be sure to let you know.
the-twister-portable-golf-ball-cleaner-u.title: The Twister Update | S1

the-two-guys-bowtie-company-update-shark.body:
Shark Tank The Two Guys Bowtie Company Update

According to our research, Adam and Tim still own the company, and it’s doing about $3.5 million per year. Recently, they launched new fabric ties and wood-brimmed fedoras for the discerning gentleman. You can find all of their products on The Two Guys Bowtie Company website.

The future looks bright for Adam and Tim.  Stay tuned for our next The Two Guys Bowtie Company update!
the-two-guys-bowtie-company-update-shark.title: The Two Guys Bowtie Company Update | S7

the-uro-club-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank The Uro Club Update

Our The Uro Club update found that the deal with Kevin Harrington was not finalized.

Although companies that appear on Shark Tank typically gain massive media exposure and attention, the Uro Club never quite gained traction.

Yet, at the time of this writing, it has managed to stay in business over the years. The product is available for purchase on Amazon.

Further research for our The Uro Club update shows that their social media pages have been inactive since 2016.

However, the company has managed to amass around $200,000 in lifetime sales.

If we get another The Uro Club update, we will be sure to let you know.
the-uro-club-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: The Uro Club Update | S1

the-vermont-butcher-block-board-company-.body:
Shark Tank The Vermont Butcher Block & Board Company Update

We have interesting news to share in The Vermont Butcher Block & Board Company update! Things went well at first, however, David would wind up declaring bankruptcy in 2017. He was left with $800,000 in unpaid debts. A businessman named Lucas Jenson would follow in David’s footsteps, opening a business under the same name selling similar products. The Vermont Butcher Block & Board Company remains active today, but David has vanished from the public eye after an embarrassing departure from the business world.
the-vermont-butcher-block-board-company-.title: The Vermont Butcher Block & Board Update | S4

the-wall-doctor-rx-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank The Wall Doctor Rx Update

We have sad news to report. After the episode aired, the company had great success, and Lori invested a little later, so he got both sharks after all. It was sold in major U.S. home improvement stores, and on QVC. A few years later, the brand was acquired by Spark Innovations, LLC, however it no longer seems to be in production. This will be our final The Wall Doctor Rx update.
the-wall-doctor-rx-update-shark-tank-sea.title: The Wall Doctor Rx Update | S5

the-wingman-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank The Wingman Update

Our research on The Wingman update reveals that the company reduced its price to $199 and expanded its product line to include apparel, hydration bladders, and surfing vests.

They sell exclusively online through The Wingman website and Amazon.

Customer reviews on Amazon are generally positive, indicating satisfaction with the product's quality and functionality.

While exact updated sales numbers are unavailable, speculative data for our The Wingman update suggests that the company's annual sales revenue is between $1 million and $1.5 million.

It appears that Mike and Pat have successfully navigated their company in the right direction and have continued to grow since Shark Tank.

We look forward to bringing you our next The Wingman update.
the-wingman-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: The Wingman Life Jacket Update | S9

thin-gloss-lip-gloss-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Thin Gloss Update

Our Thin Gloss update reveals that the company did have some more sales after the Shark Tank appearance, and even hit her $1 million goal. That said, the company ultimately fizzled out.

Unfortunately, it has been out of business since 2012. By 2018, April was keeping busy teaching motivational classes, but it's unclear if she's still doing them at the time of this writing.

We're sure, whatever she's doing, it's with the same passion that brought her to Shark Tank!
thin-gloss-lip-gloss-update-shark-tank-s.title: Thin Gloss update | S2

third-wave-water-update-shark-tank-seaso.body:
Shark Tank Third Wave Water Update

At the time of this Third Wave Water update, the company is still in business and has three different variations of its water additive on its website.

One is specifically for dark roast coffee, one for coffee and tea made in a coffee pot, and one for coffee and tea made in an espresso machine.

While the deal with Barbara on Shark Tank didn't materialize, Charles and Taylor maintained a positive relationship with her and continue to benefit from her network. They also experienced a significant sales boost following their appearance on the show.

Our Third Wave Water update found that after airing on Shark Tank, the company received 10,000 sales within two weeks.

In 2019, they expanded their product line by introducing Tethys, a water filtration and mineralization system specifically designed for coffee shops.

This system makes use of its proprietary water mineralization powder within a commercial-grade reverse osmosis system, offering coffee shops a convenient and consistent way to optimize their brewing water.

Third Wave Water remains a successful company with an annual revenue of $1 million, demonstrating the continued demand for its products and expertise in enhancing coffee quality.

Things are looking promising, and we can't wait for our next Third Wave Water update.
third-wave-water-update-shark-tank-seaso.title: Third Wave Water Update | S9

thompson-tee-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Thompson Tee Update

Our Thompson Tee update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec was not finalized.

The company expanded its product line to include various styles and colors of sweat-proof undershirts for both men and women.

Our research on the Thompson Tee update found that the company reported $9 million in total revenue in 2017.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, they also introduced face masks to their product line.

However, at the time of writing, they have grown to an annual revenue of $10 million.

We are calling this a success and can't wait for another exciting Thompson Tee update.
thompson-tee-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Thompson Tee Update | S8

three-day-rule-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Three Day Rule Update

We have great news to share in our Three Day Rule update! As it would turn out, the company did continue to enjoy growth, and eventually garnered interest from major industry player Match.com. Match.com provided the algorithm to supercharge their matchmaking process, allowing Three Day Rule to offer a free membership option in addition to Val’s pricey premium subscription. As of 2023, Three Day Rule remains in business, with an estimated annual revenue in the millions.
three-day-rule-update-season-4.title: Three Day Rule Update | S4

three-jerks-jerky-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank Three Jerks Jerky Update

Fortunately, Three Jerks Jerky is doing well! An update segment later in the season revealed that Three Jerks Jerky did about $1.4 million in sales three months after appearing on the show. Daymond helped them change their co-packer, providing better supply to meet their rising demand.

Our Three Jerks Jerky update research found that the founders are letting the business thrive independently. They stepped away from the business, but the annual revenue hovers around $4 million.
three-jerks-jerky-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Three Jerks Jerky update | S7

thrive-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Thrive+ Update

After its appearance on Shark Tank, Thrive+ changed its name to Thrive Global. A year later, in February 2019, Brooks secured $2.1 million in funding and completely rebranded the company to Cheers.

By 2021, Brooks was seeking public investments at a $49 million valuation. Cheers remained in business with $3.5 million in annual revenue.

In September, our Thrive+ update research found that the company launched a crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for a retail push, bringing in roughly $1.7 million.

Following the campaign, they introduced the Cheers Restore beverage, which boasts a patented permeabilizer technology that significantly increases the bioavailability of a key ingredient. They also launched a new hydration brand.

By November 2022, the company's annual revenue had grown to $7 million.

Brooks may not have landed a deal on Shark Tank, but the show's exposure seems to have benefitted his business. We will be sure to let you know if we get another Thrive+ update.
thrive-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Thrive+ Update | S9

throx-socks-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Throx Socks Update

After airing, our Throx Socks update found that Edwin invested in quirky patterns and styles, focusing on children and teens.

At the time of this writing, Throx is still in business. Its products, which come in various patterns and colors, are available on its official website and Amazon.

This niche appeal helped Throx grow, and by 2021, our Throx Socks update found that the company had grown to around $1 million in annual revenue.

We're calling this Throx Socks update a success!
throx-socks-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Throx Update | S1

tie-not-water-balloon-device-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank Tie-Not Update

While there are a few units of Tie-Not for sale from third-party resellers on Amazon and Walmart online, the company website no longer exists. Scott’s LinkedIn shows that he became Director of Sales at DME, a mold-making company, in 2018. Wayne still works in his family’s mold-manufacturing business, where he is listed as the owner. This will be our final Tie-Not update.
tie-not-water-balloon-device-update-shar.title: Tie-Not Update | S5

tietry-subscription-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank TieTry Update

After their episode aired in 2012, David and Scott continued working on their business for the remainder of the year. However, it wouldn’t be long before a major competitor, Freshneck.com would buy them out in 2013. As of 2013, Tie Try is out of business, and David and Scott have moved on to other ventures. This will be our final TieTry update.
tietry-subscription-update-season-4.title: TieTry Update | S4

tippi-toes-dance-franchise-update-shark-.body:
Shark Tank Tippi Toes Update

Our Tippi Toes update reveals that the company is still a success years later and has grown from seven franchises to 36. Further, we found that the deal with Mark Cuban never closed.

In 2023, they have 36 franchises and they also offer virtual classes, which likely came about during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Each of the Tippi Toes franchise stores offers dance classes, camps, and parties. Their CDs are available online for download or as physical CDs,  on the Tippi Toes website.
tippi-toes-dance-franchise-update-shark-.title: Tippi Toes Update | S2

tipsy-elves-ugly-sweaters-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Tipsy Elves Update

We have great news to share in our Tipsy Elves update! The company has been wildly successful over the years, with a net worth that is now estimated at over $6 million. They've branched out into apparel for nearly every theme imaginable, and even have a pet line with Petsmart. Products are also available on the Tipsy Elves website, and on Amazon.
tipsy-elves-ugly-sweaters-update-shark-t.title: Tipsy Elves Update | S5

titin-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Titin Update

Unfortunately, we have bad news to share. Research for our Titin update revealed that the company is no longer in business.

While it's unclear what happened, the Titan social media accounts and website pages have been abandoned or deactivated.

This will be our final Titin update.
titin-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Titin Update | S6

tom-chee-restaurant-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Tom + Chee Update

We have great news to share in our Tom & Chee update! Soon after their episode aired, they started thirteen new locations in 2014, all over the country. Then, in a Season 6 update, Corey and Trew shared that they had grossed over $14 million. In 2017, a company called GSR Brands took over the company, and eventually reimagined the menu, and as of 2023, Tom & Chee is still in business.
tom-chee-restaurant-update-season-4.title: Tom & Chee Update | S4

total-merchant-resources-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank Total Merchant Resources Update

We have good news to report in our Total Merchant Resources update! While the deal with Kevin never finalized, the company is still successful in 2023. Their estimated valuation is $5 million, and Jason and Val have been featured in business and finance media interviews many times over the past several years. You can learn more about their company on the Total Merchant Resources website.
total-merchant-resources-update-shark-ta.title: Total Merchant Resources Update | S5

total-tie-keep-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Total Tie Keep Update

Dwight wasn’t ready to give up, and that turned out to be a good thing! In our Total Tie Keep update, we found that the company is still in business, with annual revenue of around $1 million.

Now, they sell more than just the Tie Keep - they’ve branched out to socks and ties to go with them! You can purchase one and all of their other products on the Total Tie Keep website and also on Amazon.
total-tie-keep-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Total Tie Keep Update | S7

tower-paddle-boards-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank Tower Paddle Boards Update

Our Tower Paddle Boards update reveals that Mark considers this one of his best investments on the show. He saw a third of his investment repaid in only a few months.

In 2015 Inc. Magazine, recognized Tower Paddle Boards as 239th fastest growing, privately run, growing company in America. At that point, they had also passed $10 million in lifetime sales.

The company has since grown, offering a range of products and making around $7 million in annual revenue.

Check out all they have to offer on the Tower Paddle Boards website. They have several styles of paddle boards to choose from in addition to tons of gear and accessories.

If we learn anything new about this company, we will certainly let you know. In the meantime, you can check out our other company updates from Season 3 Episode 9, by following the links below!
tower-paddle-boards-shark-tank-season-3.title: Tower Paddle Boards Update | S3

toygaroo-toy-subscription-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank ToyGaroo Update

Our ToyGaroo update shows that the company, unfortunately, folded within a year of Nikki’s appearance on the show. While they did benefit from an uptick in sales immediately following the show, they ultimately could not handle the demand.

Further, it seems that the owners of ToyGaroo and the sharks, could not agree on business decisions such as shipping costs for instance. Overall, the idea was a good one, but it seems the business plan just couldn't be fully carried out.

This will be our final ToyGaroo update.
toygaroo-toy-subscription-update-shark-t.title: ToyGaroo Update | S2

toymail-talkie-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Toymail Update

Our Toymail update found that the deal with Chris Saca and Lori Greiner closed.

Shortly after their episode aired, they rolled out new plush characters, such as Chunk the Sloth and a Penguin, which were instant hits with kids.

These toys kept the popular Talkie feature, letting kids send voice messages back and forth with family and friends.

However, over the next few months, Toymail introduced the Toymail Cloud, a platform packed with apps to make the toys even more engaging.

There was Sleepie for bedtime sounds, Remindie as a kid-friendly audio calendar, and Voicie, which added fun voice filters to keep kids entertained.

By November 7, 2017, Toymail Talkies hit Amazon Launchpad, boosting visibility and sales.

Toymail also worked with Amazon Echo to integrate voice recognition, giving parents peace of mind with safer ways for kids to chat and learn.

A new subscription service was also launched, letting families download music, stories, and other content from Toymail Cloud for $2.99 a month.

Unfortunately, by 2018, Toymail hit some bumps, struggling to scale up and secure more investments.

In November 2018, Toymail filed for bankruptcy and closed its doors. In 2019, social media updates stopped, and the company's website went offline.

Our Toymail update research found that Gauri Nanda now runs Clocky, her quirky alarm clock on wheels.

This will be our final Toymail update.
toymail-talkie-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Toymail Talkie Update | S8

track-days-movie-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Track Days Update

As it would turn out, a movie with no script, no actors, and no financing was not a sound idea. Track Days failed to receive the financing on Shark Tank, and didn’t find it anywhere else either. The movie was never made, and James and Brian moved onto other things shortly after the pitch. This will be our final Track Days update.
track-days-movie-update-season-4.title: Track Days Update | S4

traditional-fisheries-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Traditional Fisheries Update

Unfortunately, within months of filming, the company went out of business. Dave and Gary moved onto other ventures, but their mission would live on. As of 2021, Publix and Whole Foods have started selling lionfish filets. This will be our final Traditional Fisheries update.
traditional-fisheries-update-season-4.title: Traditional Fisheries Update | S4

tranquilo-baby-mats-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Tranquilo Update

Our Tranquilo update research found that the deal with Robert Herjavec did not close.

However, shortly after its episode aired, sales skyrocketed, jumping from 2,000 to 10,000 units in a matter of months.

With her brand on the rise, Melissa expanded the Tranquilo line to include both small and large mats, plus new cover designs.

The product gained more attention with spots at the ABC Kids Expo and mentions on popular lists like Thrifty Littles and The Pumping Mommy.

Eventually, the brand's success caught the eye of Baby Boom Consumer Products (a division of The Betesh Group), who bought Tranquilo.

While it was tough for Melissa to step back, she was excited to see Baby Boom bring Tranquilo's comforting products to an even broader audience.

Tranquilo kept expanding, teaming up with Baby Soothe Massager creator Lauren Piccirillo to offer a wider range of baby-soothing options on Amazon and the Tranquilo website.

Our Tranquilo update found that Melissa moved into a new chapter as Director of Product Development for Baby Brezza.

She eventually relocated to Germany, where she now consults for startups on everything from patents to sales strategies.

At the time of writing, you can still find the Tranquilo Mat on Amazon for $80, along with the Tranquilo Safe Sleep Swaddle Blanket for $30.

While the company’s current value isn’t public, Tranquilo has likely grown well beyond its original $1.3 million valuation.

Despite not closing the deal with Robert Herjavec, Melissa somehow managed to steer her business in the right direction.

It appears this will be our final Tranquilo update.
tranquilo-baby-mats-update-shark-tank-se.title: Tranquilo Baby Mats Update | S8

treasure-chest-pets-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Treasure Chest Pets Update

The deal with Barbara Corcoran was never finalized. However, Daymond John stepped in and leveraged some of his equity.

Our Treasure Chest Pets update found that the company went out of business in 2011 due to intense competition and an influx of knock-offs.

Lisa has since shifted her focus. She now writes and speaks about her experiences in entrepreneurship and sharing insights on invention and business.

Unfortunately, this is going to be our final Treasure Chest Pets update.
treasure-chest-pets-update-shark-tank-se.title: Treasure Chest Pets Update | S1

tremont-electric-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Tremont Electric Update

Our update is a short one. Aaron kept working toward his vision for a number of years after the tank, but sales never quite took off. Sadly, he failed to secure contracts for the technology with major energy suppliers. In 2016, Tremont Electric went out of business and Aaron became a paramedic. This will be our final Tremont Electric update.
tremont-electric-update-season-4.title: Tremont Electric Update | S4

trimi-tank-tank-tops-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Trimi Tank Update

Our Trimi Tank update reveals that the appearance on Shark Tank gave Lindsay and Nicole a great boost in sales. For a while, things seemed to be looking up.

Unfortunately though, the business closed down some time in 2013. This will be our final Trimi Tank update.
trimi-tank-tank-tops-update-shark-tank-s.title: Trimi Tank Update | S3

trippie-airport-app-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Trippie App Update

Based on our research, Ryan found success with Trippie despite the sharks' initial reservations. Shortly after airing, the app quickly expanded to 18 new airports in major international locations like Frankfurt, Sydney, and Tokyo.

By May 2019, Trippie's reach had grown to 120 airports worldwide. The app's core functionality targeted a specific need: navigating busy US airports.

These airports handle a significant portion of US air travel, making Trippie valuable for domestic travelers.

Unfortunately, the global COVID-19 pandemic significantly impacted travel in 2020, leading to decreased app usage.

Thankfully, with travel restrictions easing in 2023, Trippie has seen a resurgence and is currently generating around $3 million in annual revenue.

Our Trippe App update also found that Ryan now works full-time as a Partner and Entrepreneur in Residence at Base Ventures, a firm that invests in promising technology companies.

We are glad to call this Trippie update a success.
trippie-airport-app-update-shark-tank-se.title: Trippie App Update | S9

trobo-stem-toy-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank TROBO Update

After appearing on Shark Tank, our TROBO update shows that the company enjoyed mixed success. The deal with Robert never closed, perhaps due to a lack of interest from Dreamworks and too intricate of legal demands.

In the years that followed, the TROBO’s price decreased. The company officially shut down in 2017 after being unable to secure a content delivery deal.

This will be our final TROBO update.
trobo-stem-toy-update-shark-tank-season-.title: TROBO Update | S7

trunkster-luggage-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank Trunkster Update

We have shady news for our Trunkster update. The Kickstarter mentioned during the episode was successful, but it appears that Jessie and Gaston never fulfilled most orders. Of the slim number of orders that were shipped, most were reported to be of very poor quality.

Most of the potential customers and investors on Kickstarter and other crowdfunding campaigns were understandably upset, and the company has never responded or issued refunds.

The website is defunct and all social media accounts are MIA. Unfortunately, we have to report that this product might have been a scam. It’s a good thing that the deal with Lori and Mark never closed. This will be our final Trunkster update.
trunkster-luggage-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Trunkster Update | S7

turbobaster-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Turbobaster Update

Based on our Turbobaster update research, the deal with Kevin Harrington eventually closed as his TV GOODS acquired exclusive global marketing rights to Turbobaster.

Although sales saw a brief spike, the Turbobaster struggled to maintain momentum.

The product was initially available online and in select retail locations, but no significant sales figures were ever released.

Despite this promising start, our Turbobaster update found that the product had disappeared from the market, and the company's website and Facebook page had gone offline.

It looks like this is going to be our final Turbobaster update.
turbobaster-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Turbobaster Update | S1

turbopup-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank TurboPup Update

Our TurboPup update reveals some mixed news. While the deal with Daymond did finalize, it appears the company has gone out of business, though the timeframe is unclear. In 2023, the TurboPup website is down, social accounts have not been updated in some time and the product is unavailable on Amazon. This will be our final TurboPup update.
turbopup-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: TurboPup Update | S6

tutublue-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank TuTuBlue Update

Even without an endorsement from a shark, TuTuBlue is doing well. In 2022, the Amazon store was is filled with positive reviews and great designs. Research for our TuTuBlue update revealed that the company has outlets in Las Vegas, Santa Monica, and Miami Beach.

Annual revenue is reported to be nearly $11 million and they even offer men’s suits now! You can shop on their Amazon store or at the TuTuBlue website.
tutublue-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: TuTuBlue Update | S7

twin-z-pillow-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Twin Z Pillow Update

We have some mixed news to share in our Twin Z Pillow update. The partnership with Lori never finalized, which was extremely disappointing for the company.  The good news however, is that they still produces products and sell them for an estimated gross revenue of $1 million every single year. Products are available on Amazon, and on the Twin Z Pillow website.
twin-z-pillow-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Twin Z Pillow Update | S6

tycoon-real-estate-update-shark-tank-sea.body:
Shark Tank Tycoon Real Estate Update

Research for our Tycoon Real Estate update revealed that the company was privately acquired in the years since appearing on Season 6. It also seems that Aaron may have a new job unrelated to the crowdfunding job, but still involved in real-estate properties. You can find out more about the platform on the Tycoon website.
tycoon-real-estate-update-shark-tank-sea.title: Tycoon Real Estate Update | S6

u-lace-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank U-Lace Update

We have great news to share in our U-Lace update! Tim’s company is still in business, with an estimated annual revenue of $2 million. Following the show, Target, Amazon, and even convenience store 7-11 sold the laces. In 2018, Tim was able to buy back the company’s equity from Mark, something that rarely happens.  You can get your very own set on the U-Lace website, or on Amazon.
u-lace-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: U-Lace Update | S5

umano-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Umano Update

Jonathan and Alex got a boost from appearing on the show. Directly after the show aired, they sold more shirts than ever before. However, our Umano update research turned over some bad news.

In March 2017, they decided to shut down the brand and stop selling all clothing items. The brothers each started a business after Umano was shut down. They hope to create a more significant social impact than Umano through other companies.

This will be our final Umano update.
umano-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Umano Update | S7

uncle-zips-beef-jerky-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Uncle Zip's Beef Jerky Update

Our Uncle Zip’s Beef Jerky update reveals that the company benefited from its appearance on Shark Tank. Orders piled up and the business recovered. In 2023, the company does between $500,000 and $1 million in annual revenue.

Unfortunately, Ken passed away in 2014. Since then, the business was taken over by his friend, who has kept it going.

You can find the jerky options on the Uncle Zip’s Beef Jerky website. They also have a Jerky Club, if you'd like to receive monthly deliveries.

If we get any more news on an Uncle Zip's Beef Jerky update, we will let you know!
uncle-zips-beef-jerky-update-shark-tank-.title: Uncle Zip's Beef Jerky Update | S2

underease-underwear-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Underease Underwear Update

Shortly after its episode airing in 2009, the business received a significant media boost, propelling sales online and through direct sales.

However, our Underease Underwear update research found that the company is no longer in business.

After two decades of operation, the Weimers announced its closure in July 2021 due to financial challenges.

In a statement on its website, the company expressed gratitude to its loyal customers for their support over the years.

The decision to close was driven by sustained financial losses, making it unfeasible to continue operations.

This will be our final Underease Underwear update.
underease-underwear-update-shark-tank-se.title: Underease Underwear Update | S1

unikey-technologies-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank UniKey Technologies Update

Our UniKey Technologies update reveals that the deal with the sharks never materialized, but Phil eventually got another investor on board, for more money and less equity.

The business thrived after the Shark Tank appearance, and continues to operate today, to the tune of around $5,5 million in annual revenue.

UniKey has partnered with Honeywell, Kwikset, Baldwin, and many other big players in the doors and locks industry, who use their technology.

You can check out the products on the UniKey Technologies website.
unikey-technologies-update-shark-tank-se.title: UniKey Technologies Update | S3

unpack-delivery-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank unPack Delivery Update

Our unPack Delivery update found that by the end of 2017, the business had quietly shut down operations, and its social media channels had been inactive since the year the episode aired.

By 2021, both Andrew and Aaron had moved on to new ventures.

Aaron shifted to roles in education and legal tech, while Andrew pursued strategic roles in advertising and PR before founding a luxury hand sanitizer brand called Noshinku.

Our unPack update found that the website reappeared in July 2024, but it had devolved into a scammy affiliate site, far removed from its original purpose.

It looks like this will be our final unPack Delivery update.
unpack-delivery-update-shark-tank-season.title: unPack Delivery Update | S8

unshrinkit-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank Unshrinkit Update

There’s a mix of good news and bad news for our Unshrinkit update. While the deal with Mark never came about, the company is still going strong today.

Annual revenue hovers around $2 million with Desiree as the sole CEO. Nate left the company in 2016, but that hasn’t slowed its progress! You can purchase Unshrinkit on their website!
unshrinkit-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: Unshrinkit Update | S7

urban-float-update-shark-tank-season-10.body:
Shark Tank Urban Float Update

Urban Float has managed to grow and stay in business since its appearance on Shark Tank in Season 10. The company regularly hits $1 million in gross revenue annually. The deal with Matt Higgins was never finalized, but the company managed to expand on its franchising business model in the months and years that followed. Their offerings can currently be found on their website.
urban-float-update-shark-tank-season-10.title: Urban Float Update | S10

urbio-vertical-garden-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Urbio Update

Research for our Urbio update revealed good news! In 2015, Urbio acquired Sabi Space, a company focused on designing bathrooms and kitchens, from Sabi, Inc. for an undisclosed amount. In 2016, a company called Honey-Can-Do International purchased Urbio, rebranded it, and renamed it to Perch. Perch remains available in 2023 on Amazon, and various other retail stores.
urbio-vertical-garden-update-season-4.title: Urbio Update | S4

valpark-mobile-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank ValPark Mobile Update

Unfortunately, Wayne did not find success with ValPark Mobile. While researching the company, we were unable to find anything about the company past 2015.

Wayne closed the company and now owns a few bars and nightclubs in the Washington area.  This will be our final ValPark Mobile update.
valpark-mobile-update-shark-tank-season-.title: ValPark Mobile Update | S7

vegas-magic-show-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank Vegas Magic Show Update

Our Vegas Magic Show update reveals that Rick continues to be a successful magician, but his Vegas dreams have not taken off yet. It seems that his appearance in the tank showed him the risk involved with trying to make it work.

That said, he's gone on to appear on America's Got Talent, Ripley's Believe It Or Not, and more. In 2022, he had over 700 performances, so we certainly think it's safe to say, that Rick is doing just fine in the business!

Check out all that he offers on the Rick Smith Jr. website.
vegas-magic-show-shark-tank-season-3.title: Vegas Magic Show update | S3

veggie-mama-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank Veggie Mama Update

We have some interesting news to share in our Veggie Mama update! It looks as though the company may have run out of steam about five years after their 2013 Shark Tank appearance. While the Veggie Mama website is still up, it is outdated and  states that they aren't currently selling products online. Given the mixed information available online, it's unclear whether the company is still in business.
veggie-mama-shark-tank-season-5.title: Veggie Mama Update | S5

velocity-signs-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Velocity Signs Update

Our research revealed that after the episode aired, the company went on to earn $3 million the following year. Despite having an investment from Mark, Kevin, and Robert– and with a high-profile clientele that included Ford Motor Company, McDonalds, Dominos, and other household names, the company went out of business in 2019. This will be our final Velocity Signs update.
velocity-signs-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Velocity Signs Update | S5

vengo-smart-vending-machines-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank Vengo Update

After leaving the Shark Tank, Steven and Brian’s deal with the sharks didn’t end up happening. Despite this, our Vengo update shows that it has gone on to become a success story through the years, following several huge contracts with the likes of Hyatt Hotels and Blackstone Launchpad.

Vengo now has over 1,500 machines and has has an estimated annual revenue of over $10 million. Learn more about Vengo on the company’s website.
vengo-smart-vending-machines-update-shar.title: Vengo Update | S7

verbalizeit-translation-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank VerbalizeIt Update

We have good news to share in our VerbalizeIt update! While the deal with Kevin never closed, Ryan and Kunal received the funding through another investor and grew the business from there. They expanded their services from just conversation to documents, videos, websites, and app translation services. In 2016, Smartling, a cloud-based translation company, purchased the company for an undisclosed amount. VerbalizeIt, now owned by Smartling, remains in business as of 2023.
verbalizeit-translation-update-season-4.title: VerbalizeIt Update | S4

vestpakz-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Vestpakz Update

It's sad news to report for Michael and Arthur's company. Research for our Vestpakz update revealed that the company went out of business shortly after appearing on Shark Tank. The sharks were ultimately correct that this product was not in demand and that justified their reasoning for not making an offer in the first place. This will be our final Vestpakz update.
vestpakz-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: VestPakz Update | S6

vibes-earplugs-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Vibes Update

Our Vibes update found that the company experienced a huge surge in demand, selling out their entire inventory just days after the episode aired.

By 2017, the company expanded its focus beyond concertgoers and began serving people with sensory processing disorders, including those with autism.

Sales skyrocketed, reaching $2 million in 2018, a huge jump from just $33,000 the previous year.

That same year, Vibes teamed up with the Hear the World Foundation, donating $2 from every sale to help children with hearing loss.

By 2021, the price of Vibes earplugs dropped to $19, but by July 2024, our Vibes update research found that it had risen to $28.95 due to inflation and demand.

At the time of writing, you can find Vibes products at major retailers like Walmart, Guitar Center, Sam Ash, Amazon, and the Vibes website, with lifetime revenue hitting $12 million by August 2024.

We’re calling this Vibes update a success and can't wait to see what the future has in store.
vibes-earplugs-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Vibes Earplugs Update | S8

victorias-kitchen-almond-water-update-sh.body:
Shark Tank Victoria’s Kitchen Update

Our Victoria's Kitchen update reveals some mixed news. It turns out the brand was acquired by an International company for an unknown amount. Deborah and David have apparently moved on from their passion for almond water. This will be our final Victoria's Kitchen update.
victorias-kitchen-almond-water-update-sh.title: Victoria's Kitchen Update | S6

victory-coffees-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank Victory Coffees Update

Our Victory Coffees update found that shortly after airing, the company had hit $1 million in sales, showing just how much the show's exposure helped.

In 2017, he launched an initiative to provide coffee to VA hospitals, though a long-term partnership didn’t come together as Starbucks held the contract.

By 2018, the brand expanded its product line, introducing the Victory Canteen, a stainless steel insulated cup, alongside its popular coffee blends, Leatherneck and Admiral.

Our Victory Coffees update found that Cade launched the Victory Challenge in April 2023, encouraging people to check in on veterans while enjoying a cup of coffee.

He continues to juggle his media appearances, podcasts, and other ventures

However, Victory Coffees is still a key focus, as Cade regularly promotes the brand in interviews and on his social platforms.

We can't wait to bring you another exciting Victory Coffees update.
victory-coffees-update-shark-tank-season.title: Victory Coffees Update | Shark Tank S8

viewsport-sweat-activated-workout-shirts.body:
Shark Tank ViewSport Update

Our ViewSport update reveals that the company finally made it, despite the sharks’ wariness. After a triumphant $6.9 million contract with the US Army, ViewSport continues to be in business today.

ViewSport is also the 2023 official supplier partner of Ironman.

You can check out the sweat-activated fitness apparel technology on the ViewSport website. Since appearing on the show, Ben has vastly expanded the product line to include all types of apparel, not just shirts.

If we learn anything new about this company, we will certainly let you know. In the meantime, you can check out our other company updates from Season 3 Episode 11 by following the links below.
viewsport-sweat-activated-workout-shirts.title: ViewSport Update | S3

village-scholarships-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Village Scholarships Update

Unfortunately, we’ve got some bad news for Village Scholarships. The company went under due to a lack of any type of solid business plan. Research for our Village Scholarship update revealed that the website is dark and the social media accounts haven’t been updated in quite a while.

It looks like those looking to crowdfund their education will have to look to other platforms. This will be our final Village Scholarships update.
village-scholarships-update-shark-tank-s.title: Village Scholarships Update | S7

villy-custom-bicycles-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Villy Custom Update

Our Villy Custom update shows that the deal with Mark and Barbara came through, and contributed to the ongoing success of the company.

Villy Custom continues to be in operation, making between $3-4 million in annual revenue. Check out these fashionable cruiser bikes on the Villy Custom website.
villy-custom-bicycles-update-shark-tank-.title: Villy Custom Update | S3

virtuix-omni-virtual-reality-treadmill-u.body:
Shark Tank Virtuix Omni Update

We have interesting news to report for our Virtuix Omni update. In the years since his pitch, Jan went on to raise more than $20 million, and has shipped over $10 million of product, all over the world. Products are available on the Virtuix Omni website, and you can even preview it for yourself at Dave & Buster's.
virtuix-omni-virtual-reality-treadmill-u.title: Virtuix Omni Update | S5

virtusphere-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank VirtuSphere Update

Our research on the VirtuSphere update revealed that the company is still in business but has yet to enter the mainstream market.

Moreover, it found success in niche areas, selling its VR simulators to clients such as the U.S. Army medical center, a naval research base, and universities in the U.S., Germany, Russia, Switzerland, and the UK.

In August 2013, our VirtuSphere update found that they launched a Kickstarter campaign to raise $100,000 for a virtual reality headset called 360specs.

Unfortunately, the campaign fell short, raising less than 4% of its initial goal.

However, according to our VirtuSphere update, the company's lifetime sales revenue is $3 million as of this writing.

It will be interesting to see what our next VirtuSphere update brings.
virtusphere-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: VirtuSphere Update | S1

voyage-air-guitar-update-shark-tank-seas.body:
Shark Tank Voyage Air Guitar Update

Our research on the Voyage Air Guitar update found that the company received an update segment in Season 2, during which they revealed their launch in 200 retail stores nationwide.

In Season 3, the company returned to Shark Tank, leading to a partnership with Kevin O'Leary, which was finalized in Season 4.

Kevin helped the company secure a licensing agreement with Fender, one of the world's largest guitar makers.

Despite a complex deal in Season 3 that never aired, Jeff considers it their biggest achievement. The partnership with Fender included a market test of a limited run of Fender Voyage Air Guitars.

Today, our Voyage Air Guitar update found that the company thrives, offering a diverse line of high-quality, foldable guitars.

Their products are available on their well-maintained website and Amazon, and they generally receive good reviews.

The company has grown to around $1 million in annual revenue.

We are calling this Voyage Air Guitar update a success.
voyage-air-guitar-update-shark-tank-seas.title: Voyage Air Guitar Update | S1

vpcabs-virtual-pinball-update-shark-tank.body:
Shark Tank VPcabs Update

Our VPcabs update reveals that Daymond considers this one of his best investments made during the show. VPcabs has been thriving since appearing on the show after Brad partnered with Wizard World Comic Cons and the Michael J Fox Foundation.

The company’s annual revenue is between $3 and $5 million. You can check out the machines available on the VPcabs website.
vpcabs-virtual-pinball-update-shark-tank.title: VPcabs Update | S7

vurtego-pogo-sticks-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Vurtego Update

Our Vurtego update reveals great news, as the company is still in business and does around $1 million in annual revenue.

Their V4 and V4Pro models come in small, medium, and large, based on the height of the user. The Vurtego website, where they're available for sale, says the V4Pro can jump as high as 10 feet! Vurtego pogo sticks are also available on Amazon.

Further, our Vurtego update research found that Spencer was able to raise over $100,000 for the V4 model via IndieGoGo in 2015. Then, in 2023, he was able to raise over $40,000 for a new product called the SlingShot that allows you to jump over 5 feet high.
vurtego-pogo-sticks-update-shark-tank-se.title: Vurtego Update | S2

waivecar-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank WaiveCar Update

The deal with Mr. Wonderful eventually closed, and Kevin even promoted the company on his website. Shortly after the episode aired, WaiveCar deployed a fleet of vehicles for use on the campus of Cal State LA and the surrounding area.

Unfortunately, WaiveCar's social media went silent in October 2019. In early 2020, an insurance issue forced the Cal State LA program to shut down.

While temporary signs indicated the service would resume, it never did. This coincided with the university's closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Zoli Honig and Isaac Deutsch then launched a new venture called WaiveWork, offering electric car rentals for a weekly fee.

However, they attempted to use the same inactive social media accounts for this new business.

In March 2020, Zoli joined REEF, a company focused on electric vehicle solutions, followed by Isaac in December 2020.

By December 2021, our WaiveCare update found that REEF acquired WaiveWork for an undisclosed amount.

In September 2022, the WaiveCar website no longer function, and the domain is being redirected to REEF DRIVE, a similar electric car-sharing program offered by REEF.

Notably, both Zoli Honig and Isaac Deutsch continue to work at REEF.

It looks like this will be our final Shark Tank WaiveCar update.
waivecar-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: WaiveCar Update | S9

wake-n-bacon-alarm-clock-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank Wake N’ Bacon Update

Our Wake n’ Bacon update reveals that Matty did not manage to get the company off the ground and never came to fruition. There is no social media presence for Wake n’ Bacon, nor any mention of it on a website.

This will be our final Wake n’ Bacon update.
wake-n-bacon-alarm-clock-update-shark-ta.title: Wake n' Bacon Update | S2

wallet-buckle-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Wallet Buckle Update

Our Wallet Buckle update found that despite leaving Shark Tank without a deal, the company has continued to thrive, maintaining a steady presence in the market.

Next, they expanded their business by securing licensing deals with major leagues, including the NCAA, NFL, MLB, and NBA.

This move allowed them to reach a broader audience by offering sports-themed designs that appeal to fans nationwide.

At the time of writing, Wallet Buckle has grown to around $3 million in annual revenue.

Additionally, the brand remains active on social media, where it maintains engagement with its core audience, especially among country and Southern lifestyle fans.

It's great to see that Trevor and Justin's situation worked out well, and we hope that our next Wallet Buckle update will be even better.
wallet-buckle-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Wallet Buckle Update | S8

washed-up-hollywood-belts-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Washed Up Hollywood Update

Our Washed Up Hollywood research update found that the company experienced a period of strong growth shortly after its episode aired.

As a result, in its first two years of operation, the company successfully expanded to over 300 retail stores and online platforms, generating more than $400,000 in sales.

Unfortunately, the company's success was short-lived.

Due to high product costs and an inability to scale manufacturing, its valuation failed to align with its revenue, and it went out of business in 2010.

Despite having some initial success, it looks like this will be our final Washed Up Hollywood update.
washed-up-hollywood-belts-update-shark-t.title: Washed Up Hollywood Update | S1

wedding-wagon-update-shark-tank-season-6.body:
Shark Tank Wedding Wagon Update

Research for our Wedding Wagon update revealed that the company is still operating in Las Vegas, but not a whole lot has changed since their appearance on the show. Wedding Wagon is estimated to be generating between $1 and $2 million per year in gross revenue.

While there isn't a lot to report in our Wedding Wagon update, it's nice to know that the company is still in business years after airing on Shark Tank Season 6.
wedding-wagon-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Wedding Wagon Update | S6

wee-can-shop-kids-store-update-shark-tan.body:
Shark Tank Wee Can Shop Update

After its episode aired, our Wee Can Shop update found that the company expanded its product line to include clothing, accessories, and educational materials, hoping to attract a broader audience.

In addition, they also improved their online presence with a revamped website and stronger social media engagement, which temporarily boosted sales.

However, the business struggled to maintain profitability.

Our Wee Can Shop update found that despite its best efforts, the company went out of business in 2012 due to ongoing financial difficulties.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Wee Can Shop update.
wee-can-shop-kids-store-update-shark-tan.title: Wee Can Shop Update | S1

wicked-good-cupcakes-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Wicked Good Cupcakes Update

After securing the deal with Kevin, Wicked Good Cupcakes next secured a 15,000 square foot commercial baking facility to run operations from. They opened a second location in Faneuil Hall, and then a third in South Shore Plaza Mall. Before long, Kevin’s investment was paid back and the business was cruising toward $2 million in sales.

We have great news to share int our Wicked Good Cupcakes update! In a season 7 update segment, the Noonans revealed they had succeeded in hitting $5.5 million in lifetime sales. Since then, the company went on to exceed $40 million in lifetime sales, and Mr. Wonderful earned more than $1 million in royalties. In 2021, Hickory Farms approached Wicked Good Cupcakes, offering a “multi-million dollar buyout,” a deal which the Noonans accepted. We’re not sure what Tracey and Danielle are up to today, but we know they are millionaires and Wicked Good Cupcakes are still sold today.
wicked-good-cupcakes-update-season-4.title: Wicked Good Cupcakes Update | S4

wild-squirrel-nut-butter-update-shark-ta.body:
Shark Tank Wild Squirrel Nut Butter Update

Our Wild Squirrel Nut Butter shows that the company thrived after the appearance on Shark Tank. Keeley and Erika had so much success, that they decided to not go through with Barbara’s deal after all.

They rebranded in 2016 to Wild Friends, after a lawsuit regarding the company name.

The products are now present in numerous national supermarkets. You can also find the delicious peanut butter options on the Wild Friends  website, and also on Amazon.
wild-squirrel-nut-butter-update-shark-ta.title: Wild Squirrel Nut Butter Update | S3

windcatcher-air-pad-update-shark-tank-se.body:
Shark Tank Windcatcher Update

It’s sad news for Windcatcher. During research for our Windcatcher update, we learned that the deal with Lori never closed.

Similar products on the market led to litigation, which dashed any dreams of a deal. Sadly, Ryan passed away from pancreatic cancer in 2018 and the company never recovered. The website is no longer available and the company is effectively out of business.

This will be our final Windcatcher update.
windcatcher-air-pad-update-shark-tank-se.title: Windcatcher Update | S7

wine-balloon-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank Wine Balloon Update

Our Wine Balloon update shows that Eric ultimately backed out of the deal, before signing with Lori and Mark. He retained control of his company, and his success soared.

After appearing on another similar show, Eric rebranded the business as Air Cork and got distribution. The company is still operating, and making around $7 million in annual revenue.

You can find the product on the Air Cork website. The product is also available on Amazon.
wine-balloon-shark-tank-season-3.title: Wine Balloon update | S3

wine-design-update-shark-tank-season-8.body:
Shark Tank Wine & Design Update

Our Wine & Design update reveals that the deal with Kevin O'Leary was successfully finalized.

Following their Shark Tank appearance, the company expanded rapidly.

Thus, by December 2019, they had opened their 82nd studio in Raleigh, North Carolina, with Kevin O'Leary attending the grand opening.

According to our research, we did not find any specific annual sales figures. However, Wine & Design has reported consistent revenue growth between 35% and 47% annually since 2011.

At the time of writing, our research into the Wine & Design update found that the company has now grown to over 80 franchise locations across the United States.

We are calling this Wine & Design update a success.
wine-design-update-shark-tank-season-8.title: Wine & Design Update | S8

wink-frozen-desserts-update-shark-tank-s.body:
Shark Tank Wink Frozen Desserts Update

Unfortunately, there’s bad news in our Wink Frozen Desserts. While the company had some great deals with Whole Foods, it ultimately shut down in January of 2020. You can no longer find Wink at any retail locations, and the website no longer functions.

This will be our final Wink Frozen Desserts update.
wink-frozen-desserts-update-shark-tank-s.title: Wink Frozen Desserts Update | S7

wired-waffles-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Wired Waffles Update

At first, things looked up for Roger. When the episode aired, everyone wanted to taste the waffle firsthand. Luckily, Roger took the shark’s advice, adjusting the recipe to make it tastier.

In our Wired Waffles update, we found that the exposure brought a deal with a private investor. But in 2015, the company went out of business for unknown reasons.

This will be our final Wired Waffles update.
wired-waffles-update-season-4.title: Wired Waffles Update | S4

wispots-update-shark-tank-season-1.body:
Shark Tank Wispots Update

Shortly after airing on Shark Tank, our Wispots update found that Kevin did all he could to scale his business but ultimately failed to achieve significant success.

However, his efforts did garner interest from several sales and distribution companies wanting to market Wispots' patient interaction center.

After numerous rebrandings and concept changes, Kevin decided to shut down Wispots and started a new venture, WiFiciency.

Our Wispots update found that Kevin's new venture, WiFiciency, offered additional products for healthcare facilities, leading to a merger with Worthington Healthcare Corporation.

At the time of writing, WiFiciency is now AIRwave Medical Solutions Inc. and is under new ownership. It appears that Kevin sold his company.

We will be sure to let you know if we get another Wispots update.
wispots-update-shark-tank-season-1.title: Wispots Update | S1

wondercide-bug-repellant-for-pets-update.body:
Shark Tank Wondercide Update

Since appearing on Shark Tank, Wondercide has continued to be a success. We reached out to Stephanie to get a more detailed Wondercide update and she shared that after the episode aired, she decided to turn down Lori's offer.

"We actually didn't finalize the deal with Lori and we weren't able to share that for some time," Stephanie told Shark Tank Recap.

"You only have a few moments to think about the offer and make a decision. Afterward, when I had more time to reflect and think about how I wanted to manage the business, I realized we had to walk away," Stephanie told us.

Despite not taking the deal, we still have great news for our Wondercide update. Stephanie shared that sales increased every year since Shark Tank and whenever the episode airs they receive a big boost in sales.

Stephanie told us, "To this day, after Shark Tank re-airs, we see a spike in business."

A wealth of products in many sizes and options are available on the Wondercide website as well as on Amazon.
wondercide-bug-repellant-for-pets-update.title: Wondercide Update | S7

world-record-striper-company-update-shar.body:
Shark Tank World Record Striper Company Update

We have some interesting news to share in our World Record Striper Company update. The company website appears to be down, however the Facebook page was active as recently as November 2022. Products are available on Amazon and other various retailers.
world-record-striper-company-update-shar.title: World Record Striper Company Update | S6

wurkin-stiffs-collar-stay-update-shark-t.body:
Shark Tank Wurkin Stiffs Update

Our Wurkin Stiffs update shows that while the deal did not go through as stated on Shark Tank, Jonathan and Daymond stayed in touch through the years. Jonathan did end up benefiting from Daymond’s expertise after all, and Wurkin Stiffs is now worth over $16 million.

In fact, the company has grown so much that it has become one of Shark Tank Season 2's most successful products.

Since airing on Shark Tank, Wurkin Stiffs has expanded its product line to include a variety of men's business attire accessories, that will keep you looking sharp throughout the day.

Check out their products on the Wurkin Stiffs website, and on Amazon.
wurkin-stiffs-collar-stay-update-shark-t.title: Wurkin Stiffs Update | S2

wyp-aviation-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Wyp Aviation Update

Unfortunately, we don't have good news regarding our WYP Aviation update. Our research suggests the business has made little progress since its Shark Tank appearance.

The reason for WYP Aviation going out of business seems to be related to Aaron's son being diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer at that time.

Aaron mentioned that WYP Aviation was a family company, with him leading affairs and his wife coordinating activities behind the scenes. He also stated that their focus at the time shifted to helping their son fight the disease with the amazing support of St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

Even more concerning is that we found that the business website is currently out of service. Moreover, all their social accounts haven't been updated since their Shark Tank episode aired in 2017.

Additionally, It also doesn't seem like Aaron has invented any other products since then. It looks like this will be our final Wyp Aviation update.
wyp-aviation-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: WYP Aviation Update | S9

xcraft-update-shark-tank-season-7.body:
Shark Tank XCraft Update

After this explosive episode, you’d hope that XCraft was doing well! Unfortunately, it looks like the deal with all five sharks never closed. However, our XCraft update research found that airing the episode caused their website to crash. They started a Kickstarter right after the show aired, and raised about $170,000. In 2018, they raised over $1 million on a StartEngine funding campaign.

Since then, they’ve gone for more funding rounds. XCraft’s Start Engine page says that they have crowdfunded at least $4,445,000 in total.

The company is still alive and kicking despite the failed deal. New models have expanded the appeal of the company, and they are apparently in talks with the Department of Defense. Before these negotiations, they have annual sales of about $5 million. You can check up on XCraft on their website.
xcraft-update-shark-tank-season-7.title: XCraft Update | S7

xero-shoes-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Xero Shoes Update

We have impressive news to share in our Xero Shoes update! Within seven days of the episode airing, Xero Shoes sold 20% of their total revenue from the previous year, causing a number of website crashes due to an overwhelming surge in traffic. Then, in December 2020, Steven and Lena formed a strategic partnership with TZP Group, a private equity firm. Xero Shoes went on to be featured in the 2021 Tokyo Summer Olympics, and as of 2023, the estimated worth of Xero Shoes is $23 million.
xero-shoes-update-season-4.title: Xero Shoes Update | S4

yardsale-update-shark-tank-season-16.body:
Shark Tank Yardsale Update

Our Yardsale update found that the company caught the attention of major outlets like Harper's Bazaar and Forbes.

Moreover, their hard work and attention to detail also paid off mid-year when the P1 Poles earned the Core77 Design Award.

Yardsale partnered with Halfdays to launch limited-edition pink P1 ski poles.

Additionally, the brand has expanded its offerings further with the FW 24 Collection, introducing the P2 poles and Mini P1 poles.

Our research into the Yardsale update found that their product range now includes apparel, like the Men's Chain Stitch Crewneck and Wool Logo Hat.

Their social media activity has tripled since their Shark Tank appearance. More people are now sharing product updates, stories, and ski adventures.

Their social reach is still under 10,000 followers. However, we expect that number to grow steadily as their Shark Tank exposure continues to draw more attention.

We can't wait for the next Yardsale update.
yardsale-update-shark-tank-season-16.title: Yardsale Update | S16

you-kick-ass-personalized-action-figures.body:
Shark Tank You Kick Ass Update

Our You Kick Ass update is somewhat disappointing, because Mark Cuban never finalized his deal. Sadly, the company eventually went out of business a little over a year after filming. This will be our final You Kick Ass update.
you-kick-ass-personalized-action-figures.title: You Kick Ass Update | S6

you-smell-soap-shark-tank-season-3.body:
Shark Tank You Smell Soap Update

Our You Smell Soap update reveals that the deal with Robert was never finalized. He attempted to make another offer for 50% of the company, but that was not in the cards for Megan.

After spending some time working full-time on the product, she sold the company. However, the products are no longer available.

This will be our final You Smell Soap update.
you-smell-soap-shark-tank-season-3.title: You Smell Soap Update | S3

yubo-lunchboxes-update-shark-tank-season.body:
Shark Tank YUBO Update

Our YUBO update research finds that the company is no longer in business. Five years after appearing on Shark Tank, Cyndi posted a message on the company’s social media pages stating that the family was moving on to new ventures, ceasing operations in 2019. This will be our final YUBO update.
yubo-lunchboxes-update-shark-tank-season.title: YUBO Update | S5

zero-pollution-motors-update-shark-tank-.body:
Shark Tank Zero Pollution Motors Update

We have mixed news to report in our Zero Pollution Motors update. The contingency that Robert required for his deal to be finalized didn't happen, which forced him to withdraw his offer. However, the company is still in business and seems to be taking order for their AirPod cars. The Zero Pollution Motors website states that they will be producing the first compressed air-powered car for sale in the United States by mid-2024.
zero-pollution-motors-update-shark-tank-.title: Zero Pollution Motors Update | S6

zinepak-celebrity-merchandise-update-sha.body:
Shark Tank ZinePak Update

Our ZinePak update is somewhat interesting. The company is still in business but has rebranded and changed their name to Bright Ideas Only. It appears that Brittany has stepped down from the company, but Kim continues to operate it. The company is still estimated to generate more than $3 million in revenue and has an ever growing list of celebrity clients. You can find out more on the Bright Ideas Only website.
zinepak-celebrity-merchandise-update-sha.title: ZinePak Update | S6

zipit-bedding-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank Zipit Bedding Update

We have mixed news to report for our Zipit Bedding update. There is no longer an official company website, and the last posts to the company’s social media pages were in June 2021. The product is still available on Amazon, but it’s being sold by third-party sellers. We think it is safe to say that the company is no longer operational.
zipit-bedding-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: Zipit Bedding Update | S5

zipz-update-shark-tank-season-6.body: You will be excited to learn that Zipz is still in business! Research for our Zipz update revealed that the company is still running as an organization that licenses its packaging technology, though an online presence seems to be absent. They don’t produce their own branded wine any longer and stopped doing so back in 2017. Kevin continues to help find new licensing opportunities for Zipz as they become available.
zipz-update-shark-tank-season-6.title: Zipz Update | S6

zomm-alarm-device-update-season-4.body:
Shark Tank Zomm Update

Immediately after airing, Zomm’s sales exploded, helping Henry work through that $2 million in overhead he had amassed.

In addition, during our Zomm update research, we found that the product line expanded to include the Lifestyle Connect and a Wireless Leash for cellphones.

Despite this, Zomm went out of business in 2018. Henry would go on to become the CEO of Soaak Technologies, which provides online services in the mental health and wellness space.

This will be our final Zomm update.
zomm-alarm-device-update-season-4.title: Zomm Update | S4

zoobean-books-update-shark-tank-season-5.body:
Shark Tank Zoobean Update

We have great news to share in our Zoobean update! We’re happy to report that the company is still in business, and in 2022, they hit $2.4 million in revenue. The company’s technology has adapted to accommodate the changing market, and they named their new technology Beanstack. Today, Beanstack boasts 8.9 million young readers, and the platform is used by 2,400 library systems and 3,000 schools.
zoobean-books-update-shark-tank-season-5.title: Zoobean Update | S5

zoom-interiors-update-shark-tank-season-.body:
Shark Tank Zoom Interiors Update

We have sad news to share in our Zoom Interiors update. Unfortunately the deal with Barbara was never finalized, and the company would ultimately be rebranded before going out of business a few years later. This will be our final Zoom Interiors update.
zoom-interiors-update-shark-tank-season-.title: Zoom Interiors Update | S6

zorpads-update-shark-tank-season-10.body:
Shark Tank Zorpads Update

The company is earning about $4 million in gross revenue sales per year and continues to be successful on Amazon’s marketplace. It seems like Taylor and Sierra have their company growing in the right direction, many years after their initial appearance on Shark Tank during Season 10.
zorpads-update-shark-tank-season-10.title: Zorpads Shoe Odor Remover Update | S10

zup-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank ZUP Update

Despite not securing a deal on Shark Tank, ZUP is still in business and operational.

Shortly after their appearance on the show, ZUP saw a 4,000% increase in website traffic and a surge in sales.

In August 2018, our ZUP update found that they faced a patent lawsuit with NASH, a company with which they had initially discussed potential collaboration under a non-disclosure agreement.

Despite these legal challenges, ZUP continued to operate, and their products on Amazon have received thousands of positive customer reviews.

According to our ZUP update research, they have expanded their product line. New products include Multi-sport Boards, Tubes, Wakesurf, Kneeboards, Mats, Paddles, Accessories, and Life Jackets.

Contrary to the sharks' predictions that they would eventually go out of business, ZUP continues to thrive and serve satisfied customers.

Their journey shows resilience, and it will be interesting to see where our next ZUP update takes us.
zup-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: ZUP Update | S9

zuvaa-update-shark-tank-season-9.body:
Shark Tank Zuvaa Update

Our Zuvaa update research revealed that the business shut down before its original air date on January 21, 2018.

However, in February 2020, Kelechi rebranded her business to Uju Media with plans to relaunch in 2021.

By June 2021, the new website was live, but revenue information was unavailable.

Later in November 2022, Uju Media promoted three clothing brands, adding a home decor brand by February 2023.

At the time of writing, the company's website and social media presence are inactive, although the business still has an active store on Tumblr.

Despite a brief revival, Zuvaa appears to have officially gone out of business around 2019.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Zuvaa update.
zuvaa-update-shark-tank-season-9.title: Zuvaa Update | S9
